description:
Wow! This was really good :)

I was walking around the food court trying to decide what to have for dinner and they had an employee providing samples. The sample sold me. I ordered the tri tip flatbread salad to go. As I was walking out I couldn't help but notice the different types of bbq sauce, so I grabbed a few containers of the various kinds and decided to sit and enjoy my food. 

It was so flavorful, the meat was really tender and fresh! I loved every bite even though I couldn't finish the flatbread that came with it. You have to give this place a try.
author: Genevieve K.

description:
I came here with a friend during lunch time and we had many options in the food court to pick from, but this place piqued our interest.

I ordered the Cabo Chop with salmon and I believe the portion was huge compared to what most places do for salads. The salmon was lightly seasoned and was not too undercooked nor over cooked. It was just right. However, the crunchy tortilla bowl was very brittle and I expected something with a more crunch factor to it and the dressing didn't seem to compliment the salad and salmon that well. Maybe my experience would have different for the tri-tip too. Overall, food was decent, but I've definitely had better, but if you're out shopping and just need a bite to eat, then this place isn't too bad of an option to pick from!
author: Alex D. N.

description:
Food: 3/5
Service: 3/5
Ambiance: 3/5
Overall: One of the food court options.  Not bad but the portions are a little on the smaller side.

The extended review...

Food:

Bacon Cheddar Buck - I mean you really can't go wrong with tri tip topped with bacon and cheddar.  Well then again your heart may say otherwise.  The tri tip was decently cooked but of course this is a fast food place.

Service: Friendly service.

Ambiance: Well the mall is a little hit or miss and not the best experience given the homeless population coming in and pan handling.
author: Spencer Q.

description: Omg! Okay so I got the tri tip burger and it was so delicious my friend got the tri tip salad and he enjoyed it !!!!!!!! Mac and cheese is really good!
author: Gaby C.

description:
FIVE STARS off the top!!! 

The choices are abundant, the tri tip is perfectly seasoned, tender, melt in your mouth deliciousness, dripping with melted cheese and topped off with bacon; oh, wait, that was my sandwich!!

I will likely never get to this place again because I don't like Westfield "mall" but I'll try to find a Buckhorn Grill elsewhere because for "fast food" it was a level of excellence I've never had in a fast food or food court type eatery.

Delicious!!!!  Great service, happy employees.  

Go! NOW, well, okay, not now, they're likely not open this early, but later, today, tomorrow ... any day!!  If you love Tri Tip ... this is the place!
author: Lynnette F.

description:
Taste - ***
Service - ***
Price - ***
Interior - ****

If you like meat, it would be nice to eat it simply and quickly. 
I ordered a hamburger and a house salad. 
The hamburger patty was very delicious. The other bread and vegetables in the hamburger were not bad. 
The house salad came with the fried onion into thin slices. The amount was big and taste was not bad. 

I ordered side fried onion and salad, the hamburger set. It cost a l lot than other hamberger shops.
author: Da Won L.

description:
Have been here many times

Have Always order the bacon cheddar buck

Service is nice

A bit salty but everything is really good overall
author: Foodlover B.

description: Excellent triptip....very tender and moist. I was impressed.
author: Sunil R.

description: 11am-2pm meals are made within FIVE MINUTES if not, you'll receive a free meal coupon! This Buckhorn Grill is located inside the food court in the mall!
author: Maddie S.

description: This place is good when you're in the mood for some brisket. There's nothing like this around the area so they take the cake when it comes to this type of food. If you're one of those people who love the rarest type of meat, you gotta ask for it. They will provide you with some the tender pieces upon request. Otherwise you get what you get and don't complain if it's dry or over cooked. My go to is the Caesar pleaser. Comes with 2 slabs of beef brisket, caeser salad, and corn muffin. It's a lot of food for me so I usually share this with my boo or save half for later.
author: Martine D.

description: Solid sandwich! Got the charbroiled chicken sandwich that came with tomato and lettuce. It was a simple sandwich which was quite generous. The chicken was juicy and the ingredients tasted fresh. The staff were really nice! Their other options looked amazing too. It was a yummy place at the food court !
author: Natalie M.

description: be careful when you order Chicken sandwich here. I ordered chicken sandwich and the chicken wasn't fully cook and its disgusting. and I'll be honest i eat it. I just realize it when i was at then i was chewing a fucking rubber chicken. Ugh! the chicken was burn tho but not cook. I gave 1 star because u can get free refill for drinks.
author: Lara J.

description:
Food: 3/5     Price: 4/5      Service: 4/5   Ambience: 4/5

This Buckhorn Grill location is at the food court of Westfield. The lines are not particularly long, but the wait for your food can be quite long. You order, get a buzzer, and pick up at the counter. Lots of selection for meat platters, burgers, sandwiches, flatbread, and salads.

Greek Salad - Crisp romaine tossed with shallot vinaigrette dressing, with cucumbers, tomatoes, red onion, feta cheese, kalamata olives, and crispy pita bread. I loved the romaine lettuce which was super fresh. The portion size was huge and will definitely leave you full. All the condiments worked well together. Also loved the deep fried pita bread - warm and delicious!

Favorites:
* Greek Salad ($8.99)
author: Victoria L.

description:
For food court food, this is pretty darn solid. Back in my pre-work-all-the-time days, I'd come to SF with a couple of friends on the weekends, and more often than not, we'd end up here for dinner, sharing the entire tri-tip for $29 and having enough for leftovers.

The meals are still super filling, but the food may leave one desiring a bit more. The clam chowder was pretty standard, but a little on the soupy side. I liked the one at Lord George (well durr, they are at very different price points). The clam chowder at Basa Seafood Express is good too. The veggies were pretty undercooked-- my squash was fairly raw. The tri-tip was good as always, if a bit salty and less meaty flavor than desired. The mashed potatoes here are very dependable and creamy (when are they not). Salads look like the prepackaged kind, so depends on if that's your jam.

Tldr; come here for the value and to be very full.
author: Nicole H.

description:
I got the Roadhouse Salad with Tri-tip (mixed greens with crispy onions, string beans, tomatoes, bleu cheese crumbles & walnuts tossed w/honey basil vinaigrette) and it was great! Very hearty and filling. I loved the mix of sweet and savory.

A few comments

Serving: The salad is huge! It's about 2.5x size of a typical salad you are probably familiar with getting at lunch. I felt legitimately full eating half of it. It's a meal!

Price: For a salad of this quality (steak, cheese, onions) and size, $13 feels appropriate, if not a bargain. 

I will definitely order this salad again and keep Buckhorn in mind for futures lunches (and dinners)
author: Josh M.

description:
All of the food court restaurants have displays of their food, so it's a really good idea to walk around and take a look before you commit to the place where you'll eat for lunch or whatever. 
But personally, Buckhorn had the best display of their food...and naturally you eat with your eyes before your mouth. 

My husband and I shared the cobb salad in a taco shell and my husband had the steak wrap. The salad was humongous!! But I was starving, so I pretty much finished it. There was such a great variety of vegetables (corn, beans, guac, radish, etc) in there and in large amounts as well to where there was no overpowering of either veggies sides or lettuce. The vinaigrette paired along with it was very tasty as well. I think my favorite part was the taco shell...it was so crispy and flaky like a pastry and it held it's shape really well up until I was done and it never really got too soggy. 

The steak wrap burrito was really good as well. The steak was tender and it just melted into your mouth. These were big as well since my husband was full after completing his meal. I wish we had  this place in TX. I will definitely be back the next time we come and visit.
author: Gloria C.

description:
Everything here might look a tad spendy, but rest assured you're probably going to get huge portions to match. Even the basic tri tip platter is quite generous (8 ounces of beef) as it is. If you're a shamless glutton like me, go all in for the Dad's cut (12 ounces). And as if the meat wasn't already enough in their platters, they also come with nicely sized sides like mashed potatoes and roasted vegetables. 

Service is rather mechanical, as it's a walk-up-and-order sort of place, but of all the choices you have here in the basement of the Westfield, this is indeed one of the better ones. Worth a shot if you're already here and hungry.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I come here... a lot. Way more than I should especially with how expensive everything is... but I am obsessed with their salads. I used to get the Krispy Chicken Avocado (sometimes add tri-tip, definitely extra dressing) but I've converted to getting the Cabo chopped (no beans, add crispy chicken, add tri-tip, extra dressing). Adding double meat gets the salad to around... $17.50 but this place has Yelp cash back and if you check in on Yelp you get a dollar off. Every Buckhorn also has a rewards program but they're specific to the location... which is kind of sad and it's a fairly archaic system, you have to tell them your phone number each time.

The lime dressing they put on the salad is out of this world, I've been scouring the internet trying to find a copycat recipe but I've yet to succeed. 

The staff here is super nice. The only thing I would caution anyone getting to go and not eating at the mall is to check your order... thoroughly. There's been a few times where I've gotten home and realized that they either 1. didn't put meat in my salad or 2. was missing one of the meats I've paid for... (this is where I took a star off) but despite that I still come back because the salads are just so darn good.
author: Judy H.

description:
So I can only speak for the crispy chicken &avocado salad cause this is the only thing I ever get here. I love it! It's so good. I wish they gave a few more pieces of chicken, but what can you do? 

This time around, I ordered the same exact thing to-go and I brought it home to eat. I ate about 1/2 of it and that's when I noticed a ladybug on one of the leaves. I know this probably happens a lot more often than people notice &it's just a little bug, but it definitely still made me lose my appetite. 

Since it was a ladybug...will I get good luck...? Lol
author: Sabrina S.

description:
San Francisco Centre food court is better than most out there. Buckhorn Grill is a prime example of that. I had the tri-tip sandwich with no grilled onions but yes to the au jus. It was really tasty. I was actually surprised how much I liked it. The bread roll was soft, the tri-tip was tender and smoky... and the au jus tasted great. It was a good-sized sandwich. We were hungry and had just walked from the Palace Hotel. We hadnt eaten all day and it was already the afternoon.. Buckhorn Grill was a great choice. You pay and order at the counter, given a buzzer and pick up your food when the it pages you. We waited maybe 10-15 mins to get our food. I would say it was worth it. 

There was a good amount of tri-tip on this sammich and the fries were very good. Nice and crispy. Service was indifferent. Cashier was just going through the motions. The lady that hands you your food at the counter was much nicer. I would eat there again if left hungry at the San Francisco Centre. I liked it.
author: Chuck D.

description:
Meats. This is a place for meats.

You want it in a bun, sure. 
You want it with a salad, why not. 
All meat with a side of meat washed down with meat? Won't do that but that's just me.

Not too sure if you like meat? Samplers available, just hang around and pretend to stare at the menu.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: I was in a hurry to go back to my hotel after a long day at work and bumped across this inside the Westfield Mall. The prime rib, cesar salad & corn bread were very comforting considering that I paid less than $20 for a full meal. Service is fast although the staff weren't very friendly that night. There was a line & a few minutes wait but the food compensated for it.
author: Orlando F.

description:
While passing through San Francisco a couple of times in the last 6 months, we enjoyed the tri-tip at Buckhorn's. 2nd time wasn't as good as the 1st, but it still is some of the tastiest beef I've ever had. Medium to medium rare and very tender and sweet. 

I wish I knew about the other locations at the time. It would've been nice to try out one of the sit-down restaurant locations.
author: Ron W.

description: I got the tri tip flatbread salad. It was darn good, especially considering this is mall food court food! It was a bit pricey and the portions was on the smallish side. If I ordered this again, I would request for no onions and to put the flatbread separately instead of at the bottom of the salad where it got soggy.
author: Sandy L.

description:
If I could give them a zero or a negative star I would.

Came here the Friday of their opening week around 1pm. There were only 2 people ahead of my friend and I in line but what we didn't realize was there were a number of people waiting for their meals (I'm talking at least 15 people). We both ordered chicken tenders from the side menu thinking it couldn't take more than 10 minutes to make and boy was I wrong. It took nearly 40 minutes!!!! And I'm pretty sure it would have taken longer if we didn't ask for our order at least 3x before they started making it. Apparently they "forgot" the first 2 times. I was livid and made it clear to the owner who was trying to help with the orders that we had been waiting a significant amount of time for what we were told would be ready in about  minutes. His response was basically that it was unacceptable but also that they were new and still trying to figure it out. Well advice to you Mr Owner, these things should be thought of beforehand. No one in FiDi on their lunchtime wants to be waiting 40 minutes for what ended up being greasy chicken that was not even good. 

Would NOT recommend coming here. Better to spend more $ somewhere that treats their customers with better regards and serves a decent meal in a reasonably amount of time.
author: Mina T.

description:
Pretty good food especially for being inside the mall food court! 
The price i just wish there was a little bit kore food on the plate!
author: Jonathan A.

description: I was in the mood for tri tip and looked up places around where I was. Let me say the food was delicious and did not disappoint! Definitely recommending to anyone and everyone who loves tri tip sandwiches
author: Roman R.

description:
This review is for takeouts from this location!
This is the second time the burger is not what was ordered! 
The burger today had extra cheese (hello lactose intolerance!) bacon (seriously some ppl do not eat pork!) and avocado (my bf just simply does not like it) on their standard burger which comes with none of that.

Ppl order what they want to eat and expect to get their order and not extra added things that ppl can have allergies to or religious reason not to consume.

It is just disappointing to get home and realize the burger you just got is so not what you ordered.
author: Sandra C.

description: The only salad I ever crave!! Portions are huge and super tasty. Get the tri tip salad- it's the perfect combo of salad and protein. Check out that portion of tri tip though!!
author: Sarina A.

description: This is literally the worst BBQ I have ever had. Everything was cold, the corn bread was dry, the meat was over salted. +1 star for the French onion soup being good... After we had them reheat it. I would rather eat at Arby's than eat here again.
author: C K.

description: For mall food, it was really good! I had the tri tip wrap and it was tasty. The cashier was friendly and they offered samples which sold me
author: Mrs. B.

description:
With a show to watch nearby and short on time for a sit-down dinner, we opted to grab a quick meal at the food court at the Westfield Center Food Emporium.  Having tried some of the restaurants here, we decided on Buckhorn Grill. 

Checking out the menu, I decided on the Char-Broiled Sirloin Tri Tip Platter.  For $2 more, I upgraded to the 12oz Dad's Cut.  The platter includes red mashed potatoes and gravy, roasted vegetables, and a corn muffin. They call it the "Best Tri-Tip on the Planet." It is marinated and hand-rubbed in a secret seasoning before it is roasted over fire and then smoked.  

 I had ordered the beef rare, but it was closer to medium-rare.  The three slices of 4oz. beef was tender and indeed was very tasty.  Roasted vegetables and mashed potatoes were very good and the corn muffin was average.  Good sized portion meal.

We were able to finish our meal and had plenty of time to walk to the show.  Very satisfied with our choice of Buckhorn Grill and will be back.
author: Al L.

description: Took 20mins to get my food. Burger was not so good. You're better off at super duper and in & out. I give a negative -1.
author: Sean V.

description: This place is great.  Ate there every day for a whole week while working in San Francisco.  Got the same thing. I wish there was one here in Miami.  Will go back again when I'm back in San Francisco for work
author: Michael J.

description: Tourist in S.F.. First time at a Buckhorn.  Had some difficulty from the start. Cashier was hard to understand. Order came out wrong. The tri-tip was very tough and a side took 10 minutes to come out after the sandwiches.
author: Robert O.

description: They have the best tri-tip in town. They have good selections of salads and huge portion. I always order the "Krispy chicken avocado" salad. It is amazing! The honeylime dressing is the bomb. Always my go to. Service is okay, not the best.
author: Nej Odaruj S.

description: This is My Favorite Place to Eat in the Westfield Mall..Nice Staff.I love the Bacon Cheddar Buck ! Onion Rings are  Good too.
author: Ken F.

description: Very good location very helpful employees! Awesome manager named Erick I hope I got his name right but he did a fantastic work getting my salad perfect!!! I used to come often before but I definitely will be coming more often due to service since they closed the one in union city thank you! P.s I got the cabo chop minus the corn and black beans add salmon protein and half romain greens and half spring mix !
author: Vernita R.

description: Though the cashier was rude, she seemed in a hurry, I still liked the food. My food came quickly and the steak was so tender!
author: Maria R.

description:
The Buckhorn tri-tip is full of good flavor. I have noticed however the tri-tip does not taste the same at multiple locations I don't know whether they freeze this meat and then reheat it but it's not unified.

The onions are tasty but they don't look too appealing on the plate looks like tangled hair.

The chicken gets the rubber chicken award so I would stick with the tri-tip
author: Ava V.

description: For a fast food joint in a mall good court, this place is the bomb. I've been here 3 times now and their entrees are always super fresh and satisfying. Their tri-tip is a must! I also really like the avocado chicken salad. They give plentiful portions of avocado and chicken.
author: Emma W.

description:
Absolutely terrible. 

This place is to be avoided for two reasons:

The beef is so salty and tough, it was like beef jerkey. 

While I was waiting for my order, a courier arrived to pick up a delivery order. He reeked and was dripping with sweat. I wouldn't want him touching my food ... it makes me question the sanitation of this restaurant.
author: Eric P.

description:
When I feel hungry during a trip downtown, this is my go to place for a roadside salad, sprinkled with blue cheese n fried onions. $7.99.
Always refreshing and tasty.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Why did you change your bread?!? The rolls you used to use were amazing and the new ones are almost inedible!! Dry and tasteless! It is an insult to your incredibly delicious tri tip... please switch back.. pretty please!
author: Adam B.

description:
We ordered lunch delivery through Forkable with Buckhorn and I ordered the Roadhouse salad with tri-tip.

It was sooo good! Salad mix, fried onions, green beans, walnuts, cherry tomatoes, blue cheese... Fresh, flavorable and great portions! Tri tip was tender and flavorable and they did not jip me on the portions.

The dressing was on the side and was great with the entire salad. Highly recommend!
author: M L.

description:
I decided to give em a try when my fav thai place was so full!
The food is okay, but I got their salad.
author: Candice L.

description: The quality was very good, especially for an indoor mall food court. Little pricey, but the tri tip was delicious and worth it! Ordered the 8oz tri tip, it comes with mashed potatoes and grilled vegetables. The tri trip was very good and the skin on the outside was crispy and charcoaled which gave it a lot of flavor. The mashed potatoes were also good, but I was very impressed with the vegetables, these were large pieces of zucchini, bell peppers, sweet potatoes, squash...not your type broccoli and carrots here. My meat was $16.99 and if you add a drink the meal can cost $20 but after a day of walking around you need to refuel. The menu looked like they had unique salads, burgers, and wraps as well. Would definitely come back!
author: Kent V.

description: Stopped here for lunch while at a conference. Tender delicious beef and the toppings and sauces were flavorful on the sandwiches. I got the Road house buck fat piece of steak. The fries were good but not spectacular.
author: Emily P.

description: The burger was delicious! Way too much shredded  lettuce but at least it was fresh lettuce. That was all I ordered only because I was in San Francisco a was not a Tourist. I can't be spending $11 on a burger then adding fries and a drink on top that. I did get full but Maybe that's why they added so much shredded lettuce. They made my order and realized I did add a drink or fries‍
author: Tamu V.

description: The Tri-Tip deserves 5 Stars. The rest is OK but as the Tri-Tip is so good I am still going with the 4+ Stars!
author: Christian D.

description:
I'm not a big fan of food courts. They're crowded and it's always tough choosing between seemingly mediocre options. I strolled by each food vendor, taking a sample teriyaki chicken at one and teasing another with a brief interested squint at their menu. Ultimately, I settled on Buckhorn because of its simplicity and quite frankly, search exhaustion. With that said, it turned out to be a good choice. 

I had the Cobb salad nestled in a taco bowl. The lettuce was crispy, cold and fresh. Good ingredients (corn, black beans, radishes, avocado, and BBQ chicken). I added ranch dressing and extra BBQ sauce to my liking at the counter. The taco shell was just the right amount of crispy. It's a large portion, so if you eat it all like i did, expect to feel a bit too full. 

Overall, a good choice given the food court context. Save the dizzying search for shopping at the mall and settle on Buckhorn for lunch.
author: Behnam S.

description:
Came here for lunch at Westfield. Just another day in the city getting my shopping fix. Located in the lunch emporium. 

I ordered a crispy chicken avocado salad. A very good, decent price for quality food. 

The chicken was yummy, breaded and crunchy. It also came with bleu cheese, my favorite. Came with a honey lime sauce which was sweet and tangy, a yummy combination. They were also VERY generous with their portions. It was too much for me to finish.
author: A Z Flor H.

description: So last night I had Buckhorn in Walnut Creek today I'm having it SF style and I must say it's better!!! The chicken which was available here is Thee Best, the word moist just doesn't do it!! The seasoning the flavor aroma it's all on point the Buckhorn BBQ isn't bad either although I enjoyed the chicken without it.
author: Mychelle T.

description: i love this place with great offerings. Craving satisfied if your craving for tri tips. Never fails. love this spot and other spots throughout bay area great offerings.
author: Meishi M.

description:
Tri-tip and some mixed greens, what more could a  girl ask for?

I usually order the Cabo Chop salad with tri tip minus the blue cheese and taco bowl with dressing on the side. This salad has a good mix of chopped romaine, avocado, black beans, corn, jicama, radishes, and tomatoes.

My new favorite is the trip tip flatbread wrap minus the blue cheese again. It seems like a whole wheat wrap with romaine, red onion, tomatoes, celery, mushrooms and ranch dressing. I am not sure how they get this wrap to stay in place but it is a lot easier to eat than when you order the flatbread style...although then you wouldn't eat all the bread :P
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Buckhorn is one of the few places in the mall (especially now that Bristol Farms has closed) where you can get a freshly made and tossed salad with some great grilled meats. I love the crispy chicken and avocado salad here, but the last time I got it I paid $13 for a plate full of lettuce! They must be cutting costs or something, because my salad had only a few pieces of the chicken, a few grape tomatoes, and most disappointing at all, TINY and pathetic chunks of avocado that might not have even been from half an avocado! Many of the pieces were also browning! After eating only half of the salad, I had run out of all toppings and had nothing to eat along with the lettuce.

The cashier wasn't friendly and was forgetful. She asked me what my order was again right after I had just told her a second ago. I also asked for water, but of course, I didn't get it and had to ask another server for it. Something else that has also bugged me about this Buckhorn is that they charge a "SF mandated fee" to your bill, a fee I have never seen anywhere else in SF. 

Now I have to get 20 of their free samples just to make up for the disappointing meal I received.
author: Enari L.

description:
The 'Ceasar Pleaser' is all I order.
Two thick slices of tri-tip grilled to perfection. It is tender not tough. Their $11.99 price is awesome for the anount of tri-tip and salad you get. I leave super full every time.
The Ceasar salad is decent with yummy croutons.
It also comes with bread and butter if you want it. The service is fast and with a smile.
If you sign up for their reward program, you can get a ten dollar coupon after you spend $100. If you eat here a lot like me, it adds up fast.
Enjoy :)
author: Cyn T.

description: Ugh!! What happened to this place?? I dined at Buckhorn grill when I used to live in the east bay. I went to the Walnut Creek locations which was really good. There sandwiches were nice and hearty and I remember really liking it. I live in San Francisco now and I was happy to see it at the Westfield shopping center. I went during Christmas season and it completely changed! I ordered Crispy Chicken sandwich and it looked worst than a McChicken sandwich from McDonalds! It was not fresh and it was so think you can barely see it! I was tasting more bread than anything else. The macaroni and cheese.. Was this made from powder? Totally disappointed me! What happened to you, buckhorn??
author: Darlene M.

description:
Yesenia J was the worst cashier ever. My first time here and definetly last. 

She doesn't know what are in the burgers. She said, she's not sure, when I asked her what's in it. She was also very rude and mean. I ordered a burger and said no cheese just in case, and it came with blue cheese, of course. 

Had to send it back.  Unfortunately fries were also cold.
author: Yelp A.

description: good food.  good service.  the garlic pulled pork platter and mashed potatoes were delicious.  corn muffin was a bit dry.
author: J W.

description:
Kudos to you guys for actually reading the notes on my Grubhub purchase 2/8/17. I've never had anyone to this day read the notes and accommodate. So to whom ever was working this day I thank you. 

I called to ask menu questions and the lady who answered the phone gave excellent customer service. Sorry I don't know your name, hunger deprived me of my memory on that one. 

Our delivery food was packaged very neat and clean. No skills or messes. Everything was accounted for including the accommodation notes. 

The food is always tasty. I was expecting more size in my chicken with the platter combo but it was still plenty of food for me. The platter was the grilled chicken with potatoes and veggies. I substituted more potatoes instead of the veggies. Their were 2 pieces of chicken on the thinner side but seasoned really really good. I think I was expecting more of a store bought size but again they tasted good and it was plenty. Maybe they pounded it?

My friend got the flatbread chicken salad. It turned out to be a wrap and he loved it. 

Another friend ordered a sandwich combo with mashers and a drink. I just remembered, the drink didn't arrive. Let's say it rolled out of the bag in the Grubhub dudes car? Yeah. 

And thanks for providing enough napkins and utensils. 

We've had the salads here and they are all yummy.

This is located in one of the 2 food areas in the mall. Fast and efficient if you happen to stop by instead. I'm too lazy so it's usually a dice roll for who's gonna pick the food up. Happy to order thru a 3rd party app and pay the small delivery fee.
author: Lennox B.

description: I'm so down with the Buckhorn Grill.  I just LOVE anyplace I can get fresh, grilled chicken--in a sandwich or on a salad or just on whatever my mood dictates.  I ordered extra chicken without any judgement from the nice man taking my order, which is always appreciated.  (I'm a protein piggie sometimes, snort snort!:)  I was hesitant to eat here because I can get this anytime at my neighborhood Walnut Creek location, but am so glad I did.  It was completely yummy!  Not to mention, it filled me up without making me feel stuffed and I was perfectly hungry for dinner.  Win/Win and thumbs up!!!
author: Christine T.

description:
Okay, so in the fast food theme, Buckhorn Grill is pretty good. Tri-tip is not a cut that I have seen very often, but it amounts to the bottom sirloin. They really market that cut as something special, but it isn't. There's nothing wrong with it, though, I'm just not buying into what's essentially hype.

So, I had a tri tip sandwich and it was A-OK. The bun, vegetables, and meat all seemed fresh and the sandwich was juicy. I'd come back. I have to...I love corn bread and I didn't have room to order them today.
author: Derek F.

description:
Came here with my older brother and three nephews on a Monday evening because some of us haven't eaten yet.

We decided to do Buckhorn Grill because I haven't had it in a very long time.  My nephew, Chris, ordered the tri-tip sandwich meal on his own and he seemed please with his meal.

I ordered the $26.99 2.5 lb tri-tip to share with my brother and my other nephews because they've never tried Buckhorn.  I asked to have the tri-tip sliced both ways, half thick and half thin.  The boys definitely seemed to enjoy the meat a lot.

We had a side order of mac 'n cheese that wasn't a big hit and the corn bread was really dry, so we just focused on eating the tri-tip.  I was really surprised that the four of us couldn't finish 2.5 lbs of meat so we ended up having to ask for a box to take the rest home.

Overall, we all enjoyed the tri-tip a lot and you get your money's worth, just avoid ordering some of the sides...
author: Sivilay T.

description:
At Westfield mall there are so many options to eat that don't come off as "cheap."  There's a variety of nice dining for lunch and Buckhorn Grill is a place if want something nice to have.  And by nice, I mean a meal that looks like a steak dinner.

So I met up with my sis and aunt for lunch and here's what we shared:

POUTINE - $7.99
As soon as I saw this in the display I had to order it.  I don't often see poutine with pieces of steak.  Also, we were holding up the line because of our indecisiveness.  Yeah its one of those layouts where you better know what you're getting by the time you get to the cash register, otherwise you'll get the stink eye!  ANYWHO, yes, the poutine not only has the gravy and cheese curds (which wasn't much) but it was topped with a load of rare steak!  That was the best part! There's also some green onions on top but I think we ended up just eating the steak.  It was so tender and flavorful.  I think the gravy only made the whole dish a little saltier than I liked.  Poutine is the kind of dish you should eat fast unless you prefer your fries soggy and swimming in gravy.

SIRLOIN PLATTER - $15.99
2 thin slabs of Sirloin steak, mashed potatoes and gravy, cornbread, tiny corn on the cob, and grilled vegetables ( sweet potato, red bell pepper, zucchini, and potato, and meat juice).
You know, I was quite impressed when I saw this plate.  The sirloin is quite tender and tasty...everyone is quite decent.  My only complain is the corn on the cobb was dry and over cooked.  But besides that, for that price, it was a good amount of food!  It did take awhile though but hey, its not fast food right?  I know its not cooked to order but still.  Not too shabbeh is what I say!

We ended up with leftovers, and I overall enjoyed my meal.  Woot!
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
If you can deal with the pushy people of the Westfield mall, this is a place I definitely recommend.
I love their tri tip and chicken combo. They give a huge amount of food, and everything tastes great. The tri tip is juicy and their grilled chicken is full of flavor. 
I would also have to say it is expensive if eating with multiple people, but a go to spot whenever I'm in the area.
author: Melissa S.

description:
My carnivorous brother made a good decision picking this place for lunch. There's lots of meat here as well as some healthier options to choose from. Tri-tip, charbroiled chicken, salmon and salads, among other things.

Definitely make this a place to stop and fill up your gastrointestinal tract. I love that they serve cornbread with their plated meals. Cornbread is the way to my heart. Well, one of the ways to my heart....

Food is moderately priced. Fountain drinks available. Soups if you're looking for something lighter. For quicker service, you can order online. They also cater.

Seating is numerous since you're basically in the lower level food court of the Westfield SF shopping center. Making this a food spot we're definitely going to revisit, recommend and share with both family and friends. And maybe strangers too. Why not?!
author: Cat V.

description: Yesenia-J cashier was so abrasive and unprofessional. She clearly does not want to be working...here or anywhere. I do love the food here but concerned about the service quality. People in the kitchen didn't seem to give one F either.
author: Rater 1.

description: Overpriced to a fault:  $14.65 for a "Big Buck" (9.99 - no fixings, no bread - just a pile of meat), and Fries ($2.99).  The fries were barely warm, greasy, and under cooked.  The meat was tender and served "au jus" because I asked for no bread, but it was cold.  Total:  $14.65 (tax was $1.15).  And to think I could have had nearly three meals at In 'N Out Burger.  Service:  perfunctory.  The staff signaled me that the food was ready, but it was not.  The cashier and order taker seamed indifferent and frankly could care less about being customer focused and service oriented.  I would have given her some customer training and taken her off the counter.  Asking for some Ketchup took three questions by me and was awkwardly sequestered to the back and out-of-reach from customers.   Take your cash elsewhere.
author: William S.

description: The food on display vs the food that comes out are worlds apart. I ordered a Philly buck and the sandwich that came out was tiny, super greasy (not inna good way), and on very mediocre bread. The meat portions were small. I expected a legitimate sandwich but ended up a "sandwich" of worse quality than any McDonald's meal I've had, but for twice the price.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Extremely solid option for the mall food court. I love the flatbread salads with tri-tip. It's almost two meals for me. The food is made to order, so you'll have a wait a bit with the buzzer they have you hold, but it's worth it, and not too long of a wait. 

You may feel it's a bit on the pricey side compared to the other options around it ($12 vs $8 for a meal), but won't leave you feeling weird about what you just ate. 

Make sure everyone in your group eats meat before heading off here. My vegetarian friends are always bummed when they find out this is where we have selected as the group lunch spot (although there are plenty of places around here they also have found things they liked).
author: Brian B.

description:
5 stars for their trip tip flat bread salad. I passed on the flatbread and asked for balsamic vinaigrette instead of the ranch. 

Tri tip is wonderfully seasoned, the greens were fresh and crunchy and the balsamic was fantastic!
author: Lauren Y.

description:
What a way to lure people in, with free samples of delicious sirloin steak.  That's what happened to us when we were wandering around Westfield's food court, looking for lunch.  As soon as we tried Buckhorn Grill's steak, we made a U-turn and got in line.  The restaurant was busy.

Buckhorn specializes in char-roasted tri-tip steak.  Tri-tip is a cut of bottom sirloin which was originally marketed in Oakland.  Buckhorn uses Angus beef and ages it for 21 days.  The seasoned and marinated meat is charred over a wood fire and finished in a wood-smoked oven.  To me, it tastes like a very good cut of sirloin: savory, tender, and juicy.  For a food court, the meat quality is great.  Try a sample for yourself and see.

The restaurant sells tri-tip in multiple forms: sandwiches, salads, and by itself.  You can even take home a whole tri-tip for $24.95 ($5 off on Sundays) -- one feeds 5-6 people.  All tri-tip is cooked to medium rare unless otherwise specified.  For steak, prices are reasonable.  Sandwiches and salads are generally $8-9 each.  Platters are around 15 bucks each.

I tried Buckhorn's "Yik Yak" ($7.99), which is one of the restaurant's most popular salads.  It consists of mixed greens, cabbage, jicama (Mexican turnip), red bell pepper, crispy pasta, snow peas, cilantro, celery, green onion, and slices of tri-tip tossed with a sweet sesame dressing and topped with toasted almonds.  The salad is served inside a soft tortilla.

The portion size is generous.  This salad will leave most people feeling full and satisfied.  The salad I had was fresh and crisp.  I liked the pear-like texture of the jicama.  The slices of tri-tip were cold.  The salad was a healthy choice, but if I were to eat here again, I'd probably order a hot tri-tip sandwich or entree.  The "Little Buck" sandwich looks great as the tri-tip is served with caramelized onions and au jus.

Service was speedy.  The staff have their SOPs down to a T.

Buckhorn Grill currently has 12 locations: 10 in California and 2 in New York.  Several locations are in shopping centers.  One is in a train station (NY's Grand Central Station).  This location at Westfield San Francisco Centre has an open kitchen where you can see all the high-paced, feverish action.
author: Daniel B.

description:
If you're at Westfield center and looking for a bite, they've been trying to turn around mediocre 90s style mall food into more gourmet options for a while. With that said, Buckhorn Grill is a small chain from Winters, CA which seems to have gained some traction in their food court ventures and have some standalone strip mall locations too.

I've had:
Cabo Chop Salad w/ Chicken ($10.49) - this was a large yet messy salad. Lots of blue cheese that drowned out the beans and lime dressing.
Roadhouse buck ($8.99) - Delicious tri tip sandwich, seasoned well, medium rare, and stuffed to the max. The sauce provided was good standalone. Potato strings complementing this felt like they weren't made to order, something you can sometimes taste from a large chain like Outback/Chilis. Otherwise, sandwich was good as is.

Way better than the average mall food, it's a short wait as they prep your meal.
author: Steven C.

description: To be honest, I was pleasantly surprised by the food from buckhorn grill. I ordered the chicken flatbread salad and the chicken was well seasoned, and was served with caramel used red onions (yum), tomatoes, and spring mix. Overall, if recommend coming here if you're at the mall.
author: Jennifer C.

description: the food was simply amazing, I couldn't believe this establishment was at a mall's food court! amazing, delicious! will definitely eat there again when I'm in town! two thumbs up!!!
author: Jenniffer G.

description:
This is My favorite restaurant when I am attending conventions at Moscone.
The food is amazing.  The best is Buckhorn burger which is a thick juicy patty on a crisp bun.  They add the perfect amount of dressing (thousand island).  My recommendation is to come here a few minutes before noon to avoid the crowds.
author: Simon K.

description: ..The downtown San Francisco location is usually the best..but after this visit.. I might jus stop eating here..the portion n missing ingredents in the salad..makes me think staff can't keep up with the crowd of the day..???!!
author: Crisy G.

description:
Who would've thought that restaurants at the mall were fairly good!!  Shopping around this massive city can be super tiring and eating anywhere would be fine with me!  Since we were shopping for awhile, we just decided to eat at the mall.  Yes I know, you are in San Francisco, a place with amazing food, but I was hungry and I was tired.  Even anything at McDonalds would suffice my stomach!  My brother, sister, and I shared a ginormous salad with strips of tri-tip on a pita bread (available in the form of a burrito roll too).  It was amazingly delicious and light!  Of course we ordered other food from another place too to fill our stomachs!  This salad was $10.99 but it was well worth it!

NOTE:
-You can try some things before eating
author: Diana T.

description:
Buckhorn is the only good food I have had in this food court. The garlic fries are really good and the crispy chicken avocado salad is my fav. I also like that they offer sauces like BBQ and ranch for free off to the side where you pick up your food. The nazis at Bistro burger have the audacity to charge extra for those (the Bush street location offers sauces free--riddle me THAT Bistro Burger, hmm?)

If you're at Westfield and want a non-yuppy meal that won't give you the runs or taste horrible, and as an added bonus- tastes good, Buckhorn is your joint.
author: Emma H.

description:
I think it's absurd when people eat salads at restaurants that specialize in steak. I can understand if someone orders a side of salad with their steak, but a full-sized salad for a meal instead? Sounds so silly! However, I'll admit that I'm one of those strangely odd people that eat meal-sized salads at Buckhorn Grill.

Buckhorn makes a delicious and satisfying Krispy Chicken Salad. $9.50 is a bit expensive for a salad, but I assure you that Buckhorn's Krispy Chicken Salad is worth the hefty price tag. This salad includes fried chicken breast, chopped romaine lettuce, grape tomatoes, fresh avocado, and blue cheese crumbles, all tossed in a yummy honey lime vinaigrette that's to die for! The chicken isn't crispy; it's a bit dry, but overall it's still decent. The avocado is fresh and tomatoes are plump and juicy. The proportion of blue cheese crumbles is just right, not too much, which is important because blue cheese is very pungent. But the vinaigrette is the real star in this salad: it's tangy, sweet, and creamy, yet not too heavy. If Buckhorn sold this dressing in prepackaged bottled form, I would buy a bunch.

But of course I've also tried Buckhorn's main specialty -- their sirloin tri-tip. The doneness varies, but most of the time it's cooked medium rare. It's charred nicely on the outside and well-seasoned. The inside is juicy, moist, and so so so delicious. They often give out small samples dipped in au jus sauce.

Overall, Buckhorn serves some good, though pricey food. The salads and tri-tip platters are large enough to share between two people (or maybe even one hungry person). But if you're looking for smaller options, the sandwiches will suffice. San Francisco's Westfield Shopping Center's food court definitely has good food selection. This puts other malls' food courts to shame.
author: Priscilla W.

description: Food was pretty good. Definitely one of the more popular restaurants at the food court here. Tri tip was good and they have unique variety of salads. Chicken was a little dry but still ok, their tri tip is their main attraction.
author: Thang D.

description:
Great food and service. 
Ordered chicken and avo salad. Delicious. Also, the mash potatoes were really good! The only thing I've ordered from here and not been impressed with is the salad on the flatbread. 
Service is always great. 
Come here frequently and frequent the location in Stoneridge as well. Consistently great across the board. Worth the price as it is more expensive than most "food court" restaurants but made up in service and quality.
author: Dee A.

description: We wanted to check out the local no chain eateries but having arrived in town in the midst of the lunchtime rush, all of the places we tried had lines out the door. So, we found Buckhorn Grill. After we ordered, we overheard another customer say it was a chain restaurant. In all honesty I was a little down because our intent was to avoid almost all chain restaurants. Well...Buckhorn was a pleasant surprise. We each ordered the Philly Buck, but one order had fries and the other order had fried onions. Once you order, you're given one of the buzzers to wait to be called. The fries were a little soggy and the fries onions were a little too salty. However, the sandwiches were pretty good! The bread they used was soft and chewy and the portions are very reasonable (not insane). It's still good for sharing of you want something "light". The staff is friendly and he service is relatively fast. It was a nice surprise and since we got mobbed out of our initial choices.
author: Christine B.

description: California BBQ at it's best. Quick friendly service along with high quality meats that melt in your mouth. We ate lunch at the Vacaville store. Place was packed which is always a good sign. Extra gold star for having Dr.Pepper, the best drink for BBQ on the planet.
author: David M.

description:
I came here to grab a bite and it was no where near busy. And yet, I waited and waited and watched as everyone casually interacted with each other and my order was quickly forgotten. 

I also witnessed one of the workers help himself to some food and as he was grabbing sauce, he accidentally poured some on his hand and eagerly licked it off. He didn't even bother putting on gloves or even washing his hands after and he continued to assist in getting drinks or handling food. Disgusting.

I'll rethink my decision on dining here again.

Oh, and when I finally got my food, I literally had two pieces of tomatoes in my salad with the tiniest pieces of chicken too. And the avocado pieces were pretty nonexistent. Severely disappointed with this experience.
author: Stephanie L.

description: The beef at Buckhorn Grill is a pure delight! I figure give the Salmon a try. And lo and behold Buckhorn Grill  put the grill in grill:the Salmon was cooked to perfection flavorful and went perfectly with the sides of potatoes..I am starting to lean toward Buckhorn Grill as one of the top eateries period.  At times I venture to some other eateries and the flavor is good but the meat is scarce..not so at  Buckhorn Grill;the sirloin,tritip, salmon.... are all served in generous portions.
author: Jimmy L.

description: One of my college basketball teammates in California introduced me to tri-tip. I instantly became a fan. Sadly, it's not a cut of meat we eat often in Virginia. I was excited to see Buckhorn Grill in Westfield Centre served tri-tip. I had a bacon cheddar buck (tri-tip with bacon & melted cheese) and onion straws. The tri-tip sandwich was delicious. I thought the tri-tip, bacon, and cheddar blended well together. Buckhorn onion straws were fried to a nice crisp. Buckhorn Grill is located in the food court but they dish out some tasty tri-tip. I went to this location twice for tri-tip while visiting in San Francisco. Buckhorn Grill is a good choice for tri-tip sandwiches.
author: Dominic B.

description: Located in the malls food court, this place isn't bad.  The TriTip is good, not as tender, but tasty still.  For $16-18 you get meat, potatoes, cornbread and veggies.  Its a lot of food.  Not the best TriTip ever, but pretty good for the price.  Refills on non-alcoholic drinks are free!
author: Chad S.

description:
I came across Buckhorn wandering the Westfield food court with a huge appetite, and I wanted so many different things. Buckhorn seemed to offer that with the tri-tip steak and grilled chicken combo with some sides. There were only a few people in line, and my food was served up super quickly. I guess it's a mall so they precook and just serve whatever people order.

Mashed potatoes and gravy were awesome--perfect taste and texture, as were the vegetables. The balance of food was excellent and healthy enough. I'm not sure I understand the hype over the meat though. I do admit that when I saw the cut of tri-tip steak, I started craving brisket for a second. But when I bit in, it was so salty and a little tough to cut and eat. The grilled chicken was likewise a little old and pretty salty. I will say the meal was pretty expensive, but lasted for 1 dinner + 1 lunch so in the end it was a good value. And don't forget to check in to use the Yelp coupon!

I'd be willing to come back and give it another try, but there are so many other enticing options in this food court! Unsure why this is the highest rated place in the food court with a solid 4. I wish the sample guy had been there before I got in line...
author: Kimberly Y.

description:
This place is truly a hit or miss. I only every order one thing from here and that's always the Cabo chop salad with 2 orders of medium well steak on top with a substitute of blue cheese for any other cheese.

Honestly that's all I ever order. I tried one time to order fries (I was being extra greedy) bad choice fries were dingy and sad looking. 

I've eaten here and their location in Emeryville and like I said it's always hit or miss (at least they're consistent in that)

The Cabo Chop is their biggest salad and I love it!! I think it has iceberg lettuce, radish, black beans, jicama, corn, avocado, your choice of cheese, your choice of meat all encased  inside a fried tortilla shell. Depending on the day they'll give you cold meat or a salad that looks like it's been sitting there awhile. 

But the salad really is great ONLY reason I keep coming back. 

Although they've messed up my order a couple times and the cashier at the Emeryville location (she's new) gives attitude I'll probably keep coming until they no longer sell the Cabo Chop.
author: Becca T.

description:
I lurrrvvv Buckhorn Grill! Every time I eat at Westfield Mall, I always do my best to try something new but I never do. I always head right back to Buckhorn Grill for their tri-tip salad. Honestly, who can turn down perfectly flavored juicy tri-tip?? 

My favorite salad is the Roadhouse Salad with Tri-Tip but I skip the walnuts since Mr. Dubs is allergic. One salad is always two meals for me, so it's totally worth the $13!

*Tip: Ask for it in a to-go box. It's so much easier to eat the massive salad that way without worrying about making a mess.
author: Tiffany U.

description:
Check in with Yelp and get $1- off.  I am a coupon Kathy so I know about stuff like that.

Great place to grab a decent meal before a movie.  I've had the French Onion Soup and a 1./2 sandwich is a great deal.  Another time I had a hamburger. It's one of the better places to eat at Sony.
author: Michael C.

description:
I've had their Roadhouse as well as the Spring Mix Fruit & Nut salads here, both with tri-tip (+$3). Both come in generous portions and I'd say the display they have out front is a pretty accurate visual description of what you can expect. Of the two, I think I like the Roadhouse salad better (but it's certainly heavier due to the deep-fried onions) but they were both awesome and filling salads. I only wish that their doneness on the tri-tip was more consistent. I don't think I'll try the sandwiches as I feel the prices are kinda steep for.. a sandwich. But I'd come again for their salads if I find myself hungry at Westfield!

Like many other places in this food court, you order at the cashier and get a buzzer for when your food is ready. 

Don't forget to check-in on Yelp to get $1 off your order!
author: Jessica Y.

description: One of the best (fast food) here at the Westfield Mall food court (lower level). The tri-tip beef they serve is very tasty and fresh. The salads are also very fresh although, I would prefer a mixed salad over the romaine lettuce. There is also a decent selection of beers or even wine to go along with your meal for an extra price.  I have eaten here on various occasions and the beef is always good.
author: Peisa M.

description:
I've eaten here twice now and both times I have been blown away at how awesome the food is for a mall food court.  This is the type of fare you would expect at a sit down establishment with servers.  I ordered the Cabo Chopped Salad this time around and it was like a Cobb Salad with sliced Avocado, sliced radishes, cubed grilled chicken, chopped cherry tomatoes, crumbled bleu cheese, a handful of sliced black olives, yellow corn, and diced jicama.  The green salad was pre-tossed with its own dressing before placing all the rest of the ingredients on top.  The thing that made this dressing stand out (besides all of the awesome ingredients)  was the dressing.  

We meant to ask them what kind of dressing it was but forgot to stop by before we left.  What I can say is that it tasted sort of sweet and tangy with a squeeze of lime mixed in.  It's definitely different from your usual Cobb Salad ranch which is what I usually have.  If you guys haven't tried this, I highly recommend it!
author: Lorie N.

description: Sunday crew sucked today. Caesar salad would have been great, if there was dressing . . .
author: Danielle M.

description:
I would drive across the city, deal with parking and the mall crowd for this amazing place... but luckily I don't have to. The fact that the Bart station is attached to this mall makes it so easily accessible. 

Buckhorn Grill stands out in one of the highest class mall food courts in America.

Do yourself a favor. Walk up to the counter, and say, "I would like a crispy chicken salad, add tri-tip, with an extra dressing on the side." Then you will wait about 5 minutes for the most amazing salad you have ever eaten in your life. 

This salad is beyond words... even though I'm trying.
author: Chase L.

description:
THEIR SAMPLES GOT ME!

I was walking and i got a juicy piece of tri tip and ended up getting the 12 oz tri tip platter!

3 huge slabs of medium rare tri tip and a side of grilled vegetables and a side of mashed potatoes and gravy, served with cornbread and butter.. SO DELICIOUS! only problem was that my plate wasn't big enough for me to cut the tri tip without all my other sides falling out  the other side of the plate. Got myself sides of creamy horseradish sauce, and it's almost like a steak dinner! The platter was definitely big enough to share between two people, and with room to walk about the mall for dessert :)

I think this was one of the best tritip I've ever had.. never been to the other Buckhorn Grills, but this Westfield downtown one was really really good!
author: Carmen C.

description: How did this happen?! An amazing place to eat in a mall food court?! Tri tip small plate was excellent, not tough or overdone, and the roasted veggies were unusually good. I have never had roasted carrots this sweet! Bf had the tri tip sandwich and said it was the best ever. Aside of the noisy food court atmosphere, what's not to like?
author: Lynn M.

description:
As I walk in here, I always notice that the line is way too long. Should I tell people that this is the worst place ever? I mean, I come here quite often enough, and I can't wait to get to my wonderful and cheap food. 

So here are the reasons you shouldn't go here:

1) If you don't like large portion of wonderfully mixed food
2) You like waiting a long time for your food
3) You don't like tri-tip.. like, really good tri-tip

Please don't go to this place, and don't take my tri-tip!
author: Jeff B.

description: Tried this place in new York and loved it....had to get it again once I learned there was one in SF....love the sandwiches....always will recommend the Little or Big Buck because the meat is so delicious. Don't forget to add onions
author: Andrew M.

description:
Buckhorn Grill... how I love thee... my favourite restaurant out of all of the delicious goodies Westfield Food Emporium has to offer. I dream of the tri-tip in my sleep.

Customer Service:
Fun fact... for all of you football fans out there the manager supports Chelsea FC. Just letting you know.

Overall, the customer service here is pretty good. Every experience I've had has been great. Everyone's super friendly and your food comes out quickly. Take note that there's always a free sample of their delicious tri-tip right in front of the restaurant!

Food:
They sell a nice variety of stuff here ranging from sandwiches to platters of steak, chicken, or seafood. I always come here for the steak platters (comes in 7 oz for 14 dollars or 12 oz, the "Dad's Cut" for 17 dollars). The prices are not cheap, but a deal for what you get - a steak which are usually around 20 dollars in restaurants.

The steak platters are delicious and comes with bread, butter, roasted veggies, and mashed potatoes. A super filling meal for a price that's super worth it. They cook it medium rare so prepare for a pretty bloody-looking tri-tip steak.

---

For you meat lovers out there, Buckhorn Grill is the way to go. You get affordable steak, great service, all while doing a bit of shopping at Westfield.

Fantastic!
author: Clarissa Y.

description:
Yes, they have LITTLE SPIKE on Pediatric Menu!  Tip:  If you leave your telephone number, for every dollar (BEFORE TAX) spent, you get points!  I usually leave work number, when get to part where order, I always first say telephone number!  As far have 58.11 points, not bad for LITTLE SPIKE sandwich!

Now LITTLE SPIKE, steak sandwich!  It comes with every!  The sandwich, the mash potato (I get that instead Fries, seems be healthier), and the drink!  This drink bar has lemonade or is spelled lemonaide?  Anyway, does have that not all places do!  Read mine o Subway Sandwiches in Sacra, not had, but BUCK HORN GRILL has!  I highly to recommend come eat here!  If they let you, order the LITTLE SPIKE, if had order same items separate on ADULT MENU, as say, is all separate but LITTLE SPIKE, comes to about $5.28 with tax!
author: Karyn C.

description:
This one is located in the Westfield food court and I must say that they are pretty consistent on distributing samplers of their well-flavored tri-tip to passer-bys!

When trying, it swayed me on ordering up the entree of tri-tip!  It was savory great.

Good proportions and you can't go wrong with the entrees here!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I guess it was a hit and miss today at brunch time at the good ol' Buckhorn.
I ordered the tri-tip cabo salad and when my order was ready the salad was heavily dosed with ranch dressing..too much that I couldn't see the lettuce! :(..I was looking forward to eating a healthy yummy salad. I should had took it back, but the line during lunch was crazy long, so today was your lucky day.
Anyways, I'm still a fan but please don't over dress the salad..it was like bowl was filled with liquid..yup-yup! :(
Not tasty not even close to appetizing.
author: Merly I.

description:
Allow me to lapse into the local lingo when describing the Tri Tip Flatbread Salad I had at this Buckhorn location.

That's hella salad!  Honest. Large plate, large flatbread, a mountain of greens and veggies, and five very large thin strips of Tri tip. Hella salad. 

If you sliced your meat right, you could literally get a piece of Tri tip into every bite. The steak was juicy and a perfect medium rare.  The greens were fresh and crisp.  The flatbread was firm yet chewy. I chose a Caesar dressing because I didn't want the dressing to fight with the flavor of the Tri tip, and that turned out to be an excellent choice. 

One complaint though. I couldn't believe they only had the dullest butter knives in the planet for us diners to eat this lovely steak salad. I get that we're in a food court and it might not be cool to have super sharp steak knives lying around for random people to grab. But please give me something at least a tiny bit sharper than that thing I had to use. It could barely cut through the flatbread!

Oh well, food court dining is hardly perfection. At least this Tri tip gem was worth the price, the crowds, and the three laps around the seating area it took for me to find a place to sit and eat it.
author: Eileen P.

description: I was amazed that such WONDERFUL tri tip is in the food court At Westfield mall!  The Med rare meat was so flavorfull without being salty, the au jus was savory and the onion rings were thin and crispy!
author: Carol G.

description: Buckhorn Grill is my favorite place to eat at the Westfield Mall in SF.  The food quality and portions are great; and the staff is extremely friendly and accommodating.  Pricing is on par for the quality and portion size; not too cheap and not too expensive.  The tri-tip is my go-to meal.  I request it cubed, rather than sliced thin or thick.  I could eat the tri-tip 3 times a week...oh wait, I already do.
author: Basil A.

description: The other locations are much better. But, again..what can you expect at the mall. Don't order the sandwich, it's not worth the money
author: Master R.

description:
I must have missed something or come on an off day. I hate issuing two star reviews, especially when other Yelpers rave about a place. 

I ordered the Roadhouse Salad with Sliced Tri-Tip on top. The employees were friendly, but the menu(s) were very confusing. They had a display case full of salads, but the salad menu was posted off in a corner (very hard to see from a certain angle). 

When I picked up my salad, it looked decent. However, thats when things changed. My first (and only) bite was filled with an extremely sweet and overpowering dressing, super greasy onion strings, and bland, lukewarm Tri-Tip. I tried to take another bite, but quickly saw a small nat fly out from the center of my salad (Yuck!!). Between the bizarre flavors and the nat, I was unable to take another bite.

The salad was also very expensive (it still would be even if it was executed properly).
author: Jackson L.

description:
For mall food, this stands out in my mind.  As we wandered through the varied offerings, I saw the huge salads, and it stopped me in my tracks. The prices were low and the ingredients looked fresh.  So I placed an order for the Crispy chicken salad. 

I was given a little pager device and sat down to wait. It didn't take long, maybe 5 minutes at most and I went to pick up the food. I swear the must have been 5 cups of romaine, topped with a delicious crunchy bit of chicken, some avocado, bleu cheese and tomatoes.   The dressing it was to come with - honey lime, wasn't up to me, so I opted for Ranch with some Honey Basil on the side. 

It was delicious and filling, and No, I couldn't eat all the lettuce, I actually ended up sharing it with my husband who'd opted for something from the Thai place next door.
author: Dianna B.

description:
Erick & Michelle rock.
The rest of the staff, too.
But those two most of all.
author: Dan B.

description:
Just not my thing: I ordered the Roadhouse Buck sandwich, and it was OK but nothing special. I can't really complain about the quality of the food as I think this is more a personal preference deal. If you like this type of food for lunch (flavorful but heavy), then by all means give it a try.

This mall gets absolutely packed, so if you see an open table make sure to grab it pronto.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Good quality food in a food court... Yes, please! More like this!

Just had a salad, with a piece of grilled salmon on top. Very nice. Don't know why this is so hard to find in San Francisco, but I'm glad Buckhorn has it. Will be adding them to my Lunch rotation...
author: Eric H.

description: My go-to place in Westfield. Big buck, caramelized onions, roadhouse onions are the way to go.
author: Jeff F.

description:
I had just got off the boat from a 10 day Mexican cruise. Instead of heading straight home to LA, I decided to hangout in SF a bit longer since the timing was so perfect with the BF also in town for Ad:Tech. He was working across the street at Moscone West so he took me to lunch at Buckhorn Grill.

I ordered the Portabella Buck Sandwich which seemed pretty safe to me without the cheese and Romesco sauce (which contains mayo.) I even asked to add avocado. Sounds cool, right? Except that when my order came out, it was on a bun. I guess I assumed it would be on a toasted roll since their meat sandwiches came on a roll. The BF offered to take it back and exchange it for a roll but instead came back with this excessively large flatbread. He said that the guy couldn't put that sandwich on a roll for unexplained reasons. Ok, weird. But just as I was about to take a bite, we realized that they forgot to add avocado. So he brought it back for a second time. In my head I could feel myself drafting this review and deducting stars.

Then I took a bite. OMG! The Portabella had this amazing flavor to it. I kinda hate to say it but it reminds me of back when I used to eat steak, there would be that bite of fat that you're not really supposed to eat but it taste so good. Disgusting, I know. But this mushroom somehow captured that essence in both flavor and texture. There's also this super smokey delicious BBQ sauce that is super addicting. I dipped my fries in that sauce and also added it to my "sandwich." Yum!

Needless to say, I'm torn. Service was a bit spazzy but the food was pretty amazing. There's also the slight chance that my taste buds were happy tasting something completely different after being on a boat for 10 days. But I still say this place is A-OK.
author: Harmonie T.

description:
Their tri-tips are like CRACK!  So juicy and delicious!

I ordered a whole rump and ate it with my salads for a week!  Oh mama!!!  

It's $19.95 for the whole rump of tri-tip but on the weekends, they offer a $5 off.  Well worth it.
author: Jenny T.

description: Expensive expensive expensive. Got the $10.99 krispy chicken salad to go. There was a 2% surcharge and on top of that, tax. Total came out to $12.19. Waited about 10-15 min for the food and the salad was mediocre in portion size and taste.
author: Jennifer C.

description: The line was short and the service was fast. They have a variety of salads and platters to make your mouth water. Conveniently located on the bottom floor of the mall they provide quick service. From the time I ordered to the time my buzzer went off it took only 5 minutes. Also the portions are large! Come with an appetite.
author: Ritchie T.

description:
Pretty darn good for mall food! Buckhorn Grill lies in the "fancy" food court on the Bloomingdales side! This place is delicious and affordable! 

Came here at 12:45pm on a Thursday and there was no line! I ordered the Big Buck and the Roadhouse Salad. For the salad I was able to add tri-tip for $3.50. The salad is loaded with deep fried onion strings which are very very addicting. The meat is juicy, delicious, and high quality. They are generous with their portions, so you'll definitely be full. 

Food comes out super fast. I waited less than 5 minutes. 

Check in on Yelp and you'll get $1 off your meal! (Ever dollar counts!)
author: Fanny H.

description:
We almost didn't eat here, until we tried a free sample of their famous tri-tip. O.M.G.!!! Likely the best tri-tip I've ever in my life tasted!

You have to eat here! This location is in a food court next to an AMC theater in the Financial District. Not really a place you'd expect to find gormet offerings. My boyfriend and I were looking for something tasty yet easy to eat, before heading to the airport. We had browsed over the menu but nothing really had stood out to us and we walked right on by. Down the hall a guy was giving out free samples and after one taste we went running back.

$1 off your order with a Yelp check-in, woo hoo for San Francisco! We took advantage of that offer. We decided to share their Caesar flatbread with tri-tip which we had them make into a wrap (10.95). We shared it because they have a sample of another flatbread on display and it's HUGE!! It easily made as a wrap big enough for 2 people. We also ordered a side of their mashed potatoes, I wasn't crazy about adding them, but when I tasted them I was glad we did! So delicious! The food was prepared fresh and fast and the tri-tip in the flatbread/wrap was just as delicious as the sampling we'd tried earlier.

Now I just need to figure out how to get these folks to open up in Vegas!
author: Kayla M.

description:
Fast, reasonably priced, and down right DELICIOUS. 

I ordered the Cabo Salad with grilled salmon for $14. It may seem expensive for a salad, but it really wasn't. The salad was HUGE, it was made with fresh, high quality, and delicious ingredients, and it tasted HEAVENLY. Also, it was ready in only about 20 minutes, which was really fast considering the fact there were like tons of people before me.

If you're in a hurry, or just want some good food in Westfield mall, definitely try Buckhorn Grill.
author: Eileen S.

description:
Forget these other reviews -- I *love* Buckhorn Grill.

I know it's a little silly for one of my favorite restaurants in the city to be located in the eatery of the Westfield Mall, but I am so obsessed with this place! Whenever friends visit from out of town and want to go shop *and* eat (especially eat affordably), Buckhorn Grill is always one of my top recommendations.

My favorite thing to get here is the Krispy Chicken Avocado salad. I know it doesn't SOUND that great, but there is something about the way their chicken is perfectly crispy, the *several* slabs of avocado (mmm, avocado), and that delicious dressing that I can't describe. It's SO good. If you're trying to be healthy, have that, and order a side of their steak because WOW. It is SO good and perfectly cooked! ... Well, if you like medium rare that's more on the rare side -- mmmmm.

I also LOVE their mashed potatoes and grilled onions. Most of the people I dine here with order a mashed potato plate, so I always end up picking off of them (trust that these servings are HUGE and no one really minds sharing).

SO GOOD.

Buckhorn Grill is located in the mall, obviously, so it's going to be a bit loud and full of tourists. But this is one of my favorite places to eat in the Emporium, and it's totally worth it. Plus, you can go shopping after! Yay!
author: Sherilynn M.

description: Good quality food, but the servers need to be abit more friendly.. but overall what mattets the most is the food. I loved my fried chicken sandwich i had this morning it was awesome & yummy.
author: Natasha M.

description: Terrible food. We ordered the 'Lemon garlic chicken' small plate, and were left pretty disappointed. The chicken was chalky and tasted stale. Not recommended.
author: Ganesh I.

description:
I love this place!
I always get the tri tip sandwich and it's delicious!
It's the best I've ever had :)
author: A Z.

description:
Typical franchise food. We had some burgers and they were pretty good. Nothing to write home about. They were cooked when ordered and not reheated. All of the ingredients fresh. 

Service is so-so, asking some of the employees for help seems to annoy them. Sorry, but it's your job. 

Come check this place out if you're venturing to the Metreon. Food is reasonably priced relative to the area.
author: Chuck C.

description:
After getting a free sample of their tri tip I wanted more. The meat was so tender and filled with a lot of flavor! It's pretty pricey, but you are getting quality food. This isn't your kid sister's mall's foodcourt. 

I opted for the salmon dinner platter. Delicious. I loved the mashed potatoes, just the way I like them! 

I would have preferred to eat this at a real sit down restaurant. The ambiance of the foodcourt was a turnoff for me.
author: Cindy K.

description:
Seriously, SO fresh and rejuvenating!
 
After a long day of urban hiking, scouring the racks and trying on hundreds of outfits, my friend and I decided it was about time to refuel, and headed downstairs to food court. Not to be outdone by the city's legendary cuisine, Westfield Mall in downtown SF pools some great options for the urban explorer. After trying a sample tri tip, I was instantly sold on Buckhorn Grill.

Maybe I was a little biased due to my shopping hunger, but my order from Buckhorn WAS something to write home about!

My dish of choice: 
Spring Mix Fruit and Nut Salad, with Tri Tip on top

It was the perfect blend of healthy with hearty. The fruits and salad were extremely fresh and crisp, and the portions were generous. The tri tip is really amazing as well.

If you are visiting SF's downtown area or just out for some shopping, I would highly recommend Buckhorn Grill to refuel after your cardio!
author: Chelsea M.

description: I love their Tri Tip Steak...love it so much that i easily spend 25$ everytime i go...i have been going like 4 times a week...plus your eating healthy...only time i eat vegetables is here...they make eating healthy taste so good
author: A E.

description: I ordered the cheddar bacon sandwich. It was a little small for the price. The meat was cooked medium rare but it was 1/3 fat which was a huge turnoff. I would come back and try something different next time.
author: Emily L.

description: I always have their Roadhouse salad with Tri-tip. LOVE it. and they have a Large plate. The Tri-tip  was juicy and a perfect medium rare.  The greens were fresh and crisp.
author: Sam L.

description:
Wow, I haven't been here in years but I don't remember it ever being this good! I've been here a couple of times in the past but had never really fallen in love with their food. Today, when I went back, something must have changed or maybe I was just really hungry after work.

I was really craving meat so I was debating between Bistro Burger and Buckhorn--I have had subpar experiences at both in the past so it was a toss up. However, Buckhorn reeled me in with their samples--I got a huge chunk of tri tip dipped in au jus and it instantly won me over.

I paid about $12 for a little buck tri tip sandwich with au jus, fries, and a soda. The tri tip was so tender and cooked just right--top it with the au jus and it is just heaven. The meal is filling--I even ended up taking leftovers home. I was extremely satisfied with my meal and I got a $1 offer just for checking in on Yelp. You can bet I'll be back again!
author: Michelle A.

description: This was probably the first time in my life EVER where a sample person actually enticed me to order! Man, their tri tip is bomb!!! I ordered the wrap. The slices of meat were very thin and I kinda felt like it was very sparse in the wrap. The vegetable meat ratio was very off balance. It was a very good try. I think I'll be back to try the stew next.
author: Lynn C.

description:
I honestly have nothing bad to say about Buckhorn. Every time I come here, the quality of food is great and consistent! My favorite dish would have to be the Roadhouse Salad. It's a HUGE portion of delicious greens and if you get it with tri-tip, your tastebuds will be singing the hallelujah chorus. I personally LOVE the taste of meat so I usually get my steaks medium rare, if not, rare and buckhorn serves their meat pretty damn rare so that's great for me! I usually don't eat salads, but this one definitely takes the cake. Another awesome dish would be the Caesar Pleasar. As you can tell from the name it comes with a side of Caesar salad (with bread) and two mouth watering slices of the famous tri-tip. But to finish you off they give you an orgasmic Au Jus sauce to compliment your tri-tip.

Their pricing is average but it's great for what it is. Definitely worth your money, it will leave you feeling stuffed!
author: Brian Y.

description:
Overall - this may be one of my more consistent lunch spots.  Good 'ole Westfield Food Court!  And, about nine times out of ten, I go with the Tri-Tip Flatbread Wrap.  Hint - it is usually on special at $8.50 instead of $11 on Thursdays and Fridays.  

The Tri-Tip Flatbread is full of sliced tri-tip (usually very good - but some consistency issues - stay tuned), as well as blue cheese crumbles, lettuce, fresh mushrooms, cherry tomatoes and red onion.  The flatbread itself is somewhat like a soft pita, with whole wheat flour - very soft and chewy, but it usually holds up well.  If executed correctly, this is a delicious lunch.  I've never tried the salads, but they look very good with lots of good, fresh ingredients.   

Why three stars?  Well - about one out of every three times, the food looks like it's been put together indifferently, which for a wrap (noun, verb and adjective) is important.  There is a swing from visit to visit in terms of quality.  Sometimes, the meat serving is not particularly generous.  I've had a few occasions where the sliced cherry tomatoes are basically a bit frozen.  I tried the Hunter's Stew on my last visit (which, was tasty) but about a third of the meat was basically grizzle - which, for a $13 bowl of stew in a mall food court, is not acceptable.  I've also tried the Chicken Caesar Flatberead, and while it is an alright item for $8.50, it is definitely not work the $11 full price.  I'll also add - the Roadhouse Onions (basically a very long micro-thin jumble of onion strings in batter that do not seperate) are not good.  No flavor, all grease.
