(And, I'm not a health nut who hates greasy food.)  I would never order them again.

Overall - for a chain restaurant in a mall food court, it is pretty good.  Not great.  Not cheap for what it is.  I like the staff at this location, and visit consistently - I'm not one to complain at a restaurant.  But, just a bit too much of a quality swing, and the full price cost for the items I order the most are over-priced.
author: Adam S.

description:
Since I've been taking classes at SFSU, I've been to this place many times.  
Yik Yak salad with tri tip is my go to dish, no fried noodles, dressing on the side.  It's a little pricey with the extra tritip, but worth it I think.  It's good for my low-carb diet.  They're usually fast with my food.  
Yum, I think I'm having this for dinner tonight.
author: Claire J.

description: They screwed up both my order and my coworker's order somehow despite us ordering separately. The soda was like 20% syrup, 80% soda water instead of 50-50. They also took a really long time to take our order, talking to each other instead of running the register.
author: John S.

description: The salads here are really good! I have a difficult time deciding on a choice every time. The portions are also HUGE so you might want to consider sharing. Everything tastes fresh and it is pretty quick from ordering to eating time. I can't say enough about the tri-tip. I am pretty picky about tri-tip and tend to be disappointed when ordering it from a restaurant. Buckhorn Grill never disappoints my hopes. YUMMY!
author: Jenny M.

description:
You will find this place at the food court; their food is delicious! You must love meat to love this place. It's not a food court type of meal. When you get your plate, everyone stares at you and the plate ... or maybe it's because I got 2 huge slices of meat on my plate. 
Staring or not, if you're in the area, you must try it.
author: Care O.

description:
Tasty tri-tip. I always get the papa sized portion, since I'm a fatty.

The food comes out fast and it is consistently tasty. 

The shoe-string onions are a nice garnish.
author: Patrick T.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in Sacramento, and I did not realize it was a chain! My favorite meal to order is the Tri Tip Small Plate ($10) which comes with an enormous amount of roadhouse onions, au jus, and creamy horseradish. Incredibly filling for just ten dollars. The meat was a little too rare and fatty but still comes in a large portion size which is great. Service is also fast so don't be intimidated by the long line. Would recommend out of all the restaurants in the Westfield food court.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
My friend (Helen C.) randomly took me here to try a sample piece of their meat. She said it was probably the best beef she EVER had in a long time and recommended me to have something here one day.

Well, that one day turned out to be a late lunch early dinner. I didn't remember what Helen C. recommended, but I just went with whatever seemed the more appearing, which was the Roadhouse Buck. For $7, it wasn't a bad sandwich, and considering that I just ordered the sandwich itself, it took less than three minutes for my order to come out.

I have to say, this place is pretty good, with the tri-tip seasoned perfectly along with the crispy onions loaded on the sandwich. Now I kind of wish I ordered something more than just the sandwich, because it kind of didn't fill me up.
author: Tom T.

description:
Buckhorn Grill is consistent. Their staff are always helpful and willing to help you with menu substitutions, their food always tastes fresh and it's evident that their dishes  are crafted with some care.

Today I ordered Buckhorn Grill's Cabo salad with no blue-cheese, a different dressing on the side, and also had some beautiful salmon added to it. They were right on it, did so with a big genuine smile and got everything right.

The salad was sensational. They basically put a whole avocado on it, and paired it with black beans,  corn, tomatoes, romaine lettuce, and some jicama for extra crunch. The salmon was well cooked and seasoned, and was only an extra three dollars. I pay about eleven dollars for a similar sized piece of salmon at Catch Isle.

I'm excited about working Buckhorn Grill back into my regular lunch rotation.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Ceasar salad w grilled chicken is very good.  I asked for tomatoes on top and it was awesome.  They could have been a little more generous with the Parmesan cheese, but still very good salad!
author: Ellen B.

description: Day 2: One more clalm chowder again! But this time I found an eggshell in my soup... Okay interesting.
author: Jackie T.

description:
Best tri tip I have ever had!  Their roast tri tip was tender, perfectly seasoned, and done medium-rare, just how I like it.  No au jus needed at all.  And their "dad" plate was enough for both me and the Mrs. so was well worth $17.

The mashed potatoes with gravy were good but not exceptional.  The roasted veggies were very good (except for the corn, which was a little too raw).

They have a frequent customer program that gives a $10 gift certificate for every $100 in cumulative purchases but I didn't sign up because they don't have locations in Hawaii or where I will be traveling any time soon.  That was the only disappointment.
author: Eric M.

description:
Had the tri tip salad. It tasted great but I got a bad case of food poisoning from here.

Please be careful eating here as undercooked meat from a fast food place may be too good to be true.

I have eaten here before with no issues, bit wanted to make sure everyone knows to be careful.
author: Chad J.

description: Very good place for delicious tri-tip at busy Westfield Mall.
author: Trifecter H.

description:
Roadhouse salad with tri-tip. Literally the only salad I like. I'm not a big salad person (makes me feel like a rabbit) but this salad is delicious. It's got paper thin onion rings, cheese (not too stinky), walnuts and DELICIOUS STEAK.

I think I found this place a couple years back and they were handing out free samples of steak and now I eat here EVERY time I go to Westfield mall. Salad here and a cream puff from Beard Papas.
author: Qinshi P.

description:
I used to frequent the embarcadero center location when I worked in the financial district because it's a "different" sandwich from your typical cold deli sandwich and burgers. Since then, I never had the opportunity to find a Buckhorn that was nearby until a friend reminded me that there was one right inside Westfield, how could I have not known?! So I just had to go back and get their sandwiches! I had several different sandwiches there...

Big Buck: I really loved their au jus dipping sauce for the meat, otherwise it'd be a little dry and because the radish sauce was a condiment that you can get as much as you wanted of, I couldn't get enough! It reminded me of actually eating at steak!

Roadside Buck: Oh my god, roadside onions, what are you?! I can't get enough of it. This sandwich has by far become my favorite at Buckhorn; the onions really well with the bleu cheese as well as the tri tip. Who thought of such a thing?!

Crispy Chicken & Avocado Salad: This was recommended by a friend and their chicken strips are really juicy, soft yet crunchy! I wouldn't usually come here for a salad but that was pretty good for a try.

California Burger: Juicy patty that was cooked just right and with a side of roadhouse onions, I can just add it right into the sandwich, I can't say enough just how much I love the onions, even though I'm not typically an onion person but heck, I'd even get that as a side just because I can't get enough of it!

Get yourself the meal deal, it's always worth it! I'm sure to go back for their sandwiches!
author: Judy C.

description:
Food   * | * | * | * 

We ordered the Big Buck Tri Tip - Dad's cut which came out to 12oz of meat for the two of us, with a side of mashed potatoes and grilled veggies.  The Tri Tip was cooked very well, a perfect Medium-Rare with great flavor on the outside.  No complaints here!  The potatoes and gravy were flavorful, with the gravy not being at all overpowering.  Our only grip were the veggies which were a bit tough.

Service   * | * | * | * | *

There really was no service.  We ordered at the counter and promptly received our food a few minutes later.
author: Marexy A.

description:
Tri Tip Flatbread Salad is really good! 
Salad with Feta is fresh and the meat is also great.
Furthermore the portions are big and enough for dinner.
author: Lucas G.

description:
Buckhorn Grill does a lot of things right and tri-tip is one of them. I've been to a few of their locations so I know what to expect. Most recently, I tried an incredible gourmet burger topped with tri-tip at their Bay Street location and was hoping to experience the same here.  I've only been to Westfield a handful of times, so I have no real opinion of their food court other than its much larger than Metreon's. This particular Buckhorn is much smaller than some of their other locations such as Metreon, Emeryville, and Walnut Creek.

There's uniformity in Buckhorn's menu and its the same layout at all locations. I didn't see the burger topped with tri-tip, so I asked the cashier and sad to say, they do no have it at this location but she referred me down the street to Metreon. Hmm. Interesting. A bit disappointed but nonetheless, I ordered the Big Buck which is 6 oz. of their delicious angus beef smoked to a medium-rare finish. I skipped on the cheese and topped off my sando with caramelized onions. 

Buckhorn has reasonable prices with a Big Buck going for $8 plus tax with no drink or side included, but you can make it a meal for a few more bucks. Less than 10 minutes later, my pager was ringing and I had a Big Buck in front of me. The roll isn't toasted but is warm, yet I do wish they had the option to toast them. Nevertheless, the meat is what's important here and it always comes through. The tri-tip was smoked to a perfect medium-rare and was incredibly tender, all of which was topped with caramelized onions and BBQ sauce.

I do like the consistency in food quality at every Buckhorn but I do wish they had all the items at every location. Given this prime location, Buckhorn should make every effort to carry all their special menu items, but I understand they're working within a tight space and may not be able to offer everything their counterparts offer. For what it's worth, a delicious tri-tip sandwich in downtown San Francisco for $8 simply can't be beat and is a must try. 

Ambiance/Decor: 3/5
Food: 4/5
Service: N/A
Price: $$
Overall: 3/5

Pros:
+ Tri-tip is the name of the game
+ Salads, sandwiches, burgers, all featuring tri-tip
+ New items include flatbread salads w/ tri-tip
+ Special menu items at various locations
+ Big portions
+ Beer and wine
+ Reasonable prices
+ Rewards program 

Cons:
- Menu specials not available at every location
author: Alexander E.

description: Exceeded my expectations for mall/food court food. Ordered the Chipotle Tri-Tip with a side of mashed potatoes. Everything tasted pretty good and came out nice and hot. The tri-tip was flavorful and soft!
author: Josh L.

description: The Big Buck sandwich was absolute heaven. Perfectly cooked tri-tip slices to medium rare with au jus sauce. The only problem is that the portion was not worth $10. I had to order two in order to fill myself up.
author: Anthony L.

description: Wow!!!!!! I am absolutely blown away by this restaurant. My boyfriend and I went there for lunch today. I got the Philly Buck sandwich, which had thinly sliced tri-tip, sautéed peppers and onions, provolone cheese, and of course, AVOCADO. The sandwich cost about ten bucks, but it was ABSOLUTELY worth it!!!! My boyfriend ordered the Big Buck sandwich, which was just tri-tip, but he ordered cheese with it. The only disappointing part was that they were supposed to offer either a side of au jus, or sautéed peppers, but they didn't offer. We should have told them they forgot the sautéed peppers, but we didn't because both of the sandwiches were so exceptional. This was our first time at the Westfield mall in San Francisco, and I only WISH they had a Buckhorn where I'm from!!!!!
author: Lindsay R.

description:
It is hard to build a salad worthy of mentioning and buckhorn grill unexpectedly did that! Huge portion that can easily feed two people. 

We had the roadhouse salad with tri tip that was topped with a mound of fried onions- there were none left when we were done. Usually fried onions have their oniony goodness fried out of them but these were amazing. Other components were romaine lettuce, cherry tomatoes, purple cabbage, carrots, green beans, and of course the tri tip which was cooked medium rare and super tender and flavorful. Can't put a name to the vinaigrette but it is sweet from the honey in it and complemented well. One of the gripes I have with salads is that there is too much or too little dressing and not incorporated well enough but buckhorn did it right. 

My new favorite stop the next time I go to Westfield.
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
Since the Westfield mall is located in the middle of SoMa, the food-court here is a teeming mass of students and employees during weekday lunch hour. Despite the long lines, however, my friend and I managed to put in our order and get our food within 10 minutes. 

I am the last person in the world to be content with a salad as a meal, but I was suckered into ordering at Buckhorn because my friend wanted a healthy lunch. I ordered the tri-tip salad on flatbread, while my friend got the chicken and avocado salad. For all my misgivings, the salad was delicious and filling-- great quality slices of meat on top, good portion sizes, and soft flatbread. My friend enjoyed his dish as well.

To sum up, the price of my Buckhorn meal was the only drawback for me-- paying close to 12 dollars on a salad at a fast-food joint, no matter how delicious and filling, seems a bit overboard. Will probably not be back for that reason, but all in all had a satisfying lunch here.
author: Esther W.

description:
*This particular location is in the Westfield Mall, so it's not exactly prime real estate, but a great option if you want something fast and satisfying.*

I always get the same thing here. "Roadhouse Salad + Tri-tip" to go.

I think I've eaten here at least twenty times and it's always fresh and delicious. The portions are super generous and the food is always consistently good. It's a great option for days when I get off work and want something healthy and convenient to take home. 

Tip #1: They have small to go containers near the pick-up area that you can fill with ranch, horseradish sauce, or BBQ sauce. 

Tip #2: If you go here as often as I do, join the rewards program.  You just give them your phone number every time you order and when you spend $100, you get $10 worth of credit toward your next purchase.
author: Yanni L.

description:
Reviewing them more for catering services. 

back when they had the old manager...I forgot his name...older guy with glasses, he was really awesome, even when I ordered just a couple of items, not quite a catering order, he'd still be able to have them deliver to us (we're pretty close by). no we're not lazy, we're busy!

but now they have a new manager, and he's more strict! but they are usually always on time, and the price is decent. the sandwiches everyone loves. their salad is good. 

personally I've only tried their crispy chicken avocado salad and that's super filling. I skip on the blue cheese BLAH.

and had the chicken mushroom sandwich? even the veggie sandwiches are delicious!

definite to go if you can't decide.
author: Christine M.

description: HORRIBLE service, they're rude and short and we even told them "it seems like you're getting a little upset with us because our order is complicated" and the cashier replied "probably". Everyone was rude. The food is not good. This wrap is all lettuce and I have three little tiny peices of chicken that are dry in it. Awful. Waste of or money. Wasted our last dinner in San Francisco on this place. You need more then young teen kids working behind your counter that now how to respect customers
author: Ashley A.

description:
The place for beef

Great backyard grill flavor. Best tri tip ever.
Perfect place for protein.
The beef sandwich is great with their bbq sauce too.

Onion strings are fresh but just ok tasting.
author: Philip L.

description: I ordered a flatbread and a buck horn salad with chicken. They came in gigantic portions, but it probably explains why they're so expnsive -____- their tri tip was salty, and i dont even know what kinda string fries i was eating on top of the salad. The only thing i liked was the fries which i dont think im probably come back for
author: Cherry Y.

description: For over 5 years I have been going to this specific buckhorn grill. I want to thank them for 5 years of fantastic meals I must have spent thousands here lol. Employees are nice and very helpful, food is good and is prepared quickly I recommend the tri tip steak platter, tri tip flatbread wrap and their grilled chicken breast, their mashed potatos are some of the best I have ever had. They also have a rewards program which is nice if you eat here alot like I do. Overall unless a catastrophe happens they have me as a customer for life!
author: Abdul Qader R.

description:
I'm surprised I come here so often considering I rarely ever eat meat...

Love this place for what it's for: a quick, fast food steakhouse with a variety of meats such as tri-tip sirloin, chicken, and salmon, and options such as burgers, sandwiches, wraps, and platters. The quality is MUCH better than you'd expect, and actually pretty damn good for its price (~$15 for my usual: the char-broiled tri-tip platter that comes with mashed potatoes, roasted veggies, au jus (SO DELICIOUS), and cornbread). The steak won't remind you of any fine dining experiences, but it's juicy, well seasoned, and actually quite lean (I'm one of those people who hates the fatty parts). It's really just comfort food, and I think steak enthusiasts will find it a fast, filling place.

There are an overwhelming number of options in the Westfield food court, but I always find myself gravitating here. I'd rather not take the risk of eating Thai food that's been sitting under a heat lamp all day.. $15 for a good steak with sides is a pretty good deal, and the portions are so huge, usually one platter will last me two meals. Be sure to ask for the order "to go" rather than "here" because then you can just box up your leftovers rather than having to transfer your half-eaten beef remains to a new box and spill gravy and bloody meat juices everywhere, etc. etc.
author: Regan T.

description:
I ordered the chipotle border buck and they gave me a burger. My friend ordered the same thing and also got a burger. So I guess they're consistently wrong at least. 

The burger was really good though, so I'm a little conflicted. If you want a chipotle burger, eat here. 

Also, the fries didn't have enough potato. #realfrieshavepotato
author: Daniel S.

description:
First time I came here, I ordered the tri tip platter to go.. it was really good, the steaks were in a great size and everything was yummy.
Came here yesterday on my birthday and got the same dish, this time to eat here.... turned out to be terrible. WTF happened to the steaks? they were cut so thin, i could barely taste the steak... everything was in a strange and more frugal portion. 
I don't think I'll come back... maybe they cut down on the sizes, the tri tip platter's steak was so thin like paper and they didn't even include corn like the one i got last time. did i ordered the wrong on or did they just messed up my order?
author: Dan T.

description:
I like Buckhorn because they often have someone handing out samples of tri tip at the line.  I've eaten Buckhorn many times, but I can never resist a free meat sample!  

My tip about this place is that you can order a side salad for less than $5 and it's big enough for a full meal.  For an additional $3 you can add the amazing tri tip to it or grilled chicken.  I've had a couple of their salads, including the one that comes in the giant taco shell bowl and the one that has the crispy onions on it.  The names of these salads are escaping my mind right now, but they're both delicious.  

I once ordered a daily special that was called the Chipotle Chicken sandwich.  I was disappointed with my selection, the chipotle sauce on it was gross so I just ate the chicken with a fork and left the soggy  bun on the plate.  

Back to the positives:  Buckhorn offers a discount to mall employees and has many wines to offer to pair with your tri tip.  The menu also includes a kids section at reasonable prices.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Some of the best mall food I have ever had. I can only wish that So Cal / Los Angeles malls had food courts with quietly, healthy, and fresh food like this......and all for a great price.

I had the two chicken breast with special honey mustard dip for $7.99. The chicken was very juicy with a lot of flavor and just perfect with the honey mustard making it even more memorable. 

Get you some if you're at that mall.
author: Tim R.

description: NOPE, NOT your typical mall food. SOOO much better!! You HAVE to come here at least once when you're at this shopping center. I ordered the Char-Roasted Sirloin Tri-Tip which comes with mashed potatoes and vegetables. OMG, the tri-tip was amazing, thick and juicy! LOL. The vegetables weren't your typical out of the can vegetables, but forreal, cut out fresh and cooked, because they were huge sizes as well! It included peppers and asparagus, omg sooo good.
author: Veronica A.

description: I'm ashamed to admit that I love a sandwich from a chain restaurant but... the tri-tip wrap is delicious. Super flavorful tri-tip wrapped up with romaine lettuce, dressing all in a chewy carbalicious wrap.
author: Jess C.

description: I had the Tri Tip Small Platter, which was 8oz. of sliced tri tip on top of a bed of fried onions. The beef was pretty well-seasoned and had enough salt to bring out the beefiness along the edges, but the flavor didn't penetrate to the center. The meat was cooked to about medium and also cut into pretty thick pieces so it was on the tougher side. It really helps a lot to not cook tri tip past medium rare and carve it into thinner slices...
author: Nei N.

description:
I came to the mall with a few friends and their girlfriends in preparation for a wedding. Needless to say, we spent many, many, many hours in this mall and hunger got the best of me. I made two laps around the food court, scanning for potential food stands that will earn my business and this grill won by a long shot. Not because there aren't any other good choices, but this place looked like the portions were large enough to satisfy my hunger and they wouldn't skimp on the meat which many food stands often do.

The sandwich was hardy and had lots of meat. After I finished my meal, I was glad I did not get any fries. My only complaint is I felt the price was a little too high. Otherwise, the meal was great. Quality, size, taste are all up to par.

I wouldn't drive just to eat here (I would be crazy to drive in downtown SF period, walking is the best way to get around) but if you are in the neighborhood, grab some lunch!
author: Russell G.

description:
Told myself that I would never review a food court restaurant but atlas I should try to stop using the word Never. 

The meal I had was really good. It was a salad with grilled chicken. Ultra fresh veggies and well grilled seasoned chicken did me right. I was in the area for business and while I would not hit this place up for "date night" I would go again for lunch. 

Big portions and higher than normal cost might scare some folks away but I recommend staying in line and going for it.
author: Ryan B.

description: I had the Caesar Salad with Tri-Tip.  The salad was huge but I wish there were more Tri-Tip.  The lettuce was disproportionate to the meat.  Pretty no-frills. It cost $11.06 including tax.  Next time I'll try one of the specialty salads.
author: Paul A.

description:
Those little samples of tri-tip that they offer up as you walk past?  CRACK!  

Okay, not really, but they have pretty much the same result:  MORE, MORE, MORE... GIVE ME MORE TRI-TIP!!!  (And I'm not even a big meat-eater)...

A few months ago, knowing that CA loves this place, I laid out $20 for Groupons giving me $40 worth of food.  They were about to expire, so it was time to get down to the food court where normally I'd be tempted away by the sight of Korean BBQ.  Not this time though; not with paid for food chits sitting in my pocket.  

Here's how it went down:

1.  We sampled a few pieces of crack, er, tri-tip.

2.  Jammer ordered up some sort of tri-tip and chicken combo surrounded by a sea of fresh roasted vegetables.  He polished it off with a beer and then had to untuck his shirt so that he could unbutton his pants.  Oink, oink.  

3.  Weffster ordered up some sort of tri-tip sandwich with those shoestring thin fried onions, blue cheese, and a side of mashed potatoes with gravy.  He got through the mashers and was too full to eat much of the sandwich.  Mmmm... leftovers!

4.  I got myself a salad that was piled so high with shoestring thin fried onions, blue cheese, tri-tip, walnuts, and lettuce, that it sat a good 6-inches off the plate.  Honest; the people we sat down beside felt compelled to comment on its size.  And I, dear Yelper, POLISHED THAT BABY OFF!!  It was dee-lish-ous!!!

And, thanks to those Groupons, we got all of that for $20.

Buckhorn may not be the fanciest joint around (it's in a food court, after all), but the food is solid, filling, reasonably priced, cheap with Groupons, and really, really good.  Also, take note, if you eat here often, they offer some sort of $10 gift certificate for every $100 spent. 

They even sell bottles of wine for $13.99.  Where you gonna find a deal like that?
author: Tracey A.

description:
The anxiety involved in eating here knocks a star off the rating. It's crowded and rushed and the Shui is completely out of Feng. If you have 20 people lined up to order and pick up food, it's probably a bad idea to completely block the flatware for 10 minutes. 

This area of the mall seems to be the place to be at about 6pm on a Saturday. I'll be avoiding it next time. I don't play well with others. 

On to the food! 

The fries were tasty, perfectly crispy with a nice flavor. 

The sandwich was pretty good. I'm fairly sure it's not the best tri-tip on the market but it'll do.  The meat is served medium rare which means that Sexy Beast (who likes his bovines completely dead, grey, charred) will likely never try it.  

The bread was fresh with a nice crust. My diet soda was almost empty by the time my order was ready and to get another would have required standing in that ridiculous line again. Not too pleased about that.
author: Victoria T.

description:
(See pic)

I had a coupon for $20 so instead of getting my usual salad, I went for the tri-tip and chicken combo. The tri-tip was okay medium rare but the chicken was very dry. It came with some grilled vegetables that were just not good at all. It also came with mashed potatoes and it was just not appetizing.

I added a French onion soup. It was with lots of cheese and was salty.

I felt like I wasted the coupon and should have ordered all salad.

What I did observe was that the kitchen area was not very clean. The floor had fries that fell.

I will stick with my salad next time.
author: T L.

description: Had tri tip and it was so dry. The sandwich was huge, but not worth the price.  Flavor was lacking as well. I'd stay away if you're looking for real good juicy tri tip.
author: Sheena W.

description:
The Big Buck Sandwich is deadly and delicious.  Big steak, soft and mild blue cheese, and amazing fried onions.  All on a warm roll.  Nice.

The fries and the drink really aren't worth the extra money, though.  There's nothing special about the fries and the drink is dinky.
author: Bill H.

description:
Buckhorn!!!! My go to place when I want a salad. I will warn you that the tri tip is mouth watering. You try it and you won't stop going back. 

My usual meal is the ceaser pleaser with tri tip. It is basically a gigantic ceaser salad with 2 gigantic pieces of tri tip.

Can't go wrong with a fat piece of tri tip. And when it's 2 that's jackpot.
author: Quyenna T.

description: The business is located towards the end of the row of restaurants, so when there is a conference nearby, the line is relatively short here. Food is pretty good too. The California burger comes with bacon which is deliciously made.
author: Taron G.

description: Delicious charred grilled tri tip for a really good price! Can't beat that! The 7 Oz for $13.99 is perfect for one person and I would recommend pairing it with grilled vegetables.
author: Lora M.

description: Love this place.  For a salad location in a mall it is excellent.  The roadhouse salad is excellent with chicken or tri tip 13.95.   Diet coke.  They also serve sandwiches but I never make it by the great tri tip.
author: Bonnie S.

description: Walking around westfield mall made me work up an appetite, so i decided to go down to the dungeon of food... I had a chicken avocado with bacon sandwich, the chicken was cooked just right. The bacon was nice and crispy with cheese on it. Had the meal with a side of mashed potatoes and an ice tea. Belly is full and now time to shop some more!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Really good food. Service is good. 

The food always tastes pretty fresh (except their fries which taste like they were from a bag, but it's kind of like a fast food joint so...) The mashed potatoes are good. The meat is cooked very well and tastes soft and juicy. Their hamburgers are pretty good as well. They're very well balanced in terms of flavor and always are big enough to fill you up. 

The only bad I can think of is that it's a bit over priced, but not ridiculous. And their soda often tastes flat or watered down. Other than that, great food and service.
author: Christopher S.

description: I gave four star because the food is pretty good for a fast food place. But not your average fast food restaurant. Good portions and price. Its located inside the food court in Westfield. The menu ranges from steak, chicken, salmon, veggies and sandwich etc etc! Even the salads are pretty interesting. Very good deal for what it is!
author: Anudari K.

description: Always a solid lunch choice, the Cheddar Buck is a serious amount of good food and fries.
author: Doug M.

description:
If only all food court food can be this good! 

Salads are fresh and are huge! Two types of grilled salmon, I believe the Alaskan is a dollar or two more. They have daily specials, and one day I got the mushroom burger and it was unforgettable. I would randomly check to see if they had it other trips to the mall. But what really has me coming back for more is the tri-tip platters. Usually roasted to a medium/medium well. You can get it with just the onion strings- which they're not too greedy with or as a meal with their yummy mashed potatoes, veggies, bread and butter. 

Leftover tri-tip is bomb the next day, with some eggs and toast too! =)
author: S Y.

description: I've been craving tri-tip dipped sandwiches ever since I ate here. Open one in SoCal! A bit pricey but totally worth it for the salty meat gasasm
author: Derrick L.

description:
I had the Lil Buck sandwich with fries.

the Sandwich was good.. ! I am not really into 
tri tip and I liked it ..

the fries were warm and crispy.. 

customer service was great. ! 

I would come back .. maybe to try out there huge 
salads they looked yummy!
author: T. C.

description:
Consistently awesome Tri-Tip! And quick too!

I've been enjoying the tri-tip from Buckhorn Grill for years.  My bf and I always order the small plate to share because their portions are decent.  For $8.99, you get 4 slices (1/2" thick, 2-3" diameter) of deliciously flavored meat.  The cashier always ask me if medium-rare is alright and I want to shout "It better be!"  PLEASE do not get it cooked anymore than medium-rare!  The slices are served atop a generous helping of thin fried "Roadhouse" onions with a cup of hot au-jus and creamy horseradish for dipping.  I normally have a hard time with horseradish sauce but the Buckhorn version is mild enough that I can see how this enhances the flavor of tri-tip.  

The reason we order the small plate is so we have stomach room to try other items.  Their clam chowder is satisfying and comes with a nice little roll and butter.  Sometimes we make a mini tri-tip roll with this. 

Recently, I tried the Bacon Cheddar Buck, which is a sandwich with thinly-sliced tri-tip, applewood smoked bacon, cheddar cheese and red ranch sauce tucked into a sweet french roll.  It was delicious, especially dipped in the au jus.  

Bonus - I get emails about the monthly specials and November's deal was a burger for $5.99.  However, the Buckhorn located in the Westfield San Francisco Centre Food Emporium does not serve burger sand was offering any sandwich instead for  $5.99.  The Bacon Cheddar Buck is def. worth this, but I wouldn't pay full price ($7.99).

The tri-tip is never anything short of delicious and is always a must when I eat at this food court. =D
author: Jennifer T.

description:
So many great food court options at the Westfield mall and this is one of them! The tri-tip sample was juicy and tasty... Maybe a little too salty? Oh well, it was free!

I opted to get the Cabo Chop salad ($7.99) and added grilled chicken ($2.50). I ordered it to-go just in case I had leftovers. After paying, they gave me a pager for when my food would be ready. Since my sister had already gotten her food (from Coriander Thai), we went to go hunt down a table. On a Sunday evening, it was pretty busy, but we didn't have to go table-stalking and pounce once a table opened up. We found a nice clean table for two and then my pager went off!

My order was all ready to go in a plastic container put inside a Buckhorn Grill baggy. However, when I went to the table, I noticed they didn't put any utensils in there! So, I got up and went to go get some silverware from the counter. Trying to be healthy, I asked for the dressing on the side and drizzled a bit over my salad. The honey-lime dressing was slightly sweet and nicely refreshing. For the price (of course, food-court fare in this mall is slightly inflated), the serving size was fair. It was a massive entree-sized portion of romaine lettuce, jicama sticks, slices of radish, black beans, corn, baby tomatoes, crumbled blue cheese, and half an avocado!

The chicken was tasty, nicely seasoned, and moist (not dry like some other places)! Everything else looked and tasted fresh! It was served in a giant tortilla bowl that I had a few bites of.

I was quite satisfied with my meal and happy that I had a filling, yet healthy meal at the mall. I'll definitely go back here if I want something healthy while in the area.

(And YAY for some quality time with the Sis!)
author: Leana L.

description:
OK, this special really was special!  

So the Buckhorn Grill sends out a monthly specials email, and sometimes the Downtown Centre store participates.  This month they offered a Caesar salad with tri-tip on top, for just $7.  When I got to the store, I read that the Caesar salad alone was $7, and the tri-tip was $3 more.  Score!  We're talking a 30% discount!  

My Lady met me for dinner here, and was just as enthusiastic as I.  Together we ordered 2 of the specials and 2 glasses of Kenwood chardonnay -- alcohol easily doubles the price of the dinner -- for a grand total of $29.81.  

Let me say that the Caesar salad was delicious.  So was the tri-tip.  So was the chardonnay.  Did I leave anything out?  Oh yes -- the metal utensils, stoneware plates, and stemmed wine glasses.  This raises fast food dining to a new level, yes?  If you disagree, you have been going to the Downtown Centre too much, you jaded mall rat.  Look around: this is a deal, and the food and the setting are awesome!
author: David D.

description:
Walking around the entire food court is somewhat overwelming. I kept pondering to myself..."hmmm what to eat? korean food? thai food? mexican food? vegan? burgers? crepes?.............!!!!"

What caught my eyes were the big salads on display at Buckhorn. I ended up getting the chicken salad and i LOVED it. My BF got the the phillybuck and was disappointed due to the lack of flavor and sauce. 

I will be back for the salads, but not so much for the meat!
author: M W.

description: This is a really good fast food concept.  I like the philly cheesesteak one.
author: Mike C.

description: Westfield Mall is my fav mall to shop at. When I heard they had a Buckhorn Grill I was excited! They didn't disappoint me. The Krispy Avacado Chicken Salad is the best I've ever had! Definitely going back again.
author: Annette R.

description:
I loved the tri tip steak served on a bed of onion rings.  The taste of the meat was awesome and unexpected.  I think if you are 
Shopping in tHe area this is a must try!!
author: Jamel O.

description: Was amazed to see this quality of fare in a food court. Friendly service (expediter not too tech savvy).  Good job Buckhorn
author: Tim W.

description: Food quality is great specially tri tip and they are not expensive . Probably best thing to eat in Westfield
author: İsmail Cem E.

description:
Not what I expected as "mall food" -- a big cut above!  

The portions were large, so we split a tri-tip salad on flatbread.  Very tasty.  The side of "fire roasted" vegetable turned out to be as described -- a delicious, woody charred flavor on a variety of veggies including peppers, potatoes, squash, and asperagus.  So much better than we'd imaginged for a quick bite after a movie upstairs.  

The only disappointment was that the actual salad had significantly less tri-tip than the "model" version they showed, which was a shame since the meat was delicious.  A minor "bait-and-switch" that I'll generally overlook, but knocks it down from a 5 star.
author: Paul R.

description:
The sirloin tri-tip could not be tender even if it's life depended on it! Cause the tri tip was so chewy that I felt like I was chewing gum =[ 

Needless to say, buckhorn grill is a no go!
author: Maggie C.

description: I love their tri tip. I order the big buck sandwich with mash potato and crispy onion strings. What makes me love my sandwich more is I put the mash potato and the onion strings in my sandwich! Soooo good!
author: Roger P.

description: I love the Tri Tip Flatbread you can have it with beef, chicken or salmon . . Healthy and filling
author: Motaz E.

description: The Roadhouse Salad is amazing, best salad I've had all year.  Fresh ingredients and a generous portion.  Definitely ordering again!
author: Gman F.

description: You would be hard-pressed to find me eating in a food court in the mall but I just happened to walk by Buckhorn Grill when they were giving out samples of their tri tip. I am pretty sure that this was the one and only time I actually stopped in my tracks and decided to eat in a food court because their tri tip was that good. They say it is some of the best and well - they were right! I had the Greek Salad and added tri-tip on top...it was darn delicious!
author: S R.

description: Stopped here to grab a bite to eat before heading to the theater... what great food and they were really quick considering it was a lunch rush at the mall. Very happy with my meal!
author: Travis H.

description:
Buckhorns is my go to in Westfield Center.

This review is just for the Little Spike. It's a kids meal that is enough for an adult portion: small drink (and it is a genuine small, not fast food size), fries, and 4 oz of tri-tip on a roll.

Value: 5 stars  -$6, it's less than $1 more than one of McD's quarter pound value meals. 1/4 pound of tri-tip vs a factory burger.
Quality: 5 stars (or close enough)
Service: reliable. I've never felt like I'd been waiting a long time.

There are a variety of sauces, so you can customize your dipping sauce for fries. Preferred is a spicy mix of ketchup and horseradish.

The tri-tip is very tender, and it stays on the substantial bun.

If you want meat and lots of it, there's the bigger choices.
author: Steve L.

description:
Good salad, quick service. 

I had a tostada and my friend had some chop salad.  The tostada is greasier than all hell but tastes so good. I wouldn't recommend eating more than a few pieces.  Both salads looked huge but I think it's just piledhigh with lettuce with lots of air pockets.

I would recommend someone going here if they wanted an expensive salad. It's mall food but you get what you pay for.  I added chicken and he added steak. 

Enjoyable meals!
author: Toby I.

description:
One of my favorite places to eat in the Westfield San Francisco Centre Food Emporium.

Normally, I don't enjoy eating beef, but since my partner is a huge beef eater (big, fat slabs of bloody steak and all), I decided that I can't really get away from it. I tried some of Buckhorn Grill's tri-tip today over Greek salad, and I must admit, I'm a fan.

Although I don't think I'm ready to take on a full slab of bloody steak, taking small steps in eating burgers and tri-tip, like today, is definitely helping. It truly does help when the tri-tip is ahhhhh-mazinggggg.

My lunch: Tri-tip over Greek salad. The Greek salad was good. Nothing too fancy. Just as a Greek salad should be. The salad came with four yummy, crispy breadsticks; and the tri-tip placed on top were delicious. They melted in my mouth. For $12, it was simply, a great lunch.

Service is fast and they have complimentary sauces and water.

I'm a fan, and I shall return. Next stop, STEAK!
author: Mike N.

description: Most people think mall food is on the crappy end of the food chain but not the SF westfield mall, which host great variety of good food including this chain. I was iffy when I saw someone in their apron handing out samples of tri-tip to people but after having a kid's meal, thanks Jan P. for the tip, I absolutely loved it. I had the little spike for about $6 or $7 and it had a lot of flavor but I decided to get a side of the bbq sauce which they have at their condiments section. It also came with fries and a drink, which considering SF higher prices for minimal things included in meals, that was pretty good.
author: Desiree C.

description: This was such a great choice!  Unbelievable food, great quality, so delicious.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Jerry P.

description: Not as good as the Buckhorn Grill in the Metreon. Go to that one for better service and the same food.
author: Luke F.

description:
pricey, but for me, the best place in the food court...and that food court is pretty top notch. the sandwiches and fries are really good, and the wait for your order is about average, it's just the price that kind of deters me from going back as often as i would...which actually may be a blessing in disguise.

PS...don't order salads! if you order salads at a place like this, lower your head in shame wuss.
author: Mike C.

description:
Juicy, tender, flavorful tri-tip cooked medium-rare from a food court?!?! YES, YES, YES; YOU BETTER BELIEVE IT!!!

Buckhorn is one of the best options at the Westfield Food Court in terms of quality, pricing, and taste. I frequent Buckhorn about once a week and the food has ALWAYS been consistent. 

My Go-Tos are the following:

*Cabo Chop Salad w/ Tri-Tip (Romaine lettuce with avocado, black beans, corn, jicama, radishes, tomatoes and blue cheese dressed in a honey-lime dressing and placed in a crispy tortilla bowl): MY FAV!!!  The romaine is lightly dressed and then the remaining ingredients are piled up high. The ingredients are always fresh and vibrant in color. The tri-tip is tender and very well-seasoned. The blue cheese and honey-lime dressing work well in adding a savory, sweet, and tangy flavor which I love! Break off a piece of the tortilla bowl for that *CRUNCH*!

*Roadhouse Salad w/ Tri-Tip (Mixed greens with crispy Roadhouse onions, string beans, tomatoes, bleu cheese crumbles & sweet Mariani walnuts tossed w/ honey basil vinaigrette): Although it's probably one of the most unhealthiest salads you can probably eat, it's also one of the most YUMMIEST! It has all the combination of flavors and textures you can ask for. The savory and salty from the Tri-Tip, the crisp from the Roadhouse onions (yummy shoe string onions), the tang from blue cheese and the sweet from the candied walnuts and honey vinaigrette. 

For the salads, request that the tri-tip be sliced into cubes and not strips b/c it will make it a whole lot easier to eat! BTW, they don't skimp on the meat portions!

*Roadhouse Buck (Tri-tip with Roadhouse Onions & Red Ranch sauce topped with bleu cheese crumbles). HOLY MOLY!!! This is one of the BEST tasting sandwiches EVER!!!! The 6 oz. tri-tip is sliced thick, cooked medium rare, tender and very well-seasoned. As you bite into it, you can taste all the juices still flowing out of it (no au jus needed). Ahhhhh!!! I love blue cheese esp with red meat....and in this case it adds a tangy, creaminess to the sandwich while the Roadhouse onions add that crisp and the red ranch a spicy kick. 

They normally prepare the tri-tip medium rare, but you can always request it to be cooked further to a medium, medium-well, and well. 

PRICES: Very reasonable considering the massive portions. 
*Sandwiches are about $6.95. For an additional $2.45 you can get fries, mashers, Roadhouse Onions, or a salad and a drink. 
*Salads are about $7-9 and you can add chicken or tri-tip for $2.50 or salmon for $3.00.
*Platters (meat and sides) are about $13.
*Whole tri-tip to take home is $19.95!!!!

SERVICE: Fast and friendly. They give you a pager while they're preparing your food, so take this time to find seating. During peak hours, it takes about 5-7 minutes to get your food.

Nothing can come between this girl and a good piece of red meat, so I will be back AGAIN, AGAIN, and AGAIN!!!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Had the roadhouse salad and always enjoy the crispy fried onion strings on top.  They put a good mix of veggies in it as well as bleu cheese.

The reason I don't give it 4 stars is because there were a few big chunks of lettuce root.  That is the really white part and not even green.  The fried onions also would have been better if they were hot.

I think I will try the tri tip next time.
author: James H.

description:
Buckhorn Grill is mostly found in malls, but they're quite good and tasty for mall food. The food is expensive as other mall foods found, but the quality difference really shows.

Bacon Cheddar Buck! Probably one of their most unhealthy sandwiches they offer, but it's really tasty and fills you up nicely. Nice thick sliced bacons with a great creamy sweet ranch-like sauce.

Their salads are alright, but they're quite expensive. One thing that's not on the menu that can be order is a chipotle chicken sandwich.

The line moves pretty quick and the sandwiches are usually made within 5-10 minutes. Perfect for a quick lunch. They got a good and efficient buzzer system going.
author: Steven B.

description:
Their salmon is great!!! 

I got the Greek salad with salmon, which was pretty awesome. Not too greasy, and the salmon was very tender and flavorful. 

The service was good for mall food. They give you a buzzer to tell you when the food's done so you don't have to wait in line. 

My mom didn't like her tri tip -- wayyy too salty. Maybe it was an off day, but the tri tip was tough, salty, and overcooked.
author: Sarah B.

description: Found this place on yelp and it was only a 5 min walk from where we were staying. Ordered the bacon cheddar buck and the chipotle buck. Both were very good. It was a bit smaller than I expected but they stuff it with tri tip and other fixings to make up for it.  They offer onion strings or something as one of the salads and kid you not... they are definitely strings. I wouldn't order those again probably. And their soda was kind of weird... just didn't taste right. It was like sparkling water with a little syrup or something. Overall, the sandwiches were very tasty but I don't think it'd be at the top of my list of must go to places.
author: Angela Y.

description: I been here about a billion times.  I never stray from my favorite.  Tri-tip with bacon and cheddar.  The tri-tip is cooked well, the bacon is nice and thickly sliced and the cheddar is good.  Basically the perfect combination.  It may be considered fast food, but don't be a food snob.  Try it out, son!
author: Chris P.

description:
It was the free sample of the tri tip which sold us.

My hubby ordered the chicken and tri tip combo with veggies, mashed potatoes, and bread. Yum. The tri tip was moist, and the rub was awesome! The chicken was a little overcooked, but still somewhat moist. The grilled veggies were yummy, and the mashed potatoes had a lot of butter. Otherwise, the tri tip was the star of the dish!

I had the cabo chopped salad with tomatoes, avocado, black beans, jicama, corn, radishes, and a honey lime dressing. Yum! The dressing was sweet and brought out the flavors of the salad. I asked for the dressing and the blue cheese on the side. The salad was huge!

We spent around $24 for lunch, but the dishes were yummy! Delicious food for being in an upscale food court.
author: Jackie S.

description:
I was inspired to write a review of this place from someone else who recently returned from San Francisco, and I keep forgetting the name of this place.  I usually tell people to look for the food court in the basement of the Bloomingdale's mall on Market st.  I've never been able to tell people properly that it's Buckhorn Grill at the San Francisco Center.

Forget that this piece of meat is coming from a fast food counter, it's still one of the best places to get grilled meat anywhere!  Pound for pound, dollar for dollar its the best steak grill place in North America, and I've tried many places.  Okay, I haven't been down to Texas or Alberta.

Anyways, I've only dreamt about a couple of food places (this little lobster shack in New England) and Buckhorn.

I'd kill to have this place within a 5 hour drive.
author: Tony F.

description: I've only been there one time, but the hefty Bacon Cheddar burger and large portion of fries made my day!!! I will return to try other things on the menu!
author: Greg T.

description: I ordered the char-broiled chicken sandwich and it was great! My mom ordered something off of the display case and it looked just like it, so props to them for being accurate with that. It was tasty and the portions were big so 4 stars. I'd come back if I was in the area.
author: Lisa P.

description: Had lunch here with my fabulous friend. I got a portobello mushroom sandwich which was gunners and he got a chicken avocado salad. Lots of salad options and it seemed popular. I have favorites in this food court which I usually stick to but nice to try a new to me spot.
author: Bebe W.

description:
This location is located at the Food Emporium of the Westfield Shopping Center downtown.

Order the 4 oz. marinated tri tip sandwich with carmelized onions if you're craving red meat, but don't want to eat too much of it.  It comes in a sandwich roll with au jus on the side. 

Dip the sandwich and take a bit of the meat with the carmelized onions.  Perfect combination.
author: Shirley N.

description: Great quality roast beef for a very affordable price.  Customer service at this location is great.
author: Gabi P.

description:
I'm here on four out of five trips to the Westfield Shopping Center's food court. Sometimes it's for the 6-oz. Char-Roasted Sirloin Tri-Tip Regular ($12.95), sometimes the same but a "small-plate" version ($7.95), sometimes it's for the Chicken & Tri-Tip Combo ($13.95). Must have tri-tip though. And a Sierra Nevada.

Since it's a food court, can't say much more - but they do give you stainless stell utensils and nice napkins. Some day, would like to visit their actual restaurant, yeah.
author: Peter L.

description: This place gives you good food and huge portions in SF Center.
author: Mark L.

description:
September 19, 2009 @ 5:30 PM, Pre-Movie Dinner at the Metreon with Boyfriend

A.  MOVIE:  CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS (On 3D) Supercute with 3D action all throughout the whole movie! It's so cute I want to see it again on 3D!

B.  PRE-MOVIE:   BUCKHORN GRILL
What is there not to go BUCKWILD over LITTLE BUCK?! We're talking about a delicious and flavorful  big piece of steak in a bun. Top it with some of those addicting Buckhorn FRIED ONIONS  and put as much or less of that sweet barbecue sauce. Your mouth is in STEAK SANDWICH HEAVEN! 

Well, some of us are crazy enough to turn down Big Buck--like me.  It's not like I don't recognize good stuff if I see one. It's just that I made a half-a** promise to be healthier and doing a semi-decent job about it. 

And I am sick, sick, sick of chicken!!!! No CHICKEN BUCK for me so I chose  PORTABELLA MUSHROOM SANDWICH. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/AeKh9lnUsOzbuLu_s5Zvlw?select=ma4kj3i-GcEm_8_JFQfd1Q It was not the same as a piece of juicy beef but that thing is not only GIGANTIC but PRETTY GOOD for a 'shroom.  It was grilled, tender and juicy. I ate it like how I would have eaten my Little Buck--with plenty of onion strings and doused with barbecue sauce. It was so filling it I was still full until after the movie. So, if you are a veggie or just want to try this thing--go for it! It's delicious!

Total:  1 Philly Buck with Fries http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/AeKh9lnUsOzbuLu_s5Zvlw?select=Y-OERw0f0ZM3oLKBag_oyw and Soda (BF) 1 Portabella with Fries and Soda (Me)= $21. 58 (with tax not including tip)
            

C. POST-MOVIE:  MARICA SEAFOOD RESTAURANT  @ 9:15 pm
I hate writing updates but BF and I found ourselves at 'MARICA" at Rockridge Oakland  once again  devouring oysters, drinking cosmo. He had his main dish. I had mine--well, it's more of a dessert but can you blame me? :)http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PGGtbjr8m4V54tWMgqYxmQ?select=FYDoUGTg-QonNyXhJ07Jyg
author: Leah E.

description: Perfect comfort food. Everything on the menu doesn't disapppoint. Burgers are juicy and flavorful and so are their amazing tritips. Where can u find cheap good steak anywhere. Buckhorn is the only place. And they are fast too. Great dinner and meals with reds and whites. Super star!
author: Diana T.

description: Normally I don't like food court food but Buckhorn Grill definitely change my mind. We ordered the Chicken and Tri-tip Paletter. It was definitely delicious because the chicken and tri-tip was cooked just right. The vegetables was also cooked right. I though the price was definitely worth it because it is definitely not your typical food court price. I will definitely come back and try their other entrees in the future.
author: Julie C.

description: For a food court place, the food isn't too bad! Love eating the tri-tip platter, but if you're sensitive to salt, skip the au jus because the meat is already well seasoned...I love the fried onions, but sometimes they come out extremely greasy (perfect for my stressful days)... Definitely a convenient stop while waiting for Amtrak or while I shop (the price beats Bristol farms' and the quality is just as good)
author: Lynelle M.

description: This place sucks! I stopped in for a quick bite before my spa sessions at BW and only went there cause my gf tried the sample and loved it. What we ordered tasted NOTHING like the sample - over salted, sloppy and falling all apart in seconds. I wanted nothing to do with this gross mound of meat and tossed it promptly. If you like this place - good for you, bad for people around you (messed my gf's stomach up BAD!). Never again.
author: Bella B.

description:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 2.5 Stars
Average: 3 Stars

[M] ROUND HOUSE SALAD
+ Sweetness of the vinaigrette was just right
+ Good amount of meat (for extra cost)
+ Onion strings 
+ Big portion

[W] PHILLY CHEESE TRI-TIP SUB
+ Tri-Tips were delicious!
- Bun was too dry 
- Philly cheese wasn't really Philly cheese...

The Philly cheese wasn't really Philly cheese. Instead of cheddar, they just used slices of provolone on top. It melts from the heat of the cooked meat that's underneath when it should be melted cheddar that's poured on top. Good onion strings though, other than that T_T We will not be coming back.
author: Mona C.

description:
FREE TRI TIP SAMPLES!! That in itself deserves its own star.
We always share a salad here. They give you so much.
Only reason I am giving them 4 stars instead of 5 is because last time they gave us chicken instead of tri tip.
author: Sarah C.

description:
I'm surprised that I'm rating this 3 stars because it's in such a prime location ... and the average is 4 stars, but nevertheless this place lacked the spark to be 4 or 5 stars. 

I ordered the Philly Buck expecting a nice, big, cheesy, juicy sandwich. NOPE. I got a sloppily made sandwich with NO flavor and really little cheese. The only thing that saved this meal? The meat. I gotta hand it to them - the meat was pretty good ... and I'm really not a meat person.

$8 for this sandwich that wasn't filling or really all that flavorful? Ehhh. I was thoroughly disappointed; however when I walked around and saw the salad ... I was in awe. Those things are HUGE.

Like I said, the tri-tip meat here is actually really good ... so maybe I just need to order something else or just get the salad. Or maybe...just ask for a big ol' plate of plain meat.
author: Steph S.

description: For a mall the tri-tip platter was good and had a lot of flavor. There was no need for additional seasoning. They had samples while you were in line so all in all it was a good experience.
author: Tiffany F.

description: I have eatern here and the Emeryville location. I really enjoy their Little Buck sandwich and sirloin tri-tip platter. It's a little expensive, but they have good quality meat. Their roadhouse onions are very addicting! I like how the atmosphere is casual, so even though the Emeryville location is a restaurant, you don't need to tip.
author: Jennifer T.

description: I love swinging by this place once in a while to grab a tri tip flat bread wrap.  For fast casual they do a great job and I love their bbq sauce and horseradish. The service is fast and friendly.  A bette outpost than the one in the Embarcadero. But get it to go and enjoy whatever you get at home with a glass of wine.  That food court should never actually be eaten in (depressing!).
author: e w.

description: I come here regularly to this location inside the Westfield Mall in the basement food court. It's so convenient to all the department and specialty stores here. But I must admit I've never ordered anything other than the Roadhouse salad with tri- tips. My first time here, a worker was handing out tri- tips samples, and I was hooked. The steak slices are perfectly cooked to a medium rare and they are so juicy and flavorful. Blue cheese crumbs, cilantro, skinny crispy onion rings, and cherry tomatoes are scattered throug the greens. It's a very generous portion, too.
author: Paula H.

description:
This eatery is located in the Westfield shopping center. This eatery is located in the food court. The prices of the menu items are reasonable from $6-$9.00 each.
I ordered a trip tip cheddar sandwich. The presentation was excellent. The sandwich was tasteful. The bread on the sandwich was better than normal bread. The bread was garlicky, toasted and made just right with really good lean tri-tip. The sandwich came with cheddar on top of the tri-tip. Go here to enjoy an excellent tasteful sandwich!!
author: Harley G.

description: The 12 oz Char-Roasted Sirloin Tri-Tip platter was delicious and reasonably priced for a San Francisco restaurant. The slices were generous and includes mash potatoes w/ gravy and grilled vegetables. Located in beautiful Westfield San Francisco Centre on the lower level trendy food court. Several beer selections and wine are also available. Located where it's fun to dine, shop and explore.
author: DAVID T.

description: Solid lunch place that has enough options to please everyone in your party. $10-$12 per salad.Their krispy chicken salad is really good.
author: Crystal L.

description:
If you're that rare breed of #fitgirl who has high standards for healthy food you should definitely add Buckhorn Grill to your list. 

I tried their Cabo Chop salad today and it was incredible. It was very fresh, well presented, and the variety of veggies made for an incredible flavor. The chicken breast was lightly seasoned, warm when I had it, and not too salty! Of course, put the dressing on the side and avoid eating the fried tortilla bowl - and your divine six pack will be A-OK. :)

Will definitely be back to check out their other salads!
author: Erin P.

description:
Underpromised and overdelivered.

But also overpromised and underdelivered.

Good part: Small platter menu description said char-broiled chicken breast with lemon and garlic seasoning. It did not say I'd get two. Or that they'd be outstanding.

Bad part: Small platter menu description said char-broiled chicken breast would come on a bed of greens. There were five leaves.

Good news outweighs the bad news. Closer to three and a half stars.
author: Jason B.

description:
This place is known for tri-tip. So why would you order anything else? It's like going to a steak house and asking for a veggie burger.  Why would you do that?! crazy people.

Anyway, the Little Horn was enough for me... perfect amount of juicy tender meat, sweet caramelized onion, au jus dipping sauce.  Dang i'm starting to salivate, and i JUST ate! 

My only bad experience was my own fault.   A piece of caramelized onion got stuck between my teeth, so I pulled out my floss and got it out.  Only to have the onion fall off the floss and into my keyboard.  Um. Eww.  I can't exactly call the tech guy for this...
author: Jessie H.

description:
Best Tri Tip sammy ever.  This is what I mean about liking mall food sometimes.

I know its in the food court but still it's SF - they don't do average food court here.  Actually this was in the "Food Emporium".  At this food court - the food is better than most restaurants I've tried.

The Tri Tip was so juicy and tender - the mashed potatoes and gravy was so good too.  My bf ate their twice! while we were in SF even though we had so many other foodie options - we even skipped going to Mission Chinese!

Will def be back - wish there was one in San Diego...
author: Kristina P.

description:
I like my food like i like my men: Generous, Hot, and ok, maybe a little Meaty.

I can never finish an entire buckhorn sandwich, no matter how hard i try (and believe me, i DO try). The mashed potatoes used to have a starchy flavor, but have somehow developed into a beautiful potato blend :)

Now, here's where buckhorn decides to get sneaky. The westfield buckhorn has chicken bucks (chicken sandwichs, for those who are not as well versed in buckhorn) while the emeryville location does not, but does have burgers. Having tried both the buck-burger and the chicken-buck (or, the cluck-buck, as i call it) i do prefer the cluck-buck. (say it outloud, its kind of awesome). 

The chicken chedder buck and the roadhouse bucks are always deliciously safe decisions. ooo, and bonus points for working in the mall; they do a 10% discount. 

so, why five stars for a food court chain? the people at this one are AWESOME. attentive, friendly, FAST (which is basically, amazing) and seem to understand that when it comes to food, the extra effort is always appreciated. 

until we meet again, my dear.
author: Andrea C.

description:
I love this place.

If you are an SFSU student, staff, or faculty member, show them your id for a 10% discount.

Ok, now that that's out of the way, let's talk food. I am a total carnivore, so any place that gives a good portion of meat in its sandwiches works for me. I usually go with the Roadhouse Buck, but the last time I went I got the Bacon Cheddar Buck. I love how both sandwiches had so much meat that the bread could hardly contain it.

Also, wanna give major props to the cashier there. I ordered one sandwich, made it a combo, and then I was gonna add a side order of roadhouse onions because I was splitting a meal with my girlfriend and we wanted to have two sides. The cashier told me to order the onions with the combo and get a side order of fries because it was $.75 cheaper. So not only did I save money with the discount but I also saved money because the cashier was looking out.

Always a good experience here
author: Tonichi L.

description:
Loyal fan of the Cabo Chopped Salad (with the tri-tip add on, comes to about $11). 

If you are a big eater like me, this item will be "just right" or almost just right after an appetizer or snack or dessert = ). Mountain high salad of jicama, greens, beans, etc. MAKE SURE your dressing is mixed in if that's what you requested (as oppposed to on the side) before you leave, sometimes they somehow forget to add it. There's nothing more shocking than having a dry tossed salad haha.

Order at the register, then eat in the food court frenzy for some delicious salad and sometimes even more delicious people watching! I wish they had more of these restaurants in the peninsula.
author: Danny H.

description: Good salads and GREAT tri tip. The tri tip was so delicious- savory, smokey, melt in your mouth. Could eat it all day!
author: Erin Y.

description:
If I heard that a place in the mall's food court had an average of four stars I would assume everyone that rated it was high at the time. But now that I have eaten at Buckhorn Grill I realize that you don't need to be high to give this place four stars. It's actually really good. The sandwich was 4 stars for sure.  And it's located in a mall, which is convenient if you are shopping there but otherwise I probably wouldn't go out of my way to eat at the mall. (The crowds drive me bananas).

I skipped the Little Buck (which is pretty much a French Dip) and went straight for the Big Buck because I assumed a place in the mall was going to give me a skimpy rip off sandwich. Nope. My French Dip was big enough that I needed to take the rest home in a box. The tri tip in it was amazing and tender and not over cooked. Caramelized onions came in it along with a side of au jus (the yummy stuff you dip your French Dip in). 

If you find yourself hungry and at the mall, I would say stop at Buckhorn and get the Big or Little Buck (depending on your appetite). You won't be sorry and you'll probably be surprised at the quality of a food court restaurant!
author: Liz M.

description:
Roughly 3 times a week I grab the Roadhouse Salad with Salmon for lunch here. It's a huge, delicious salad with a generous entree-sized piece of salmon on top. I seek out sub $15 salads that have a good variety of fresh vegetables. I don't go for pizza topping salads, or the fancy minimalist kind (organic argula with parmesan, capers and pepper.. come on people), or any other of the common salad entree failures restaurants are still serving up.

I want a salad that is a quality, filling meal. This one fits the bill. I haven't found anything better in the area. I go to Split Pea Seduction often too but I always have to supplement their salad with a crostata. Their crostatas are great, btw.
author: Tim K.

description: Meaty deliciousness. The Westfield food court has a lot of surprising gems but it's hard to go past Buckhorn Grill. We go to SF for a week-long conference each December look forward so much to ducking out for lunches at Buckhorn! I generally go for a little buck with onions and the delicious jus for dipping while my boyfriend is able to make it through an entire platter. Everything is amazing. I think things are tastier here than the (also good) Grand Central location.
author: Kate S.

description: This is honestly the best food court I've been to. I mean where else can you get a steak salad this fast after blowing all your dough on some new shoes from Bloomingdales? There was a good amount of meat, easily enough to split between two. They put too much dressing for my taste so you may want to get it on the side. My dad got a sandwich with salad on the side and was satisfied as well.
author: Stephie D.

description: Great meat and sandwiches! I loved the barbeque sauce. This was the first place I ate after getting to SF and it set the bar high for all other places!
author: Jacob K.

description:
I was visiting town and walked through the food court with no intention of eating at this place. A girl had samples of Tri-tip steak on toothpicks. I grabbed one as I walked past and to my surprise, it was cooked to perfection and was jam packed with natural moisture and flavors.

I walked around the food court which has some top notch joints for a mall food court, and I found myself back at this location and ordered some thick cut Tri-tip slices with a side of veggies and fries.

It brought back memories of tri-tip from the butcher shop as a kid.

If you appreciate perfectly cooked tri-tip steak, this place is a must. The fact that it is in a mall food court may sound silly, but their quality product speaks for itself.

I will eat here again when I visit this town! =)
author: Jason B.

description: The bacon cheddar buck is amazing at buckhorn grill one of the best sandwiches in the bay
author: Christian T.

description:
I can't believe this is at a mall's food court. The tri tip sandwiches were SO good. I had the Chipotle Border Buck combo with Roadhouse Onions (fried onion shoe strings) and a side of fries. 

The meat was perfectly seasoned, cooked, and sliced. They're pretty generous on the meat portions as well. I'm sad that it's so far away, but definitely check this place out if you're at Westfield SF. Very decently priced as well. 

Happy customer.
author: Tina T.

description:
Was in SF on Saturday morning volunteering and we decided to go to the mall food court for a late lunch. Buckhorn Grill is always my spot for food at the Union Square food court. I LOVE THEIR SALADS!! My usual is the tri-tip roadhouse salad but this time I decided to get something different and went with the tri-tip cabo chop. Ok, not completely different but the tri-tip is a must!! It's $3 extra but it is so freakin delicious! 

Not cheap ($12) but it was so dang good! Even my friend ditched her vegan food from Loving Hut and started having some of my salad :)
author: Natalia H.

description:
Wait, this is the one at the mall, right? Anyway, you won't believe this shit. So I got dinner here the other night, put my tray on the table, went back up to the counter to get silverware and when I came back my food was gone!

So I thought the aggressive clean-up crew had cleared the table, but then this guy comes up to me and says: "What are you looking for?"

"I'm looking for my damn food!"

"I knew it!" He said "Somebody ripped you off. I saw the whole thing. Let's find that son of a bitch."

So we started walking around the cafeteria, and sure enough, there was a bum chowing down on my dinner. Security kindly escorted him out, but that fcuker finished my plate!
author: Scott W.

description:
I was lured in my the free samples, and it did not dissapoint.

I dined here over the weekend, and the line was pretty long. It wrapped around the cord, and there were only two cashiers available.  Nonetheless, the wait was about 15 minutes, and comparable to the other popular food stands in the food court at that time.

I ordered the tri tip sandwich, which is the tri tip thinly sliced served on toasted bread, and au jus dip.  I ate at Prime Dip the day before, so naturally I started to compare them.  The bread at Buckhorn Grill was a 6 inch long roll, and it was super toasty.  I prefer the light toasting of Prime Dip actually, but that's just personal preference.  The meat at Buckhorn was higher quality, but the portion sizes were smaller.  Also, the sandwich at Buckhorn was topped off with grilled onionsm, which added a nice sweetness and gourmet-feel to the sandwich.  I thought the au jus was too salty.  

The price was fair, especially for all that beef.  Cost was around $10, which is the same price point as Prime Dip.   Although, the Westfield location is much better than the Tenderloin.
author: Sue N.

description:
Ordered the small tri tip sandwich. and it was small. we asked to have the sandwich cut and you guessed it, we received it un-cut. the sandwich was decent. the tri-tip itself was pretty good. well at least the samples were. i do wish the bun was toasted a bit. it would make a big difference.

the roadhouse onions were ok. i basically ate tons of batter and not much onion.

the sandwich was about $6.79 and then to make it a combo (drink + side) is an additional $2.50.
author: Kathy W.

description: YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY, they really do have the BEST tri-tip.  Add onion strings and some mashed potatoes and you have a wonderful feast!!  Prices are really reasonable and service is quick.  Love this place!
author: Andrea B.

description:
I am definitely a fan of Buckhorn. The first one I went to was in Sacramento and I was excited when I saw this location. 

I typically get the larger tri tip sandwich and fries. The sandwich is very good, the meat is tasty, and I like to add the BBQ sauce. The larger sandwich is filling, I think I may be able to eat the smaller one but it is so good that I want to just eat the larger one. I haven't had anything else because I cannot get over the sandwich.
author: Joe G.

description:
We came here last weekend to avoid the rain outside. This is a great place for a quick meal before or after catching a movie at the Century Theatre. Like many other shops in this food court they use an electronic paging system to buzz you when your food order is ready.

I usually get the crispy chicken and avocado salad (delicious!! - enough for one person), or the cabo chop salad - served in a gigantic crispy tortilla bowl, you get a substantial amount of veggies: romaine greens topped with avocado, corn, black beans, jicama, tomatoes, etc. (can be shared by 2 persons). 

Meat lovers can get their fill with sirloin tri-tip, grilled chicken, or salmon choices in both sandwiches or plates. The tri-tip is very tasty (but can be very fatty). I prefer the salads (see 2nd paragraph above). Beer and wine are also available. All menu items are priced under $10.

There's a frequent diner program, but every Buckhorn Grill location manages it separately. So you cannot use points earned at other locations. :(
author: Luis C.

description:
Do I risk losing all credibility by giving a mall eatery five stars? 

Even if the answers yes, I can't go back now. Two words. Wait, maybe it's one word. Either way: Tritip. So good. I had a french dip-like sandwich with tritip, sauteed onions, and au jus. When I got to the end, I was licking my fingers and contemplating  drinking the au jus. (Not really because that's gross, but you get the point.) My wife got a chicken sandwich and said it was great, too. 

Oh, and the fries? Gone. Delicious.

Look, it's not like I'd have an anniversary dinner here, but for what it is -- a quick place to grab some good food -- you'd really be hard pressed to find a better alternative.
author: Mike B.

description:
I met a NYF for lunch today & we decided to split a salad at Buckhorn. Their salads are huge & not the cheapest option, but they're fresh and delicious. And I didn't have to pay because my friend treated me as a Pre-birthday lunch. Woohoo!

We picked the Yik Yak, which ended up being kind of like an Asian salad. We added chicken for some protein. Although, now that I've read other reviews, I feel like I should've gotten their tri-tip. The only odd thing is that it comes in a tortilla. I thought it was a hard tortilla shell, but it was a soft tortilla they just stuffed in the bowl.

I'd go here again because the food is good & fresh and the serving sizes are big enough for two people, which could make it kind of a bargain lunch!
author: Kris L.

description:
The food is great!!
The beef they serving is amazingly soft(medium rear recommended)
Like to have my lunch there also the salmon is very tasty but mostly go there for beef.
author: Shemi E.

description:
Great find for a shopping center food court. 

$13.99 for 7oz of sirloin tri-tip, red-skinned mashed potatoes, grilled veggies, and au jus. The meat was surprisingly not overcooked and wonderfully juicy, and the veggies and mashers were similarly delicious. 

The platter of free samples drew us in, and I'll definitely be back here the next time I'm at Westfield SF.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Its now up to $850, that I have spent here.  Keep in mind, there are alot of other choices around where I work for me to get lunch.  But every week, i still come here at least twice to get their salads, sometimes with beef somethings without (cause sometimes you feel like a nut and sometimes you dont... )

My new favorite salad is the fruit and nut with beef, I had that today.  Comes with spring mix greens, apples, strawberry, dried apricots, walnuts and blue cheese.  I added beef to that.  Yeah.... to that!  Its a food for me...so i dont always get this.

What I usually get is a side salad, which is huge, with their vinaigrette and beef.  Sometimes to kick it up, I add walnuts or blue cheese...  so many different combination.... the list is endless....  

Im going to report back when it reaches $1,000!!!
author: Janet S.

description: I really love the sirloin tri tip and the mashed potatos. The portions are usually big enough to share and the price is reasonable for the food. My favorite plate it's the ceasar pleaser.
author: Marilia S.

description: Got the roadhouse salad add tri tip and avocado slices.  The dressing is way too sweet and they used too much of it, the lettuce was a soupy mess. The fried onions things were super greasy and kinda left me queasy.  The tri tip was terrible. Definitely not as good as what I read in other reviews.  Better options in the food court, dont think ill be coming back.
author: George M.

description:
I always go here whenever I am around Union square. The roadhouse salad with tri tip is perfect as usual. So delicious and enormous  that am stuffed and need to go shopping to walk off that meal.

If you never tried their tri tip before there is usually someone handing out a free sample, but be careful once you try it you will get hooked.
author: Abigail L.

description:
I love this place--hands down, the best food court option ever!

I had the Big Buck Sandwich with Tri-Tip and made it into a combo (which included a drink and side). The meat itself was delicious--perfectly cooked. I didn't eat the roll it came on because it was just too much. I chose mashers for my side and they were so good. 

Everything those around me were eating looked great so I don't think any other option would have made me unhappy. The line can be a bit slow, but it is so worth it. 

Try the horseradish sauce!!!!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Very fresh salad and a great variety of dressings and dips.
author: Gopi V.

description: Awesome Tri-tip sandwich , the meat literally melts in your mouth ...kinda pricey but isnt everything in SF
