author: Phillip J F.

description:
Mall food is not my fav...however there's a Indian guy works there always make my day lol...i gave him good tips :P 
all right let's talk about the main thing,, their clam chowder n platter r soooo yummm
author: Jessica Y.

description:
For a to-go spot in a mall food court this place is awesome. 
Ordered:
Roadhouse Buck- thick sliced tri-tip with roadhouse onions & red ranch sauce topped with bleu cheese crumbles....this thing was PACKED, just the way I like it!  Tri-tip was tender, savory, and paired well with the dressings
Red Skin Mashers and Gravy- nice touch to the tri-tip
Wouldn't go out of my way for it but next time I'm in need of a hunger-fix after a long-day of Westfield/Union Square shopping this will definitely be my go-to place!
author: Mahsa K.

description: I love this place in Westfield center because it's quick and I can always get a great salad! They do meats really well here, so you cant go wrong! Be sure to try the samples they usually hand out...
author: Danielle M.

description:
Buckhorn grill is one of my favorite spots in Westfield. They always have the most bomb-diggidy samples while you wait. It's generally fresh steak with onion strings. Delicious.

As far as the main meal goes, I always get the crispy chicken salad with avocado. My pro-tip is to grab a small thing of their famous BBQ sauce to go along with it so you can dip the chicken in it and eat separately if you so desire. The only thing you need to watch out for is the salads can be heavy on the dressing at some points, so you might want to ask for light dressing.
author: Jason M.

description:
for some odd reason, i've been devouring a lot of beef in this new year 2011.  so after a business meeting at the flood building, i ventured here to eat more beef.  i was lured in to this food court stop by a young lady giving away free samples of tri-tip.  
after a drop $10 on a 6 inch tri tip sandwich with bacon and melted cheese i was thoroughly disappointed with not only the portion size but the amount of gristle on the tri tip that in my humble opinion should have been trimmed off. my dining companion made the wise choice of a dried fruit and crumbled blue cheese mixed green salad.
oh, by the way the fountain drink was mostly ice too.
normally i don't whine like this about seemingly small inconveniences but this was just a bad lunch and big waste of time and money.
one day after such a wonderful dining experience at the Sentinel in SOMA.
JYW = not a fan
author: Jeff W.

description:
I have been going to Buckhorn for over a year now, I work close by and go a few times a week. I really like the chicken small plate and that is all I order. Recently I felt like why do I only get 10 pieces of lettuce I would like a few more. So I have been asking for extra lettuce. Apparently this is confusing? I got this response:

"You want what?" - Alex
" I want extra lettuce" - Me (Alexa)
" Umm ooookayy" (rolling eyes) - Alex
" Also could I please get a side of avocado?" - Me (Alexa)
" Uh hold on" ( raised hand in my face) - Alex

Honestly.. the service is just unacceptable. Extra lettuce should not be confusing and for this guy who I think is the manager to roll his eyes at me as if I am annoying him for order food?? It is unfortunate when you find a place that you really like and you get treated like this... 

There is another Buckhorn down the street.. So I will be going to that location only from now on.
author: Alexa V.

description: Looking for whole bunch of green a little quality meat to chase it, this semi fast food outlet hit the spot with their flat bread salad and steak. Ask for the dressing on the side and you can have a full on food fest without the guilt. Easy on the wallet too, especially with the yelp check in deal.
author: vic f.

description:
The cubed sirloin tri-trip was so freakin' good.
You know how sometimes you're outside a restaurant, and the smell of the meat being roasted over a chestnut fire or whatever smells like you want to eat the smell?
Then you eat the meat, and it's dry, tough and tasteless?

This meat tastes as good as that smell.
Finally!
Though that smell does not waft from the Buckhorn area.
There is no smell.
You're confusing me.

The tri-tip was amazing, it will live in my vegetarian dreams forever.

Buckhorn? Not a good name.

Buckthorn? Hornbucks? Whatthorn?
Doesn't work.

Update: Deducted a star because sometimes the steak is way over- or undercooked.
author: Lame Lake Meese Z.

description: After work I was really hungry and have been hearing about this place. Since I love tri tip I'm like why not, so I ordered the tri tip sandwich the big one with the grilled onions and only ate half. It was good but I like mine with a thicker sauce perhaps some sort of BBQ sauce. It was good I would try it again and maybe get it with the crispy onion rings and blue cheese.
author: arlene d.

description: I want to start off with an apology to Buckhorn. I have passed both your locations in downtown Sac on L street and your other in the Roseville Galleria without a second glance, always assuming it was over priced and probably not great. Well, I'm here today in the Bay for unveiled and this location totally proved me wrong! Today we ordered three versions of the California burger and the lemon garlic chicken and all the food came out got and great. My burger in particular had ample amounts of bacon and avocado. The pepper jack really made an impression and the red mash with gravy was delicious. Also, the staff, on top of all being friendly and helpful, was also very tentative (which I didn't expect as it's sort of cafeteria style seating). All in all, I will definitely frequent the locations in Sac because of this experience.
author: Ruben A.

description: Really...really....worth it...it was me & my husband's 1st time it wasn't disappointing at all:)) worth every penny:) $40 for 2 wasn't bad at all:)) will be coming back 4 sure with our kids:)))
author: Joan S.

description:
"Meat!...Meat!...Meat!"
....Nope, this is not an encore performance at the Nob Hill Adult Theater.

Hell must have frozen over...since I am actually going to give an almost favorable review of one of the price-insensitive eateries in the Westfield Shopping Centre's Restaurant Emporium (their hoity-toity nomenclature for a food court...and what's with the pretentious Brit-speak spelling of "Centre"?)

Anyhow, against my better judgment, I decided to give the food court another try after lackluster attempts at Coriander Thai and Bistro Burger. Imagine my gleeful surprise when I discovered I could eat a sandwich here for less than $7. I tried the $6.45 Chipotle Border Buck, which come to think of it, does sound like something you would find at the Nob Hill Adult Theater. It has sliced pieces of tri-tip piled on a small sweet French roll and slathered with a chipotle and pepper jack cheese sauce. Pretty tasty, even if it has the specter of a similar item at Jack in the Box over it.

For an additional $3, I got a mound of lightly crisp French fries. The combination is obviously a better deal than what you find at the vaunted 'wichcraft around the corner, though obviously you can get a Saigon sammie for a lot cheaper. But the Buckhorn will do if you are in the afterglow of a Bloomie's sale. And of course, you get busing service here, a luxury for those of us used to taking our trays to the garbage receptacle. Can't help it...the grammar school cafeteria ladies programmed me that way.

FOOD - 4 stars...a good, meaty sammie and a better deal than 'wichcraft...which isn't saying THAT much
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...just a mall with people using those big trays as battering rams
SERVICE - 3 stars...well, the buzzer did work...but why do the servers have marbles in their mouths as they speed-recite the menu to you?
TOTAL - 4 stars...barely....for the sammie and fries
author: Ed U.

description:
Hello vegans and health-conscious people! Buckhorn Grill has one of the most satisfying, healthy, and REASONABLY PRICED (only $6.95) meals I know of ... and it appears completely vegan to me .. it is the YIK-YAK salad.  It is lots of veggies ... sugar snap peas, jicama, carrots, cabbage, maybe, almonds? served in a great big tomato-flavored tortilla with this tangy oh-so-delicious Asian style dressing.  It is enormous, and it is filling, and it is incredibly tasty.

People often come up to me while I'm sitting there in the Westfield Shopping Mall, with my dearly beloved Yik Yak Salad, and they ask, "What is that?"  And "where did you get it?"  Because they want to get one, too!  

Yes, I can see why.  The Yik Yak salad is a thing of beauty!  Its' a friggin' NUTRITION RAINBOW.  But no need to be jealous, you can have one, too!  For only $6.95.  And I guarantee you will not be the slightest bit hungry when you are done.  Especially if you eat that big honkin' tortilla, too. 

And remind me, who said vegan food is too expensive and/or too much hassle?

These Buckhorn Grill's are all over the place.

What could be easier?   Take care of your body and get some healthy veggies today!
author: Rachel D.

description:
Came here to grab a bit to eat before seeing a movie, their food is pretty darn good and reasonably priced.

I got a BBQ sandwich and it was tasty.

This review is from 3/24/12
author: Arthur Z.

description:
I was running around the Embarcadero 4 Center like a madman and was looking for a quick lunchtime bite during my work break.  Good thing I ran into Buckhorn Grill because their Chipotle Border Buck that included melted jack cheese, sliced tri tip, and chipotle sauce really did hit the spot.  The bread (french roll) is less than desirable but it's the tri tip that you're really paying for.  

I'll be back to try a bunch more of their tri tip sandwiches.  I don't know about their jammin' salmon sandwich.  I can imagine that I can't take a salmon sandwich seriously if "jammin" is in the name.....
author: Albie F.

description:
Their tri-tip is good but my go-to item is the Jammin' Salmon! One of the better eateries at the mall.

I'm trying to get like Jared and do a Subway diet, so I was going to replace my Subway with the Jammin' Salmon.  You'd think they would have nutritional information but they don't.  I cheated and ate the sandwich anyway.  And it was too good to be as many calories as Subway.  

I let Jared down.
author: Erika C.

description: The bacon cheeseburger and tri-tip salad are the highlights of the menu! This is not "food court food" whatsoever. Everything is done in a reasonable amount of time and comes out made to perfection.
author: Jenn B.

description:
I can't believe I just spent close to 9 bucks on a salad - with no meat. The last time I spent this much on salad is at Fresh Choice where I can eat as much veggies and cheap pizza I want. But this is an new experience for me. This might just be the slow evolution of me becoming a yuppie, a low income yuppie, but nevertheless - yuppie.

I ordered the Cabo Chop, which was amazing! I was so surprised that I was full after eating that, especially because I am a big guy that eats meat at every meal. They had chopped romaine lettuce, avocado, black beans, corn, jicama (WTF?), radishes, tomatoes and blue cheese crumbs in a crispy tortilla. I didn't really like the tortilla because it tasted like a carrot chip, and I hate carrots.

I will definitely come back here again. I just can't say when because the idea of paying for fruits and leaves is still new to me.
author: Dorian T.

description: After a long drive to the city, my girl friend and I were looking for something tasty, reasonably priced, and quick. What we got was: bland salmon, brown garden salad, a long wait, and a pricy less than mediocre meal. They were lucky we were starving. $26 wasted.
author: Natina A.

description:
I've been to this Buckhorn quite a few times, and every experience so far has been pleasant. I usually get the Cabo Chop salad which is basically a HUGE salad that comes in an orange tortilla shell-- which might I add is DELICIOUS. I see so many people throw the shell away without touching it. Give the tortilla bowl a chance, it'll blow your mind.

I have had their dip sandwich as well. Also, absolutely amazing. I'm obsessed with their horseradish dip. I could drench my sandwich in that stuff all day, every day. That sounds really weird to say, but I'm not kidding. Buckhorn is definitely one of my favorite lunch spots in the Westfield Centre. The prices aren't bad either-- my salad was just $7.99. That's little compared to what you'd pay almost anywhere else in that cafeteria for a substantial meal.
author: Ashley D.

description:
Fan-fucking-tastic! Not the best tri-tip in the world(noone can beat me in a tri-tip cook off) but amazingly delicious nonetheless. Perfectly cooked. Nice bark on the outside, and the perfect amount of pink on the inside. The au jus is literally orgasmic. Literally.

Why arent there more BBQ spots in town!?!?
author: Nelson S.

description:
$11 is a little steep for salad but their crispy chicken salad is irresistible!

A quick how to on the best salad: order the cabo chop salad and add crispy chicken. The chicken seems baked but tastes fried, it's not greasy but it is crispy and juicy. At the same time, it's tender and you can cut it with a plastic fork.

I prefer their salads over their sandwiches. While I would love to eat this more often, an $11 salad is a bit pricey. 

Plus: ABSOLUTE BEST customer service! aaron, you're awesome! :)
author: Stella C.

description:
Yes! The tri tip may just BE the best tri tip in the world-- as Buckhorn advertises. You will see the poster next to their cashier stand. They are generous and kind in offering slices of tri tip as a sample. There is usually a woman who stand in front of the line with a tray of this.

The largest tri tip platter, ~$18, will be enough to serve 2 people. This is my favorite dish! Comes with mashed potatoes + gravy. Cooked vegetables [incredible taste!]: red bell pepper, half of a whole onion which splits easily into layers, yam. The tri tip comes with au jus, for dipping. Water is complimentary, just ask!
author: Veranna N.

description:
I have to admit, they got me with the samples they were giving out. It was almost like i was walking around Costco.. and they got me to buy their product. 

I had the Roadhouse Salad and added tri tip to it for an additional $2. I'll pass!! Last time i get a salad at a place you should really be getting a slab of meat and a side of potatoes. But i was hoping it'd be similar too yardhouse's new york steak salad. It was sooo far off. Tasteless and nothing special about it.

WARNING: My friend found a curly hair in her mashed potatoes. EWWWWW!! I should take away a star for that. but i'm trying to be understanding that a hair may just slip by once in a while -_- To compensate for that disturbing find.. they gave her a new plate of food. But we were careful with the mashed potatoes.
author: Samantha L.

description: All I can say is the tri tip here is AMAZINGGGG. Really good as fresh get a sample when you walk by and it will lure you in to get one. I got the sandwich tri tip and it's just delicious on every bite that it gets you to say welcome to san Francisco home of the best foods. I also got the chicken avocado salad and it was good the chicken was a little dry if I knew a head of time would of substituted it for the tri tip. Overall I will always come back unless they start messing up on the tri tip or something but the best food around in the food court so far
author: Leonard I.

description:
I was sad to see the Jolliebee near Moscone Center had closed, and decided to check out the Buckhorn Grill based on it's Yelp reviews. For around $10, you can get a good lunch time meal. I ordered a bowl of soup and a half sandwich, which was very tasty as well as reasonably priced. My order was ready faster than my boyfriend's burger and fries, but my meal was a bit smaller.

It's an interesting set up where you place your order at the register, they give you a pager, and you pick up your order and return the pager at the end of the counter. I was tempted to join their frequent visitor program even though I don't live in the city. Even though I miss Jolliebee, at least I can visit the Buckhorn Grill when I am near the Moscone Center.
author: Liane C.

description: I think the tri-tip is weirdly overly seasoned, but they are always giving out free samples, so it's pretty easy to judge for yourself. The fries are lackluster and plain. However, I think they have really nice options for enormous salads (I normally take half home). I particularly like the Greek salad - they're generous with the feta, and the fried pita strips are delicious. The food is unfortunately variable depending on who's doing the cooking - sometimes it's not grilled and charred enough. but a good option in the food court.
author: Lisa K.

description: Kind of salty but pretty impressive for mall food. I got a tri-top sandwich with onion rings. Onion rings had clearly been sitting there for a while. The meat was tender and there was a lot. Lots of meat is always a good thing. They need to  dial down the salt. Lots of salt is not a good thing.
author: Corey Jace W.

description:
With all the hot, beefy men walking around during the Pride Parade, it's no surprise my friend & I were in the mood for a hot, beefy sandwich to sustain us through the rest of the festivities! 

Buckhorn is a fantastic pick in the sea of options at the Westfield Food Court. I ordered a Big Buck (6 oz of tri tip w/ caramelized onions on a sweet french roll, $7.95. For an extra $2.50, I got a side of fries [they're nothing special] & a root beer.) 

I remembered to tell the cashier that I wanted my meat cooked well done. They don't ask & if you don't specify, you get it medium rare. Buckhorn's tri tip is cut pretty thick & it is super flavorful because it's well seasoned. I complete my sammy with a generous spread of horseradish sauce (I love horseradish sauce) & it is a four star lunch. 

Juicy, tender & satisfying--all my favorite qualities in a sandwich & a big strong man!!!
author: Fancypants X.

description: omg!! I don't normally do chains but these salads here are HUGE!!!  thank you new go to salad place!!  fast and people were friendly. Plus if you need a taste of tri-tip they had people giving samples out front.  I got the Yik Yak salad without meat and it was delicious!
author: Amanda K.

description: On my late exploration of beef, I finally tried tri-tip last night. I had the tri-tip flatbread, which came with thinly sliced tri-tip, lettuce, blue cheese, mushrooms, and tomatoes all wrapped between a hot parmesan flatbread. The flatbread satisfied the carb lover in me with it's chewy texture and perfect thickness. The lettuce was a little overdressed for my taste, but I did like the combination of the blue cheese with the tri-tip. The tomatoes and mushrooms added a nice freshness to a slightly heavier dish. My boyfriend had the platter with tri-tip and chicken, which also came with mashed potatoes and grilled vegetables. The amount of meat provided was decent, and I thought that the chicken was especially tender. I also haven't had mashed potatoes in longer than I can imagine, and I liked how it was a little chunky and well-seasoned. Both dishes were very filling, and I'd definitely come back again!
author: Ashley T.

description:
Not a bad choice when you want to make a semi healthy (i'm talking about salads here) eating decision while emptying your wallet @ this mall. 

I normally get a roadhouse salad but i can't stand those dam fried onions on top. the 1st time i tried it, my friend and i both said "what the hell is all this fried shit?ahhh it's consuming our salad!" 

seriously though, it was like our salad consisted mainly of that crap! anyway. i'd still recommend this place if you're at the mall, and if you're eating tri-tip get it done medium rare, do yourself a favor and get a side of horseradish.
author: Susy C.

description: this place is chaos during lunch and weekends.  If you are cluster phobic or afraid of large crowds this location is not for you.  the food is a hit or miss for me.  I order the Greek salad with medium rare tri-tip.  The tri tip is never ever medium rare it's gray.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Ordered Caesar salad with tori-tip and dressing on the side. I got overly dressed salad and I complained and they did not remake the salad. I got a shrug and an oh sorry. Tri tip was well done and very dry. Who serves tri-tip well done? The "Parmesan cheese" had zero flavor.  What happened to this place? Used to have a decent salad.
author: Jt S.

description:
One word: Salad

Salad. A whole variety of them but not only that, they are HUGE - not just a small portion of "side salad" size but actual platters of salads. My favorite are Avocado Chicken and the Roadhouse salad :) however, there are also many other selections.. But if I can give you one advise, just stick to the salads. They are Delicious. Healthy. And they fill you up pretty fast. 


So ditch the fact that its located on the cellar level of Westfield, it's not your typical food court type of salad. Worth the visit, money and time. Indulge as much as you can!
author: Charmaine Marie L.

description:
Possibly the best eatery in the basement food court, but that ain't saying much.  Bambie had the Tri-Tip.  I ate chicken.  She drank wine  I drank beer.  $28.   

I don't enjoy the food court ambiance.  Don't like the Market st. bums patrolling the tables for leftovers & lurking to snatch unattended purses.   Even though the property is new,  I can see this place degrading into creepiness really quick due to the high level of foot traffic and lackadaisical maintenance.
author: Tom S.

description: So I came to SF and once again got my life!! This time it was in the food court at the restaurant BuckHorn. So about this Cabo Salad.... It was everything a greedy person like myself  that is trying to become unplump could dream of...  As I am perusing through the food court I spot this massive veggie field salad galore and instantly new I had to have it...All I know is 20 minutes I am still eating this black bean,, corn, carrot, avocado and lettuce filled salad in a orange tortilla bowl! I am a lush when it comes to food but this salad did not give me the usual damn I ate to much feel afterwards. Look if you are hungry and would like something fresh and healthy like go to Buckhorn order the Cabo salad and get your like, I got mine!
author: Char I.

description: Fantastic sandwich i need 5 more..... The meat cooked perfectly the jus was delicious the onion great welll i enjoyed it a lot ..
author: Frenchy G.

description: This is an awesome place to grab a quick bite to eat while you're shopping, although it is completely above fast food quality. Buckhorn serves tender, juicy, slightly but perfectly bloody tri-tip. I'm very appreciative of the availability of tri-tip in the Bay Area since my cousins in St. Louis just recently were able to find some in their area. Here, for about $10-15, depending on your appetite, you can get a generous portion of tri-tip with some deliciously cooked sides. Then, you can walk a few yards away and get some Beard Papa's for dessert! What a perfect day that would be.
author: Priscilla V.

description: Hubby and I tried the tri-tip meal with a Dad's cut and a fountain Diet Coke. Worked out to just under $22 and the two of us were quite satisfied!
author: Deborah C.

description: Anytime me and my husband are in need of food in the area, especially while were shopping in the mall, this is our go to place. The food from the buckhorn has always been great. I love their salads and their mashed potatoes and their tri tip sandwiches. Everything I've had there so far has been good, which is why its our go to place when we are in the mall area. Love this place!
author: Rehana K.

description: The food was tasty. We ordered a tri tip platter, a sandwich w/fries, french onion soup and a side of chicken tenders. Everything was really tasty and cheap for the amount of food we got. I would definitely go again!
author: Heather H.

description:
Had lunch today at buckhorn grill while shoppoing

Cabo salad.  Outstanding dressing and plenty of cheese, beans, jicama ...

Came out quick and fresh.  good place for a quick good lunch
author: Bill L.

description:
One of my favorite sandwiches is a chivito, the national sandwich of Uruguay.  The closest thing to a chivito in the States is Buckhorn's little buck.

On a health note their sandwiches really pack on the calories and cholesterol. Be warned!
author: Roger H.

description: Crispy Chicken and avocado is the best!!!!! Although its a lil pricy but so worth it
author: Rosa A. F.

description:
Decent food at a decent price, but nothing special. 

Tri-tip was perfectly cooked and delicious. It was even on a decent roll. But it was nothing special. The Au jue was flavorless. The mashed potatoes were well made, but again - flavorless. I guess when you are a chain appealing to the masses, you have to stay away from strong flavors -but that doesn't mean you have to stay away from all flavor.
author: Kat S.

description: Just came back from Buckhorn -  ordered a crispy chicken BLT.  Good sized sandwich for $7 and very well seasoned!  As I was waiting for my sandwich, I helped myself  to a couple of tri-tip samples!  WOAH....DELICIOUS!!!  Meat was cooked MEDIUM rare and it was so tender and SUPER TASTY!  SHOOT! I should have ordered a tri-tip sandwich! All the more reason to come back and order it then!
author: Diana M.

description:
I got the chicken and tri-tip combo, which was ok.  The chicken I got was a bit dry, but the tri-tip was great.  The potatoes and veggies were pretty good as well.  The dish was a pretty large size, large enough that I couldn't finish it, and ended up taking the rest home.

Also, the price isn't as bad considering what your getting and at a popular mall.

I'll be eating here again when I make my way downtown for some shopping.
author: Pia V.

description: This place is as good as it gets for "fast food".  Get the bigger tri-tip steak sandwich, with the grilled onions and mushrooms--au jus.  French fries looked good, and the mashed potatoes were a slightly healthier version.  Great value for what you pay.  Salads were generous also.
author: Gregory N.

description:
I had food in this place when I had Christmas shopping. I ordered a bowl of noodle soup which was not impressive, very mediocre. Their food is not what I want to review here but the experience with their cashier. 

It was a busy day. I waited in a long line to order food. When it was my turn to pay the food, I used a credit card.  After  the cashier sliding my card, she told me that the transaction did not go through and asked me to use another credit card to pay.  I felt puzzled at her words because I just used the same card that morning to buy Caltrain tickets without any problem.  But since there was a long line after me,  I gave her the other card. 

After 1 hour, I called the credit card company to make an inquiry about the problematic transaction.  The answer was that the transaction went through. 

Yesterday, I got the statements of the two credit cards. They  show that the cashier charged me twice for the same order. 

Therefore, You should be alert when you use credit cards to pay for your food at Buckhorn Hill in the food court on Market street.
author: Nina H.

description:
Talk about customer service... 
I was waiting for my fruit and nut salad at the Bloomingdales Buckhorn today. A lady came up to the counter asking why her sandwich was delayed. Apparently, there was a problem with her beeper and she never got notified her item was done. Within the blink of an eye, they re-prepared her meal and presented her with a future free meal as an apology for the confusion. I've never seen someone so pleasantly surprised by such great service! 

They are the best!
author: Rada I.

description: This is a quick service restaurant located in the Westfield San Francisco Centre food court. I always come here for their juicy sirloin tri-tip (they give out samples around meal times). My usual order is the Caesar salad with tri-tip (available in regular or half sizes). The salad is extremely fresh with chopped romaine lettuce, slices of parmesan cheese, and crunchy croutons tossed in a creamy Caesar dressing. Or if you're feeling extra adventurous and hungry, get the Cabo Chop salad with tri-tip. Wow so much food: chopped romaine lettuce, avocado, black beans, corn, jicama, radishes, tomatoes, and blue cheese crumbles with honey lime dressing in a fried sweet tortilla bowl! Their tri-tip is really tender and juicy, without too much of the fatty portions. I usually pair my meal with something from Jamba Juice, but you can also order a glass of wine from Buckhorn if you'd like. Finally, make sure to sign up for their Frequent Diners Rewards program: you receive a $10 off coupon for every $100 you spend there. Plus they will also email you their monthly specials at all of their locations. All in all, this is my go-to place at Westfield so I come here every couple of weeks for yummy tri-tip!
author: Andy C.

description: Kind of on the pricey side, but they do make a great steak. I come here from time to time and they would have a bits of the steak cut and that really hits the spot.
author: M C.

description:
This place is DELICIOUS.

I know there are plenty of places to eat at this food court and everytime I go eat there I want to try something new...but I always end up here!

+1 for tender tri tip
+1 for delicious sauces
+1 for friendly staff and presentation
+1 for good price and great taste

I've gotten several different kinds of tri tip sandwiches and dishes with different dressings ... one with blue cheese, one with chipotle?, one with red ranch MMMM.

They're all good and all the components of the dish go well together. 

I never liked blue cheese because I always thought it tasted like feet, but I enjoy the cheese here! 

Your tastebuds will definitely become a fan of this place.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Their meat is honestly to die for. It's juicy, succulent, and grilled to perfection. The tri-tip plates tend to be cooked a bit more rare than the sandwiches so if you like your meat with less blood, you might want to ask them if they could cook it more for you. But honestly, medium rare meat is THE BEST if you truly know how to eat your meat. It's the healthiest way to eat it too. But honestly, they know how to cook their tri tip. Their sauce is great too - with a bit of soy sauce, tangy taste. Their red mashers are yum-tastic with the potatoes mashed to perfection with the right amount of gravy on top.

Most of the time when I come to Union Square, I can't resist but to eat here!
author: Elizabeth C.

description: My friend brought me here a few times, when we got hungry after shopping at west field center. We both got the beef salad tortilla bowl. I tried to finish it because it was so good. I'd love to come back.
author: Serena Z.

description: Yum! Yum!  I love this place!  My favorite is the crispy chicken salad because it comes with all kinds of goodness like blue cheese and avocado! yum. yum. yum.  For a $10 salad, it is huge and very much worth the money.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Very mediocre fast food. Meat was not warm and very hard to bite through. Fries cooked in old or burnt oil. If ever go back would try salad.
author: ben h.

description:
Met up my girl friend for a quick meal during her dinner break and decided to go to the Food court in the Westfield Mall since it has a pretty good selection of food. My friend was craving meat, so we came here for her to get it. In the past, I've always enjoyed their delicious tri-tip sandwiches. The meat is always cooked so tenderly and combined with the sauces and toasted bread, they're always delicious.

This time, however, I decided to go with the ROADHOUSE SALAD because I'm on a diet and wanted to be healthy. The portion is huge, with a ton of fried onion strings piled on top. I thought I wasn't going to be able to finish, but ended up finishing it. It was just sooo delicious!! It ended up being less big as I was eating it since I did manage to finish the entire thing. However, I don't think it is the healthiest salad out there. But if you're looking to be semi-healthy and a fan of onion rings, this is definitely the salad for u!
author: Louisa L.

description:
We've been going to Buckhorn ever since their first location opened up at the Metreon, I can't even count how many years ago!  They serve up a really good and consistent Tri-Tip sandwich.  

Whenever I go with the s/o, we each order the Bacon Cheddar Buck.  What's better than Tri-Tip, Cheddar Cheese and Applewood Bacon on a delicious roll?  I order mine as a combo with a drink and Roadhouse Onions, which are just so awesome.  Not quite Onion Rings and not quite an "Awesome Blossom" but better!  We also share a Caesar Salad, which is so huge, it's more than plenty for two people to share.

The entire meal between the two of us costs just under $30 but is totally satisfying.  Now, if they'd only up a Buckhorn in the South Bay, life would be sweet!!!
author: Nick D.

description:
Grudges... don't you just hate them. I held a grudge for a previous experience, but haven't been back because of a lack of time to come here. Today seemed like a good day to benefit from the manager's email for a previous mishap, which entitled me to a free salad. Don't get me wrong... I like a GOOD free meal as much as anyone, but I also wanted to try something different here. I brought my faded, aged email (he remembered my incident) and ordered a Big Buck, their version of the classic French Dip ($7.95) with grilled onions. The Big Buck was hearty and a must for beef lovers. Love that the Au Jus container was big enough for dipping. Because the sandwich was hearty, the salad became my dinner and then some... what a bonus! 
When the manager rang up my lunch and dinner, he refused to charge me... Now this is what I call above and beyond service. I insisted on paying for the Big Buck at the least, but he refused to accept my money. Instead, I dropped it in the tip jar as I still have my sense of justice. Woot woot to the manager Aaron for knowing how to take care of his loyal customers. Yes, I am looking forward to my next time back now!
author: Mike C.

description: Home to the smallest, thinest, cheapest chicken sandwich.  Not good.
author: Mark F.

description: I got the yik yak salad and added the tri tip, WOW! Best tri tip ever, huge portions enough to take home or to share with someone. Highly recommended!
author: Maggy L.

description: Got the try tip plate. Was good for mall food. The veggies and corn were fresh and portions were solid.
author: Darin C.

description: Not bad tri tip I've had better...overpriced if you ask me...$15 for a tri tip wrap & drink...not again
author: Trev C.

description: This is a small chain that has a few locations in the city and california, I would recommend the big buck because it has juicy meat.  The caramelized onions are sweet and go well with the sandwich.  As for the sides, the onion rings/shoestring onions are crispy and tasty.
author: Stevezee C.

description:
Good place to go before the movies to eat.  

Bacon Chedder Buck is the only thing I've had here and it's really good.  My boyfriends tried a couple of other menu items and I can't remember what they are but he never had a complaint.  I really want to try the salads, they look very good.

The only reason why I am giving 3 stars rather than 5 is the service.  Maybe it only happens to me but the service can be pretty rude.
author: Katie J.

description: First time wow I have to say I was impressed. I had a Tri tip sandwich which was great, and the customer service is friendly and inviting! I don't usually even eat the mall food at Westfield probably because I'm preoccupied shopping. I'm definitely coming back here.
author: Marie P.

description:
I was downtown today and in the mood for something new.  I've had just about everything up and down Powell Street over the years (Pizza, Mexican, Thai, American) and decided to stop by the Westfield Food Court since I don't come to downtown that often anymore and there are plenty of food choices down there. 

One of the first places that caught my eye was Buckhorn Grill.   I took a sample of the tri-tip and was impressed.  After scoping out my other options, I decided Buckhorn Grill would be my choice.   

As I was in a bit of rush, I ordered a Philly Buck, with Red Mashers and a drink.  That set me back about $12 or so.  I took the order to go just in case I couldn't find a place to sit.   Alas, if anyone knows Westfield, it is PACKED and since I was by myself, trying to find a quiet place for yourself to eat was a little difficult.  I ultimately decide to take my order to my destination (about a 10 minute walk away from Westfield) and ate my order there. 

So while my order wasn't as fresh as it could have been, I had no qualms about that aspect.  From a taste perspective,  I was a little disappointed in my Philly Buck.  The sandwich was a little saltier than I expected.  This may be due to the fact they were busy and tons of orders  were coming in and the cooks didn't have time to measure the right amount of salt.   The meat, onions and peppers were alright but I may have to eat the sandwich as soon as it's done instead of waiting to give it a true measurement. 

The one pleasant surprise was the "Red Mashers" (or mashed potatoes).  Due to waiting for a few minutes before I ate, the gravy wasn't quite as good as it could have been.  But the mashed potatoes still rated high in my book.  It was lumpy and that's how I like my mashed potatoes.  

Overall, I'll give Buckhorn Grill 3 Stars.  The sandwich wasn't great but I'll definitely give it another shot in the future to see if my initial taste was an aberration.  Of course, I'll be adding a side of mashed potatoes to that order!  :)
author: Donald L.

description:
I was hungry enough to get a Little Spike, which is a mini tri-tip sandwich on the kid's menu, but I was blown away. I don't like meat that is not fully cooked, but this meat was just so tender and juicy that I gobbled it up! Oh my goodness, and it was just a kid's dish! I can only imagine what the huge salads with a mountain of onion strings and tri-tip taste like! 

The kid's meal was abou5 $5 and was about 3 inches long, but it was packed with meat. It also came with shoe string fries, which were light yet crispy. This was perfect for a snack! 

Oh! They also give out free samples of the meat and onion strings! (I took 4 haha)

I will definitely be back!
author: Jenny H.

description:
The GF and I love this place I am more of a chicken person, but this place has some bombay tip sandwiches.

I always get the Ray Buck not on the menu, but you can hear a description of it by Ray Woodson on KNBR. I always add in the onion strings in my Ray Buck , because it adds that extra crunchyness to the sandwich.

Repeat offender!
author: Adam C.

description: Fantastic spot for roast beef lovers. Well prepared and tender with all kinds of different ways you can have it in a sandwich or salad. Pigeons loitering around the outdoor eating area are fat and looks well-fed. I guess they like the roast beef too. It's a quick walk from our SF office so I'll probably be back to fight the pigeons for a table.
author: Bonny B.

description: I had me a Big Buck Sandwich and a side of  Roadhouse Onions , it was delicious!!!!! The meat was a lil to rare for me, but with the Au jus it wasnt that bad!
author: Rene L.

description:
Tasty food and quick service anchor this walk-in restaurant. Lots of seating in the food court area, but not much within the restaurant itself. 

Prices tend to be a little high ($9 for the meal combo) but not too bad. However, they didn't even blink when I ordered the kid's meal for $5 (tri-tip sandwich, fries, sm. drink), so I'm happy. It was plenty of food for a grown-up and would be a lot for a small kid. In addition to tri-tip sandwiches, they also have crispy chicken and several salads. You can also order a whole tri-tip to take home for dinner.

The beef is juicy and flavorful, very well cooked. Fries tend to be crispy, light, and tasty...meaning they're surely cooked in actual beef fat. Mmmm...

Trivia: Tri-tip became popular starting in Santa Maria, CA where it is grilled whole or rotisserie style. It is known for its full flavor, lower fat content, and comparatively lower cost.
author: Jan P.

description:
It's kinda funny. I go here and despite the specialties being meats like tri tip sandwiches and grilled chicken, I seem to always end up getting a salad here. But it's no ordinary salad. The salads could probably feed two people maybe even three. My favorite would be the Cabo Chop salad. Black beans, hicuma, half an avocado, corn, radishes, blue cheese, grilled meat of your choice (optional) all in a tangy sweet citrussy dressing in a crisp tortilla. The salad is HUGE!!! and tasty.

The sandwiches are also really good served up in a roll with fries. Simple yet tasty. I seem to find myself coming back here more than once. For a chain and for what they do they do it pretty well.
author: Hyung L.

description:
Don't let the fact that Buckhorn Grill is in the mall food court fool you - this place has some seriously good eats.

Their basic tri-tip with au jus is flat out amazing. Well spiced, with red and juicy slices of steak and a soft but tasty french roll. The red mashers and gravy are a great compliment to the sandwich.

A sandwich with a side and drink is less than ten bucks; way less than most places with a decent French dip or similar steak sandwich.
author: Nick S.

description: I'm in town on business.......thank you fellow Yelpers for guiding me away from disaster. Went to Westfield food court based on you reccomendations and settled on Buckhorn Grill. I got the roadhouse buck sandwhich. I want to tell you it was good, but it wasn't........it was unbelievably good. Tri tip was cooked perfectly and the bread was soft and fresh. Add the blue cheese and onion straws and Bobs your uncle! To make things even better...... It was only $7.50. That's dirt cheap for San Fran. Really impressed.
author: Ben D.

description:
The roadhouse onions are the best. I usually order the tri-tip and it's delicious. 

The SF Centre Westfield shopping food court is always packed. Finding seating can be very difficult on Fridays and weekends. 

When I'm craving meat, I'm there!
author: Nance H.

description:
I liked Buckhorn Grill fine enough - especially for a mall restaurant - but I agree with the other comments on the service. I wish there was an option to put 3.5 stars but I will put it at 4 because in the end it was pretty good in comparison to some of the garbage you can eat in the Westfield mall.
Why bad service? Not to bore you with the intricacies of my order and how the cashier girl misunderstood but I ended up with a Big Buck plate with a full serving of fries AND an extra plate of fries for two. Needless to say this was way more food than I ordered and she completely misunderstood what I asked for. The manager was surprisingly blasé about the whole thing which makes me think that kind of thing happens all the time.
The food though was good. It is really good tri-tip although the dipping juice made the whole thing too salty. I don't mind drier meats so it didn't bother me to eat it straight but someone who is more of a dipper may have a problem with that. But the sandwich itself was very yummy. Good fresh meat almost without any bad pieces and decent bread too.
And the fries were fantastic and to my taste too. I am a big fan of skinny fries so that was heaven.
So yeah, all in all, I ate everything and enjoyed it. Not perfect or WOW by any means but as far as mall options go, this is at the top of the list and SF meat lovers should definitely try out their stuff at least once.
author: Dorian S.

description:
Everything here is really good
Special shot to their huge salads (and I'm talking ALL CAPS HUGE)
Really tasty
Great prices
What else do you need?
This one is easy: 5 stars
author: Rick P.

description: I would give what I had a 2/5 stars, but I would go again and try something else therefore I gave it a 3/5.  The salads looked good and at the last minute I changed to a portabello sandwich which was underwhelming (soggy, not much flavor).  My husband enjoyed his meal though (burger).
author: Shanlee D.

description: Since I don't eat meat, I can't comment on the deliciously tantalizing tri-tip that passes over the counter while I await my order. But thankfully, Buckhorn has some delicious salad options for non-meat eaters like me. The salad portions are huge for any salad order. I particularly like the Yik Yak with snap peas and jicama. The Roadhouse is my favorite though with their signature onion strings on top. Always have to remind myself to eat in moderation despite their crunchy onion-y goodness! Salads start at $6.50 and of course you can add tri-tip or even salmon if you wish.
author: Anna R.

description:
I love love love this place. The other places at this food court are kinda hit-and-miss. But, if you want a guaranteed good meal, look no further.

I like the tri-tip plate. Steak, mashed potatoes, a roll, and a few veggies thrown in as an afterthought, to make you feel not as guilty...

Also, I really enjoy the Roadhouse "Salad" with tri-tip. It is a "salad", not a salad really, because the small leafy matter hidden underneath the crispy fried onions, bleu cheese, tomatoes, and steak, hardly constitutes a salad, thus it is a "salad". Ladies, if you were thinking of choosing the "salad" as the low-calorie option, consider the tri-tip platter instead, as I actually think it has less calories than this "salad".

Even when I don't have time to stop and eat, I always try and mooch my way over to their free sample person. :D
author: Rachel H.

description: I usually always eat at Sorabol when I go to the mall, but Buckhorn was handing out pieces of tri-tip and as soon as I tasted it I had to have more. Their tri-tip is super yummy and so is their Caesar salad. You can get them together in a wrap too if you like. Sorabol is still my go to place, but if I want steak and salad I'll definitely go back to Buckhorn.
author: Amy W.

description:
My friend Paul is a very interesting character.  He lives in southern california and has come to visit me many a time.  He has interesting quirks, lets loose all the time, and sometimes describes himself as a positive man in a negative world.

So when Paul decided to try buckhorn one day, the world changed.  As we were discussing our lives, he took a bite out of the tritip sandwich and said...

"Adrian, you know... the world isn't that bad.  There are good things in life.  The tritip has shown me the path, and I shall follow."

Get the tritip.  It's awesome.
author: Adrian E.

description:
On my way back from SFO on BART, I begged my boyfriend to stop at Powell so we could go to the Westfield food court for lunch. I had a craving for steak and onion rings, so I decided to try the small plate char-roasted sirloin tri-tip at Buckhorn Grill. It most definitely exceeded my expectations. It was the perfect amount of steak, roasted to tender, juicy perfection. They looked a bit too red, but to my surprise, I didn't find them to be too rare at all- just super soft and flavorful. It came served on a plate of crispy shoe-string onions and this AMAZING creamy horseradish dip. Totally hit the spot AND for less than 9 bucks. Crazy. 

So far, I've never gone wrong with anything from the Westfield food court (waaay beyond any normal mall food court), and my experience at Buckhorn Grill completely reinforced my enthusiasm for this place.
author: Jessie C.

description:
The food here is always delicious. I love their giant salads (especially the Greek) as well as the chicken strips and tasty try-tip. Lots of my co-workers go here too, and I've never heard a bad review. 

As far as the prices, if you're just looking for something to eat on the go, it is quite overpriced ($8 for a salad with no protein). However, if this were an outing with friends/ family/ a date, the prices would be much more tolerable. And if you can get 2 meals out of an entree ( I sometimes can), then you can rest easier. 

To sum up, tasty, heaping portions, but on the pricier side.
author: Alyssa G.

description: I had completely forgotten how mich i love this place. They have the best tri tip sandwich that I ever tasted. I used to go to the other location in emeryville when I worked closer. I just want to say that I murdered that sandwich and I will be going there once a week. The staff was also very nice and friendly. I'm only going here to fulfill my shopping meal needs.
author: Tiffany M.

description: The tri tip is always made very well, always medium rare to perfection because it has no fat anything more will make it concrete, usually order the Big Dad's cut for $17.99 or even the family size for about $28 bucks which is a huge amount of meat!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: N A.

description:
Four stars because they have a great chicken caesar salad.  Chicken is moist and warm, and the dressing is very good.

One star off (maybe 2? ok 2, because no, I'm not "yay, I'm a fan" after my latest visit) because of the bad attitude and rude customer service of the fat 'sample' guy that works at the Westfield location.  I always get a caesar salad with chicken ('always' meaning the dozen or so times I've been there), and always ask for a piece of bread,  and always leave happy ready to enjoy my tasty salad.

Tonight, same deal, order ready, ask for bread, guy behind the counter starts getting me a piece of bread, and that fat sample man interrupts (rudely- as in I've just tried to rob the cash register) "bread is an extra $0.50".  I tell him I always get bread with no problem and he just repeats (not to me, but rather at the boy in the process of getting my bread), "bread is an extra $0.50".

Really??  No big deal, if bread costs extra, that's fine- I just didn't know.  But the awful way the 'sample' man handled the situation was really off-putting.

Uck
author: Kevin C.

description:
Love this place!!!  Whenever I'm at the mall (pretty much every weekend), I'm never surprised that I end up in the Buckhorn line.  First off, as soon as you walk close to their booth, they give you a sample of their fresh tri tip!!  That pretty much seals the deal for me.   My girlfriend and I always share the Cabo Chop Salad.  This thing is monstrous!!  No cheese, no beans, no radishes, double the corn and avocado!!  It also comes in a crunchy taco-bowl type outer shell.  Sometimes we'll also get the tri tip sandwich which is also tasty.  The tri tip is cooked thoroughly and still keeps its flavor in every bite.  The French onion soup is great for a cold winters day. 

I must give this place kudos for almost always getting our order correct.  Its not easy to accommodate my high demands, but they sure try!! 

*nom nom*
author: Steve H.

description:
They've since removed the burgers from the menu...something to do with food court politics - there should only be one burger establishment and Burger Bistro down the way has first dibs. I'm just guessing that's the reason, and I find it ridiculous. 

Still, I love this place for their giant salads and deliciously tender tri-tip. I'll keep coming back.
author: Elaine W.

description:
When you're craving salty and beefy stuff, where do you go?  Buckhorn! Esp. when you work around the downtown area.  It's a cheap way to satisfy your cravings, which was what I wanted.

It's def. something different from the regular sandwiches that you normally get.
author: AhLin C.

description: Was excited to try their food based on the reviews but did not meet up to the hype! Had the little buck sandwich and the meat was super salty! Would not try again.. Onion strings were alright.. Crispy and they gave a lot
author: Stephanie K.

description: My husband and I have made it a habit of having lunch here after our spa day at Burke Williams. I usually go for the Roadhouse salad with tri-tip add-on which is a good portion at a reasonable $10.50. The tri-tip is very tasty and always cooked just right. If you haven't tried it, you can get a taste from the sample guy. If you're lucky, he'll have the crispy shoestring onions too. That's how we got hooked in the first place...we come here whenever we're in downtown.
author: Katie L.

description: Best mashed potato's I've had my entire life! I live in Orange County & when I would go visit my sister she would tell me about this place, I thought she was wierd for thinking such delicious food could come from the food court at the mall. My mouth waters thinking about them. So sad I love so far away :( Love this place. Their steak too yummy.
author: Michelle M.

description:
1 Big Buck and 1 Roadhouse Salad "To-Go". I had heard good things about their Roadhouse Salad so I was dying to try it. I'm so glad I did, it was a huge salad - I split it amongst 4 people. It came with a huge stack of greens, tomatoes, Roadhouse fried onion strips, walnuts with honey basic vinaigrette and bleu cheese on the side. My co-worker had the chickenshrrom sandwich and had only positive comments. We knew it was good when he wouldn't share his sandwich with anyone. I split the Big Buck with my co-worker and found the tri-tip to be very salty. I ended up throwing the meat on top of the salad hoping the honey vinaigrette would sweetened the meat. 

Service was fast and packaged nicely for take out. I ate comfortably back in the office. Those fried Buckhorn onions are addicting and go well with anything on this menu. Prices are reasonable and I feel like I get good value for the dollar for lunch.
author: Candace F.

description: Pretty tasty food for the money. Tip - get any menu item with the word "Tri-tip" in it :) Their take on onion rings is pretty interesting - they serve them shredded. And they don't skimp. Good atmosphere in the restaurant itself. The restroom next door on the other hand... You'll be waiting for about 10 minutes to wash your hands because homeless people will be slowly and meticulously washing various body parts with no sense of urgency due to the expanding lineup behind them.
author: Aleks O.

description:
So your at the Metreon and waiting to see your movie, but are hungry and want something that taste good...well your in luck. The Buckhorn Grill delivers big on taste.

 Most places inside malls or shopping centers have just OKAY food, but this place is different. They offer a wide variety of great Salads, Burgers, Sandwich, and Fries.

Next time your at the Metreon and hungry strikes, check this place out.
author: Nick C.

description:
How can the best tri-tip I've ever had come from a food court in a mall?  I have no idea!  I'm still scratching my head on this one.

I was on vacation and doing a little shopping.  Normally, I wouldn't visit a food court, but you see, they have Beard Papas here. Let me explain, when I travel, I do my research on Yelp.  I have my meals laid out in advance.  So, there's no room in my potbelly to waste.

Buckhorn caught me by surprise.  It wasn't that there was an employee passing out free samples.  I didn't even see her till I came back and stood in line.  It was all the people passing by with their food trays.  I'm not a huge fan of tri-tip!  But man, everyone's food looked so good! 
 
I'm gonna have to agree with their slogan "The best tri-tip on the planet!"  Tender, juicy, flavorful thinly sliced tri-tip....after my sandwich, I was too full and had to cancel our dinner reservations at House of Prime Rib.  

So why only 4 stars?  With 7 locations up in Northern California, someone needs to open one in Orange County!
author: Minna T.

description:
I always go for the sandwiches here and personally, they're decent. For less than $10 you get a sandwich with a TON of meat and some onions. The lines are short and the meat is good. The Anju sauce is meh, I think it provides a very good flavor for some people but it didn't really hit it off for me. It had a very thin flavor like it was something that was watered down from something thicker, not sure how else to describe it. 

The tri-tip is ok. It's not very flavored and its too thin to be really mouth watering and savory. Just a note for anyone who didn't look at picture, this sandwich is MEAT, onions, and bread. Beware the rush that is the mall seating arrangements. 

If you want good mall food, this is probably the best place in the mall. If you want real lunch, go outside.
author: Rohan D.

description: I'm not a huge meat tri tip lover, and I thought it was alright. I dont like how fatty it was. However... the onion rings were soooo good! Get them! Also the horseradish sauce they have its excellent.
author: Jess O.

description:
It is a rare occasion that I find a food experience outside the home AMAZING and this Buckhorn is out of this world!  

I stopped only because I was tempted with a sample of the tri-tip and it is easily the best sample I have had in the past five years.  I mean, who wants to eat steak from a food court?  I had the Char-Roasted Sirloin Tri-Tip Regular (6 oz for $12.95) with fries instead of mashers and I enjoyed each and every perfectly cooked bite.  The fries were freshly crisp and barely seasoned -perfect for the barbecue sauce I added.  The veggies were roasted to a sweet and savory perfection.  The Tri-Tip, oh the Tri-tip.  Have you ever had an overcooked beautiful piece of red meat that leaves you longing for the delicious gratification you wished for?  The Tri-Tip is the manifestation of a dream!  I wish the meal was not so filling so I could have shopped and come back for seconds.

For you all who will be rushing through:  I waited a maximum of eights minutes to order and receive my meal.  In the meantime I enjoyed exploring the range of refreshments available and probably would have waited longer at a "fast food" joint.  Don't let impatience cause you to miss out on a great thing.

P.S.  The salads looked equally orgasmic.
author: Shauen P.

description: I admit I was skeptical about having lunch at a fast food place in a mall; but a fellow CM had nothing but good things to say, so a few of us packed in today to check it out. We ordered on the same ticket, got our pager, and took a seat. The pager went off a few minutes later, but only one of the meals was ready. So the rest of us hovered over the pick-up counter until our orders came out quite a bit later. I ordered the chipotle sandwich -- a fair amount of tri tip, that was tender and yummy, sandwiched in a just-right baguette, smeared with chipotle that has a nice kick -- for $7. Definitely above-par from what I expected, and a good lunch price-point; I'd visit again!
author: Christina G.

description: This place serves up great food with huge portions.  I wish they had a stand alone store in NC that we could visit.  We both had the steak platter that was more than enough for one person.
author: Dave C.

description:
The free tri-tip sample got me!

I ordered the tri tip platter.  Got my tri tip medium...very tender and tasty.  I'm a purist and I love the taste of the beef with nothing on it.  The mashed potatoes were also well seasoned and I never finish it.  This time I did.  Yum!  I guess the rest of the plate (grilled veggies and a mini corn on the cob) was just for decoration purposes.  The veggies were grilled, but there was nothing special about it.  I would have been very happy with just the beef and potatoes.

I have one close to me in Midtown Sac.  I'll be sure to try that location as well.
author: Will C.

description:
Surprisingly delicious. Ordered 2 Lttle Bucks with caramelized onions and a Yik Yak salad to go. They give you a little flasher light and send you on your way. The food was ready in about 5 minutes, all bagged to go. 

The Little Bucks had a ton of meat in them. Honestly, it is not necessary to order the Big Buck. The Little Buck has more red meat than one person needs in a sitting. It is smokey and seasoned just right. You have the option of ordering it with au jus instead of caramelized onion. The bread suits the sandwich. The Yik Yak salad is crispy and fresh with a nice combination of ingredients. It was served  with a  side of delicious "Asian inspired" thick dressing full of ginger, garlic and sesame seed oil. The edible bowl it is served in is inedible...the only flaw. Who knew food mall food could be this yum?
author: Bleep S.

description:
Great place to grab a quick bite before catching a movie at the metreon! 

We had some time to kill before our movie started and we decided to shop around the mall for a bit before getting something to eat. Conveniently, Buckhorn Grill is located right in the food court of the Westfield Shopping Center. I was told their tri-tip here was quite tasty and definitely worth the stop, so there we were.

I got their Char-Roasted Sirloin Tri-Tip Platter which came with thickly sliced yet deliciously marinated tri-tip pieces, a side of vegetables, and their extremely yummmmmy fries! MMmm i love their fries - so crispy on the outside and so soft and potato-y on the inside. Just how I like it. I also had an extra side order of onion strings which came out pretty good but a little too oily for me.  Overall, the tri-tip was pretty good, not the best, but still better than many other places I've tried. The meat was juicy but I felt it was a tad bit too cooked for my liking. 

I'll definitely come back to try their Yik-Yak Salad the next time I'm around the area.
author: Cathy N.

description: After a long day of shopping, Buckhorn Grill in the massive SF shopping center foodcourt was exactly what a girl needed to regain strength. Ordered the Buckhorn salad and it was the Best salad I had ever had for lunch. Salad included the crispy onion strings, lettuce, feta cheese, walnuts and that addicting honey balsamic vinegarette dressing. So so good..Wished I got the tri tip with, until next time...
author: Jennifer A.

description:
The salad portions at this stop in the Bloomingdales Food Court are HUGE. I always order the salad with cubes of tri tip, corn, black beans, blue cheese, avocado, and other yummy veges inside a big tortilla shell. The dressing on this particular salad is sweet and refreshing. I'll then take it to the nearby Yerba Buena Gardens with friends, and make a small dent before saving the rest as leftovers.

The steak at this place is so tender and flavorful. I gobble up the samples before and after I stand in line, and the girls who offer them are friendly. The food is reasonably priced, especially for the amount you get. And I've never had to wait very long for my order to come up.

This is a great place to have lunch.
author: Ali W.

description: My go to place for delicious and huge salads. A little pricey but worth it for the freshness and consistently great taste. I love the added bonus of the tostada shell - just that little bit of fried crispyness! I joined their frequent customer program that gives a $10 gift certificate for every $100 in cumulative spending. Just give your info to the cashier and then they can look you up by your phone number the next time. The line gets long at lunchtime but I've never had to wait longer than 10 minutes to get my salad - love that I can take it to go too.
author: Kristy C.

description:
Eating a Buckhorn grill has become a disappointment lately.

Eating there 2 years ago was way different.  the tri tip was perfectly cooked, tender and truly flavorful for an inexpensive cut of meat.  

About two months ago I had the trip tip ad it was really quite good, I had a portion that was thinly sliced that they normally add to salads. The other thing I had was a bowl of very good cream clam chowder.  It was a
satisfying lunch and i was happy.

3 weeks later I was back and I wasn't happy with the tri tip as it was really chewy and had zippo flavor.  It was truly a major disappointment as 
I was really looking forward to it.  TRULY BUMMED OUT as the mashed red potatoes were lukewarm........................  Had to ask for them to heated up.  How can they serve lukewarm spuds???????

Back again...........................  this shocked even me.  Eating at The Westfield is not on my FOOD RADAR BUT A BEST GF works there and we can have lunch.

Zooooooooooooooot alors, Tough meat and lukewarm spuds again. They obliged me again and I got hot spuds BUT I DON'T WANT TO HAVE TO ASK FOR THEM!!!

Plus the counter fem was not very nice and argued with me and told me I couldn't have what I ordered!  Cannot believe that, if it is on the board with a price, why the challenge with a customer?  Anyway, she stomped off to ask her manager if I could have  it  AS ORDERED  I WAS      TRULY   D I S P L E A S E D.

The manager said I could and I got it.  But why the challenge???  Would I lie about something like that?????  

Bottom line:  The manager gave me a voucher for a free meal and I got TOUGH TRI TIP and LUKEWARM SPUDS......Grrrrrrrrrrrrr

Besides, the salads are wasteful, too big.  I got a side salad and gave half to my GF as it was just too BIG.

Doubtful I'll go again as I have started cooking my own tri tip at home with a coffee~cocoa rub that I make and it is even better than their's.
MY spuds are ALWAYS HOT!
author: ELINOR H.

description:
Food - I only got a salad, and the reason why I'm giving two stars is because the service suckkkked. Granted, it was during dinner time but still.. I left very very unsatisfied, both in appetite and service.

I ordered a fruit and nut salad, after realizing that I craved some sort of fruit for dinner since I haven't had any real fruit in the last couple of days (yes, I know.. bad :( )

After waiting about 10 mins for my food, I realized the person at the cash registered messed up my order. Apparently my receipt said 'cajun salad'.. I'm not sure what happened there, either she didn't hear me correctly or entered it wrong. So when I got my food with a confused look, I was ready to take it and go.. why did my fruit and nuts salad come in a tostada? So I double checked and indeed my order was wrong. 

I told them I ordered a fruit and nut salad.. and the guy, stressed, stared me in the eye and said "the receipt says you ordered a cajun." After explaining that I did order a Fruit and Nut salad, he said, okay wait just a minute. I waited just a few minutes and he gave me my correct order. +1 star

After setting my food down and ready to eat my food. My friend notices a small green speckled beetle on my salad. Great. I pick up the beetle with my fingers and drop it on the floor.. I would've went back and complained, but I was too tired, lazy, and hungry to do so. 

The salad was meh. Only 2 slices of apples and 2 slices of strawberries.. with some dried fruit thrown in. The nuts were sparse.. and some of the greens had a dirt aftertaste. Needless to say, I won't be ordering salad from here... I didn't even finish my $8 salad because I just lost my appetite. 

My friends ordered some salmon sandwich. I think they liked it. +1 star.
author: Jenn L.

description:
Wow. This place rocks!  The portions are huuuge, the food is delicious and the price is great.
I got a salad and added tri tip - total $10. I have a healthy appetite and I think I only got through a third of my salad. It was outstanding (and as I type its making me crave it again). My bf got the sirloin platter with two huge pieces of perfectly cooked meat, roasted veggies and mashed potatoes. Yummmm. 
I definitely recommend Buckhorn, but make sure you come hungry :)
author: Lynn M.

description:
Buckhorn Grill is a pretty good chain to get some tasty tri tip. Every so often when we're tired of another place in the San Francisco Centre food court, we'll go to Buckhorn. They always give free samples of their tri tip, along with some onion strings. Recently, my fiancee bought a Groupon worth $20 for $10 here.

I really enjoyed getting the Roadhouse Buck sandwich (tri tip with onion strings, red ranch sauce, and bleu cheese crumbles), but with thinly sliced meat instead of the thick tri tip.

Most of their items are pretty delicious. I'm jealous of this one guy who, at a Warriors game, made a halfcourt shot to win tri tip from Buckhorn for a year!
author: John C.

description:
Yum!  Gourmet fast food, as Jessica C. says, for real!  We split the yik-yak salad (HUGE) and the sirloin tri-tip platter.  Wow!

Yik-yak salad- highly recommended.  Sesame, jicama, almonds, lots of other flavors.  Served in a big fat tortilla.  Good veggie option, huge huge salad.

Sirloin tri-tip: uggggh the tri-tip here is SO GOOD.  Wonderful meat!  Liked the mashed potatoes and perfectly grilled veggies on the side too.

Random note: the mall closed the bathroom early, before the mall and food court closed.  So.... yeah.  Watch out for that.
author: Yen D.

description:
I've been going to Buckhorn Grills for the past decade. The first thing you notice when you eat a sandwich from Buckhorn, is how delicious and perfect the meat is...large slabs of slow roasted juicy tri tip piled high. Perfect with a little au jus and creamy horseradish. The sandwiches are priced reasonably and with the amount you get, a pretty good deal.

Their burgers are alright too, but I'm not a fan of the way too fluffy, not chewy enough, bun that it comes on.
author: Cristofer P.

description:
The boy and I stopped by the basement level of the Westfield shopping center for a quick bite before our IMAX experience of "Watchmen" at the Metreon. 

If you're unfamiliar with which unit space Buckhorn Grill is, they are the ones who shamelessly lure customers (like me) in with their Tri-Tip samples. Yummy. 

I was torn between the fruit and nut Tri-Tip salad and the Little Buck sandwich (served with caramelized onions and Au Jus dipping sauce). Then.. the two lunchtime words I could never refuse, melded into one:

Chickenshroom!! 

I requested a crispy chicken in the place of charbroiled. Don't be shy- ask for what you want. Add a fountain drink and your choice of fries, onion rings, salad, or mashed potatoes for $2.45. The friendly staff at Buckhorn will be happy to accommodate. This is a food EMPORIUM after all.
author: Elaine T.

description:
This review will be very useful....

Do Not order a sandwich here. The meat is pretty damn good and sandwiches RUIN that....

First off, the bread is blah. Second, they presentation of this sandwich makes it look absolutely unappetizing. I picked the meat off and ate it. The cheese the melted on it was also totally unappetizing. I have NEVER in my life REMOVED cheese from a food item. This I did.

The fries were Crap too. But still, STILL the tri-tip was GREAT. Order an entree (meat without crap on it to ruin it) with a nice side (not fries).
author: Jessica L.

description:
We came here because we bought a Groupon. I figured it was a good excuse to try the restaurant. Since it is located at the AMC Metreon, we also included a movie. Boy, were we surprised. I loved the small order of Salmon with came with sweet potato fries (I'm a sucker for sweet potato fries). 

We bought two entrees and two drinks and we only had to pay an additional $3. I'd come here again.!
author: arleen r.

description:
I want some now as you are reading this. 


Yes, I still want some. The man and I grabbed some lunch here and shared one plate and it was good enough for the both of us. The tri-tip was medium rare, but that's the way to have it. It was mouth watering delish!

I don't know what else to say that he hasn't said. I just wanted to add to the stars. =) Ha!
author: Clarisse C.

description: Good salad for the price paid.  Had the yik yak and had dressing on the side.  Salad was way too thick and too sweet.    Large portion and was offered protein as Ana edition to it.  Service was quick although the cashier could not figure out the $1 yelp discount.
author: ken p.

description:
TRI TIP FTW.

I'm so glad they were passing out samples of tri-tip in the front or else we would've ended up somewhere crappy. 

The chicken and tri-tip combo came with mashed potatoes, sauteed mushrooms, grilled veggies, and a tiny corn on the cob. It was good enough for 2 people looking for a moderately sized lunch.

It's places like this that make this mall food court the classiest one.
author: Jeffrey L.

description:
food:5/5
service 5/5 (cashier only, in mall food court)

Buckhorn Grill is my favorite place to eat in the mall food court. It has generous portions and everything is delicious. I usually don't come here for a meal but as a snack. I split the salad between friends so we all get a little. My favorite salad is Road house salad that comes with greens, tomato, bleu cheese, fried onions, green beans, and dressing. I usually get meat that costs extra ($2.5-3) since I like my salads with meat. The total comes out to about $11.

The reason why I am giving this place only a 3 star is because they have dramatically DECREASED their salad portions to almost half what it used to be and kept the same prices. I feel unjustified to pay $11 for a plate of veggies that no longer fills you up as a meal. Even for san francisco this is expensive for mall food, given the portion. I've heard from other people that they have been testing out portion sizes so you get less food for more money. I really hope that they go back to their previous portion sizes or else I will never come here again when there are so many cheaper options around.
author: Cecile S.

description:
If you are looking for a quick, HUGE salad, indulge in Buckhorn Grill. I tried the taco salad which came in a taco shell the size of my head. It was filled with fresh lettuce, avocado, jicama, cherry tomato, corn and black beans. 
It was a lot of salad to eat and the edible bowl was so full of food that once the crispy shell broke, it made a huge mess all over the table. 
Word to the wise, don't break the shell on an overly full tortilla bowl until you have eaten at least half its contents.
author: Janell D.

description: I come to this food court 2 times a week to meet with my better half as he takes his lunch break and I am heading home. I skip dinner at home and this is one way we get to have a quick dinner date. Often enough it's Buckhorn that we would chose because I'm a carnivore. The tr-tip with veggies and mash potatoes usually does a great job for both of us. However today I was treated rudely by the server/cook. He was heavy set curly haired middle age latin dude that just does not have any customer appeal. This is what I say to those who work the kitchen..."IF YOU CAN'T TAKE THE HEAT LEAVE!!". I only give you another star because the oysters are reasonable...that's about it... Because i eat at this mall for dinner at least twice a week, i would most likely will not go here to often now.
author: Ateh M.

description:
For mall food, Buckhorn Grill is great.  I have been to the Westfield Mall one on Market St. and the new one in the renovated Metreon.  

I typically order the dinner combo with the Char Roasted Sirloin Tri-Tip and Chicken Breast which comes with two sides (ie. mashed potatoes w/ gravy & garden salad are my usual).  The beef is juicy, somewhat tender, and and has good flavor.  Portions are pretty big too. I would even go as far to say that their food quality can be compared to some lower end restaurants.  However, you may pay more than most other food options in the Metreon or Westfield food courts.  As a result, I eat here sparingly.

They have burgers and sandwhiches too which I hope to try next time as well as main salad options that are a little cheaper than the plates.  

Give them a shot and see if the price is worth it.  I think it is once in a while.
author: June P.

description: Pleasantly surprised here. The phrase "Mall Food" doesn't exactly inspire much culinary confidence, but if three is the average, this place gets a fourth star for its quality taste and value portions. One tri tip should fill you up (I went with the southwestern/chipotle option), and it tasted great as well. Not gonna go out of my way downtown, but if I'm stuck somewhere nearby and passing through, I'll come in again
author: Taylor C.

description: Probably one of the best tri tip sammie I've ever had. Little buck with caramelized onions and au jus paired with tomato basil soup...HEAVEN. Oh, and the IPA complimented the flavors of my meal. One word-LEGIT.
author: Mabel N.

description: This my absolute fave place to eat at the Westfield center. I love the fruit and nut salad with tri-tip on top and a glass of red wine. All mall food should be this good!  Although they seem to have as many employees working behind the counter as they do customers in front, they never get out food in less than 20 mins.
author: Kim W.

description:
I've ended up here twice in the past two weeks during the lunch time wander. Simple sliced meat sandwiches served with a side of au jus. The fries could be better, but I should really refrain from ordering the combo (a side and a soda) with my Big Buck.

The food here is consistent, and the sandwiches usually come out pretty quickly.
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description: Actually 3.5.  Tri-tip combo pretty good but a bit pricey for casual food court dining.  Hence minus 0.5 stars.  Mashed potatoes nicely done also.  For "fast food", this is a nice alternative which is close to restaurant sit down quality but without the fanfare.  Handled allergies very well as staff seemed pretty knowledgable.
author: B W.

description:
Damn! The tri-tip is bangin! Fried onion ring thangs! Grilled veggies! Mashed potatoes to die for! OH BOY!

I wish I knew someone who worked here so they can put a little extra on that plate.

All this talk is making me wanna go there!

Keep it comin' Buckhorn!
author: Ivan F.

description:
my husband and i had lunch here purely based on the yelp reviews. and our lunch was just average. the sliced beef on the sandwich was tender, but really didn't have any flavor.

i would have tried other restaurants in the food court, but i ordered such a huge sandwich. my advice. order the smallest one they have if you have to try it.
author: Le E.

description:
In the middle of Christmas shopping, feeling a little peaked.  Need something to get me back going again.  Saw the sign for Buckhorn Grill, and headed straight for it.

Yeah, there was a little line in front, and they do give you a beeper to let you know when your order is ready (implies a long wait).  But their thickly-cut slices of seasoned tri-tip were too hard to resist.  Placed my order, paid for it, and waited with my beeper.  Fortunately, didn't have time to go back to my seat because my order was ready in less than 3 minutes....yeah!

Filled up a little container for ketchup (for my fries), and another one for some BBQ sauce, and proceed back to the Signature Seating Area (see http://www.yelp.com/biz/visa-signiture-holiday-in-san-francisco-san-francisco#hrid:UR7nWhHcvQxaugeRKMgTig)

I ordered a Roadhouse Buck, which is a tri-tip sandwich topped with fried Roadhouse Onions, and bleu cheese crumbles.  Yeah, I'll have some stinky breath, but I'm with family.  As I made my first bite, my teeth cut into the bread, through the crunchy onion strings, through the bleu cheese, and through the tender tri-tip (it's been more than 12 hours, and I can still taste it).
