The tri tip was tender as always, not chewy or tough.  The bleu cheese added a nice bite with the onion strings.

I only had a couple of fries, because my kids ate them all.  But from what I had, they were freshly made, and not dry.

After I finished this sandwich, I was energized and ready to go!
author: Steve L.

description: Very tasty and fresh. I love the grilled chicken with grilled veggies and mashed potatoes (with gravy). :-)
author: Robyn M.

description:
Roadhouse Salad with Tri-Tip

Orgasmic.  Think I'm over-exaggerating?  Think again.  It is truly, genuinely, undeniably  "THAT GOOD".  This salad has everything I want in it.  Loads of sliced, juicy tri-tip.  Gobs of blue cheese.  Delicous green beans.  Crisp, fresh greens.  A generous portion of fried onnions (OMG).  And an ever so tantalizing vinegarette.  Simply pefection.  Occasionally when I feel like a fatty (who do I think I'm kidding with the occasionally there?) I get a side of fries.  Which are also very, very, very good.  One of my favorite places to eat and refuel after a day of window shopping, because I spend all my money on food and have none left to clothe myself.  Thats right, I eat naked.  Whatcha gonna do about it?

Minus one star because finding a place to sit in the food court seriously sucks balls. Beyond atrocious.  I've come close to blows over securing a four top.
author: Chelsea C.

description:
Keeping this short..

The husband ordered - tri tip steak sandwich with au jous and fries.  *** stars.  Steak was on the salty side.  My husband had to take some meat OUT and add fries to lessen the salty taste.

I ordered:  Grilled salmon (small plate).  Came nicely grilled with lemon wedges.  Two big pieces of salmon for only 10 bucks!  I didn't order sides because I'm starving myself.. j/k, sorta. 

Will we come back?  Yes, I'll order the same thing, and my husband will order something different :)
author: Alice E.

description: Wow. My new favorite spot to grab a great salad near work! My friend and I were downtown, running errands, and starving. We decided on Buckhorn Grill for one of their scrumptous salads for lunch. So glad we did! I ordered the Yik Yak salad with crisp greens, cabbage, jicama, snow peas, red bell peppers and toasted almonds all tossed with a sweet sesame dressing. It was crunchy and delicious! I also added grilled wild salmon on top to get my Omega 3's. What a healthy and fulfilling meal. I will definitely be back!
author: Anne E.

description:
Roadhouse salad w/tri-tip.

That's all you need to keep shoppin' til close.
author: Saori H.

description: The onion fried things are kinda ok,   sandwiches overpriced.
author: Michael E.

description:
I grew up in Shell Beach by San Luis Obispo and went to school in Santa Barbara so I've had more tri-tip than you will probably ever eat. Whenever I see it on a menu and it looks like it is done right, I always go for it.  Sadly, there are not a lot of places with good tri-tip in the Bay Area.  I really wanted to like this place but th buns killed it for me.

I ordered the Roadhouse Buck: First of all they were cold..you dont make a tri tip sandwhich on a cold bun.  It wasnt even toasted and cold..just sloppily placed there.  On a positive note, the bleu cheese they use was a fantastic match to the meat.  Tri Tip was pretty good...but the cold bun distracted me from the good parts.

Secondly, Tri Tip is not supposed to be thinly sliced, it should be cut into thick slices.  The Roadhouse was the ONLY sandwhich that was thick sliced...glad I love bleau cheese!

On a positive note, the guy at the corner was really cool.  He actually acted like he enjoys his job (they better hook him up with lots of tri-tip!)

Overall, definitely can't give them 5 but I decided mid sandwhich that I just couldn't give them a 4.  Hopefully they figure out their bun situation because I definitely would raise my rating.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: So I went to college in SLO which is where tri tip was born. I was fairly sad to graduate and leave that magical town, especially Firestones restaurant. When I moved to SF I was craving tri tip and stumbled upon this place. Best tri tip in the Bay Area!!! I recommend the roadhouse buck with onion rings and blue cheese!! I'm getting hungry just writing this review. They also have multiple locations so very convenient to visit.
author: Shahram S.

description: so you're late to a movie at the metreon and you need to grab a quick bite to eat.  this is a good food court place to share the roadside salad and add tri-tip.  just sample some tri-tip to taste the flavor.  could also go with the grilled chicken in the salad.  the crispy onions are great.  $1 off on yelp too
author: Rob C.

description:
Maybe I just went on an off night, because this place seems to be fairly well regarded on Yelp.  I kid you not, though, my tri-tip sandwich tasted like bologna.  As in, "My tri-tip has a first name, it's O-S-C-A-R".  That kind of bologna.  I couldn't believe it.

Once the initial shock passed, I pulled a piece out from the sandwich and handed it off to my roommate, who concurred (after gagging a little) with my assessment.

You have to try pretty damn hard to make tri-tip taste like a nasty Oscar Meyer food "product."  But they succeeded, because Buckhorn Grill just has a way with b-o-l-o-g-n-a.
author: Adam W.

description: The tri tip sandwich has been described to me as "heart attack on a plate". The Cheddar Buck is conceptually awesome: cheddar cheese, smoked bacon, red ranch sauce  and tri tipped packed into a loaf. Awesome. Now it would be angina inducing if it were bigger but the portions here are not that big and if you've seen the size of the Philly Steaks at Amato's (gander the 24" http://www.amatoscheesesteaks.com/menu.xml), you'll truly know what an aorta plugging sandwich is. However it's still decently tasty and with a side a fries it is definitely a good way to ruin a diet. 3.5 stars
author: Kim N.

description: Soooooo, I had no idea I was gonna have to eat lunch here... I was actually forced to go to the mall and eat because I was trying to meet with someone to discuss a business matter but unfortunately they were on a two hour lunch... SO... off to the mall!  It was lunch time, and a weekday so it was pretty busy at the "food court"/food emporium.  Nothing looked very appetizing because I was stressed out but I saw their (faux? I don't know if it's actualy food or fake food in there) salads in the display case.  The crispy chicken and avocado salad caught my eye, so right away I knew what I wanted.  I asked the hub what he wanted and he said the same thing! So I told him to get something else and we'd split and share since the salads look GINORMOUS!  Our food didn't take too long to come out.  The salad was actually really good and the chicken was really tasty!  I decided to swap the blue cheese for feta since he doesn't like blue cheese.  It was really refreshing and tasty.  The hub got a tri tip sandwich, which was okay but I found it a little salty but I did enjoy the mashed potatoes!
author: Kymberli C.

description: Wonderful tri-tip along with roadhouse onions! I usually prefer the medium-done meat. I have tried the Greek salad with extra beef and that was great as well. For $9+tax for the small platter of sirloin tri-tip, the food is as good as it gets.
author: Lazeeb C.

description:
Normally when I go to Buckhorn I go knowing that I am going to get a tri-tip sandwich.  So, I've never really looked at the menu.  I had no idea they had grilled chicken or that they had platters.  So, I got me a tri-tip/chicken combo the other night.

Here's how it scored:

+3    for super tasty tri-tip
-2     for giving me a super fatty piece
+2    for some yummy moist chicken breasts
-1     they did taste a little oily
-2     for having Diet Pepsi instead of Diet Coke
+2    for asking me if I cared
-1     for not having a larger cup
+1    for the yummy veggies esp the sweet potato, carrots & corn
+2    for the addiction causing onion strings
-1     for giving me an addiction to something fried
----
+3
author: Jeff P.

description:
Oh the power of the free sample!

Michael M and I were at the mall shoe shopping on our lunch break....yes this is the reason he is the BEST assistant of all time!

We were approached by a guy with samples of tri-tip....sign us up! The sample was bomb and we hopped in line.

I ordered the mixed greens fruit and nut salad with grilled salmon on top.  It  was lite and so tasty. I am not sure what was in the dressing but I think it was one part ranch, one part crack...it was sooooo good!

I also got a cup of the french onion soup but I think I will pass on it next time, the salad was enough and totally hit the spot. It is good to know there is still healthy yummy options hiding out in the Westfield food court!
author: Alicia K.

description: This place is fantastic.  Ordered the Tri Tip Sirloin for myself, Little Buck for the wife and Chicken Tenders for the daughter.  Everything was really good.  Beef was tender and cooked perfectly.  Mash was a little salty but the grilled veggies were perfect.  My wife who normally isn't a sandwich person enjoyed her meal and so did my daughter.  This is how all fastfood should be.  It certainly changed my perception of what was possible.  Too bad they only have limited locations.  Hope they expand soon!
author: Es P.

description: Food was good but service sucks!! I came here for lunch and ordered the soup and salad combo which is $6.99 and the cashier charged me $7.99 for "today's special" that came with a drink. I told him I didn't want a drink because I already had a drink in my hand and he told me to just take a bottle of water. It's fine if the meal really came with a drink but if I had the option to not have the drink and pay less, wouldn't you think he would suggest that option? I normally would also get a mall discount but the cashier did not apply the discount and told me "oh the special is already discounted". I didn't even want the "special" that came with a drink!!Also, my order was to go and they did not even give me a fork or napkins!! How the hell was I suppose to eat?! Good thing I ended up eating there and not taking it back to work. I love this place because they have good food but they seriously need to provide better service.
author: Iris L.

description:
I'm gonna throw out a word here.  This is a word I do not use lightly, but I'm going to use it now:

Beefgasm
author: Kyla B.

description:
As delicious in theory as a fried onion sandwich may be, that's not what I ordered. 

When one orders a chicken sandwich, one expects for chicken to actually be in the sandwich. This is no dramatization of portion, my friends.  They forgot to put the chicken in my chicken sandwich and I discovered this too late, back at my office. Luckily, my coworker didn't like the looks of the chicken on her salad and gave it to me so I could have an actual lunch.

Shame too, as the food that I actually received was quite good and comparable in price to other FiDi places of lesser quality. But still- dude, you didn't put chicken in my chicken sandwich. 1 star for you.
author: jessica s.

description: I ordered the Roadhouse salad with NO WALNUTS, and added toasted almonds. Thankfully, I am not severely allergic to walnuts, or I'd be dead. Lucky for me my lips are only itchy. I count 5 walnuts in my salad. Don't eat here if you have any allergies to nuts or other items that may be on the menu.
author: D S.

description:
Imagine you are bored out of your mind in class and can't wait for a break. Finally the teacher lets you out of class and you go wandering down to the food section of WestField shopping center. After walking around for a little bit you see a lady giving out free samples of Tri Tip, so you go over and grab one. This was my experience last week. I have since gone back every night I have class (3 times a week) to get free samples. The tri tip is amazing. 

I have gotten the Tri Tip sandwich with caramelized onions. It was really good. I ended up taking it back to class to eat and was worried I might offend a vegetarian but all i heard after class were people asking where I got the sandwich from because it smelled so good. 

My Friends have also tried the Caesar Salad and another salad with chicken strips on it (forgot the name), both time they were very impressed with the salads and I will definitely be heading back there again for free samples and food.
author: Alex R.

description: I got the tri-tip sandwich and the meat was a little rubbery. I have definitely had better at other places. I think there are better places to eat around that food court.
author: Brandon R.

description:
If it weren't for those onion strings .... well, I just don't know.  Those are very good, addicting, greasy ... and so good.

The sandwiches are also very good.  I opted for the Little Buck Philly Style, which is 4 oz. of tri tip steak with onions, peppers, and cheese.  It is served with a side of au jus, which is mandatory, because the sandwich would be very dry without it.  You can upgrade your sandwich to a meal which included onion strings, or fries and a drink for a few bucks more.  I have had the platters too, which is sliced tri tip, mashed pots, and veggies for a bit more than $10 ... also very good.  People are raving about the blue cheese steak, so I will try to get that one next.

Every time I go, I keep wanting to get the Roadhouse Salad ... I keep saying in my head ... roadhouse salad ... roadhouse salad ... but when I order, somehow my mouth says ... "Little Buck Philly Style meal please."

Grab your pager, and wait for your meal to be served on real plates!
author: Michael M.

description:
I really enjoyed this place. Honestly, I've never really gave it a second thought of eating here, but today it really smelled great. I had to try! 

I had the tri tip sandwich with cheddar cheese applewood bacon and a side of fries. The tri tip was pretty good. Tender, tasty and not overloaded with fatty bits. The cheese and bacon were an awesome topping addition. The fries were perfectly cooked. I really enjoyed where they have the condiments lined up and ready for you to squirt on as much as you like on your plates! =)
author: Michael M.

description: I LOVE their salads!  I've tried to break away and try some other restaurants at the food court where Buckhorn Grill resides, but I am constantly drawn to this place.  I always get the salad with the blue cheese, onion threads and tri-tip.  They sprinkle some delicious candied walnuts on top too . . . yum!
author: Janet S.

description:
So in attempts to being healthy, I decided my lunch for the day would be a salad. And with long thought I decided to wander the Bloomingdale's mall. Now, I am usually not about mall food court restaurants, but you can never go wrong with Buckhorn Grill. 

I thought $7 wasn't bad for salad, but if you are a meat lover add either grilled chicken, tri tip, or salmon for an extra few bucks. $11 total (with tax)..WOW, I thought to myself. I just spent a fortune, this better come with a whole chicken, cow, or a river of salmon topped with gold bits. I waited for my lovely vibrating buzzer to jiggle for my order to go, which it nicely spoke to me "your order is ready" (how techy!). To which I go up to the counter, and he hands me a gigantic box. Is there a cow in there?! This salad was HUGE...so much for keepin it healthy! The cabo chop salad over took my body, I scarfed it down, and wanted to explode afterwards.

The service was good and pretty prompt in getting my food during the lunch rush hour.  Oh hey for those who like to mooch, samples of tri tip and whatever else from the sample dude...score!!  *drools*
author: Catherine O.

description: I was not overly impressed with my sandwich.....it was good, but not great....
author: Kenneth G.

description: Buckhorn Grill won me over after I tried a sample of their delicious tri-tip. After ordering their Roadhouse Salad with Tri-tip, I began spreading the word of this creation, which I generally refer to as "Best Salad Ever." How can you go wrong with blue cheese and fried onions on top of mixed greens and tossed with SLICED tri-tip. If you thought normal tri-tip or even tri-tip cut into cubes is good, you have tried nothing yet until you taste how incredibly the flavors of the salad harmonize when the tri-tip is sliced.
author: Denton X.

description:
I work in between this Buckhorn and the one at the Metreon.  But I always go to this one (even though the line is always longer) because the workers are more courteous and they are much more generous with the onion rings. 

I admit...I haven't tried too many things at Buckhorn.  I can never seem to get past the Roadhouse Salad, or want anything else, for that matter.  It's the devil and angel in one big, delicious salad bowl!  

There's the lettuce, tomatoes, and peas.  I'm thinkin'..."Now I don't feel guilty about the Nation's burger I had last night!"

Then there's the blue cheese.  "Well," I say to myself, "cobb salad has blue cheese, so it's all good."

Oh oh oh, and then there's the Mt. Everest of thinly cut onion rings.  "Okay, that just negates the veggies.  But it's fried onion rings...on a SALAD!!"

And on the days when I'm feeling the urge to splurge, some strips of their tri-tip. 
"............."  
Chomping away as the devil in the salad prances about, snickering at the angel buried in the lettuce and onion rings.

Wow..what a good lunch.
author: Liz C.

description:
My husband and a friend went to hang out in the city one night and he came home all excited about this new restaurant he found at the food court in the mall.  

Ok, I thought, it is in the pricier food court section, so it must be pretty good.  So I thought I'd give it a shot.

On a whim, he headed up to the city Saturday and found ourselves at the mall and lo and behold we were starving.  Presto!  Instant opporutnity!

Since I had never been there and didn't know what to expect, I let my husband order for me.  We both got the tri-tip and chicken combo.  Our little buzzer went off less than 5 mintues later and my husband brings back this tray of FOOD!  

Oh my gosh!  I cannot eat all of that!--But I tried.  It was really really good.  The chicken was a teeny bit dry, but not intolerable.  Tri-tip was perfect.  Veggies?  They were pretty good, but the mashed potatoes (with skin) were killer.  Even the gravy (which I normally would have avoided like the plague).  

I was very very please with the quality and quantity of food and I was also impressed with the friendly (and smiley!!!) service we received.  

I am sure we will be going back, but may not make a special trip.  

Definately a place to get a lot of food for a decent price and not have to do the restaurant thing where you have to wait for a table.  

I was surprised the mall was not more crowded either...even on St. Patricks's day!  Hmmm....
author: Amber G.

description: Oh my goodness. Go with the tri-tip. Melts in your mouth. And they use all fresh ingredients. Unbelievable.
author: Ron L.

description:
A quick pit stop between the stores at the mall.

I ordered the daily special: tri-tip sandwich, cup of french onion soup, plus a drink.

S ordered some form of a kid's meal: tri-tip sandwich, fries, plus a drink.

OUR PORTIONS LOOK EXACTLY THE SAME!  Besides the drink size, there is virtually no difference with our food portion.  Yet I paid twice as much.

Lesson learned.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Tri-tip is a staple food in our house.  Some of our family is from Santa Ynez, the home of Santa Maria BBQ tri-tip.  So, I think I know good tri-tip when I eat it.  And I LOVE Bleu Cheese!!!  (Yes, I'm being pretentious with BLEU, it goes with CENTRE).  

My 3rd day at the new job found me lunching with one of my new co-workers, a very nice woman by the name of Marianne.  I like her because the last half of her name is my name, how could I not?  We had a very nice time at lunch in the busy food court at Westfield.  

I had the Roadhouse Buck ($6.45) which is "thick sliced tri-tip with Roadhouse Onions & Red Ranch sauce topped with bleu cheese crumbles".  The onions are very thinly sliced, battered and fried onion rings.  The sauce, yummy.  The cheese, perfect compliment.  The onions, well I ordered a "combo" and had more than enough for two people!  With the drink, it was $11 and change.  Like I said before, it is a bit pricey for lunch out everyday at this food court.  The sandwich is messy, very messy...but oh so good.  

Can you say food coma?  I don't drink coffee in the afternoon, but found myself wandering by Marianne's office in a daze...she suggested I have some coffee to get me out of my funk!  Good call on the lunchtime activities, thanks Marianne.
author: Anne O.

description:
I'm with Alicia k. on "the power of the free sample."  My original goal for lunch was to have a nice, healthy meal consisting of some greens.  yeah right!  That plan changed the instant I sampled a piece of the tri-tip.  OMG that meat was so freakin tender it melted in my mouth.  

They have a variety of salads, but I decided on the "chipotle border buck" (tri-tip w/ chipotle sauce and pepper jack cheese on a sweet french roll for $6.95)."  I figure I might as well go all the way since I already abandoned my original plan.  I enjoyed every single bite of that juicy sandwich.  It was a little bit fatty but dang, I think that's what made it taste soooo good!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
bacon cheddar burger:

with lettuce, tomato, some kind of sauce, purple onions, cheese, and applewood bacon

delightful little bun, not too thin...

and copious bbq on the side

best burger i've had to date.  tasty, huge, oh so filling...

gaaaahhhhhh....

*coma*
author: VonZilla ..

description:
The Buckhorn Roadhouse salad is a great lunch and the size is so big that you can definitely split it. I love the crispy onions and the walnuts with blue cheese crumbles that it comes with. 

I also sampled the "classic pick" - the steak sandwich - and it was very good as well. I think the sample girl out front gets me every time. I think I want to try some place new and then she hands me that little toothpick with the steak and its all over! She reels me in time and time again.
author: Natalie N.

description:
The  Buckhorn Grill is a great alternative to the foreign food of the day restaurant. They have to die for sandwiches, great burgers, phenomenal fried potatoes, sweet potatoes and onion rings. All of their salads and lettuce in the sandwiches have no iceberg lettuce. One big plus for me. 

I personally love their tri tip sandwich, bread is crunchy, and the meat marinated very well. When dining with a group, we will always get an order of fries with sweet potatoes and onion rings, the dip sauce that comes with are yum city. 

When I want to eat healthy I will order a roadhouse salad, or the yik-yak salad, or the other one that I can't recall the name of at the moment. If you need protein, add grilled chicken, tri-tip or salmon to the salad. Reasonable prices rule the day at Buckhorn Grill. 

Service is you get your food in 5 minutes or you get comped for another meal. Happened once in 30 times here. Don't count on it.
author: Edward S.

description:
I think I walked right past this place before I actually decided to order my food from here. Those people who hand out samples really do help; she was standing there minding her own business when I came along. I pretty much offered the sample to myself since she just stood there holding the tray. She was sampling the tastiest, most flavorful, perfectly marinated piece of tri-tip. My taste buds immediately replied with, "mmmmm, yummmy!!That is some tasty beef!" And that's when I knew I'd be ordering from this place. 

I ordered the Philly buck, which was thinly sliced tri-tip with bell peppers and provolone on a sweet roll with a side of fries. It was a little oily and sloppy to eat, but it was  good and tasty. Seemed like it was marinated with a bunch of different peppers and spices (dry rub?), but it went well together. They pack a lot of meat in the roll, unlike a lot of other shady places. 

So, if you don't believe me, walk up to this place, take a sample or two, and try it.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Not all that.

The trip tip is just okay. Personally I like my tritip cut thicker. And both times I've been there my meat came out cool not warm! They are also doing their tritip an injustice by not prepping their sandwich bread. I think they should throw it on the grill and warm it up. Please...don't just pull it out of a plastic bag. The bread is so rubbery.

Ive also tried the greek salad. It was also just okay. Skimpy on the meet portion and for $9, I'd skip it.

I'm probably not going back.
author: Jade R.

description:
Salad, anyone?

At the Buckhorn Grill you can get pretty good west coast fusion food with a particular twist, but the salads are what keep be coming back again and again. 

Roadhouse salad = exquisite.
Yik-Yak salad = sublime
and on and on. I always get the dressing on the side, that way I can dip the bites I want dressing on, and eat the rest au naturel. Usually I get the protein option of chicken or salmon. I have also sampled the fried potatoes, fried sweet potatoes, and fried onion rings, or strings. Everyone is doing deep fried battered onions, and I do not remember who calls what what. 

Order and pay up front, get a table with a fun time food beeper, and in less than 5 minutes you are chewing the good stuff.
author: Xerote M.

description:
Imagine you're in the Westfield.  You have been with your girlfriend for a myriad of hours, debating the woes of open-toe vs. slingback at Bloomie's, getting dusted with airborne bronzer at Bare Escentuals, daubing spittle from the corners of her drooling lips at Swarovski, and peeling her away from the truffles at Cocoa Bella.

Boyfriend, you deserve a delightful lunch from the Buckhorn!

   If you're of the carnivorous sort, it looks like there are a lot of meaty 'wiches for ya.  But no matter how much you might love meat, get the Yik Yak salad.  Jicama, bell peppers, sesame dressing, perfection.  You could never eat the whole thing, so sharing it with your lady might be a good idea.

   Do right by adding the onions to whatever you order.  They aren't good for you, but they are damn good for your taste buds, and sometimes, that's all that matters.

   SO glad they are all the way across town from me!
author: Lea N.

description:
Today I had the Bacon Cheddar Chicken sandwich combo with Red Mashers and a soda. I didn't go there with much expectation, but I ended up a fan of this dish. For a little over $10 with tax, I got PLENTY of food! The sandwich was very flavorful, although the chicken was a little on the dry side. My fix to that was to lather the sandwich in ranch! :)

The mashed potatoes were also very tasty. They had just the right amount of salt to them and the gravy topped it off perfectly. 

I think next week I will try something else in hopes this was not a fluke.
author: Jason B.

description: 3rd time here and still kicks butt! Cafeteria style seating since its in the bottom of the mall....dont bother me none...I still get my grub on regardless!
author: Dennis M.

description: Buckhorn in Emeryville does not disappoint.  Always consistent.  Try the cheddar buck.  And the mash do are awesome.
author: Michael C.

description: I'm a huge fan of Buckhorn's Roadhouse Buck, and I've never had a bad experience at any of their restaurants. This one in particular is conveniently located near the BART station, so I come here for lunch sometimes. The service is friendly and quick. The Roadhouse Buck with swiss cheese, not bleu, is amazing. I'm not big on steak, but its so well cooked and the red ranch makes it that much better. Their fries are also thin, crispy, and an absolute must. Prices are very reasonable for the quality and portion of the food. I've ordered the Roadhouse Buck to go on several occasions, and even though the BART ride between my job and SF is 15 minutes, the sandwich is still really good. I've introduced it to several of my co-workers and they all loved it.
author: Ariana A.

description: Buckhorn isn't cheap by any means for something in a food court; however, the three times I've been here, I've always been pleased with the food. I've had the salmon sandwich, caesar salad, and the roadhouse salad, which were all delicious. Salmon sandwich was hearty and the sauce that came with the sandwich really gave it an extra dimension. The caesar was good. I mean there's not really much to say about a salad that's already been perfected by someone else and then recreated here. The roadhouse salad was perfect. The heartiness of the onion crisps cut by the acidity of dressing was a great balance. The food here will set you back anywhere between $7-15, so I really stand by my original statement of it not being cheap. Overall, definitely worth a try.
author: Kevin D.

description: Got their "Ceaser Pleaser." 2 big, but thinly sliced pieces of very nicely seasoned tri-tip, ceasar salad (could have used a bit more dressing), and a roll.  Perfect amount for lunch.  Very quick around 11:50 before the lunch rush.  $9.71 with water.
author: Marc S.

description:
I am not a huge fan of red meat... but Buckhorn has tempted me with the free samples. So, perhaps this is not the best place to start my red meat eating experiences... the mall... but I am loving the tri tip sandwiches, salads, you name it! I tried their chicken... while it is good... the tri tip is hands down the best thing on their menu. YUM YUM YUM! 

The flavor is really good, juicy, buttery and when you are done eating it... you feel like you had a real meal... not one of those quick mall feedings that usually leave you feeling all icky.... like you ate a brick. The portions are generous, they have all kinds of condiments available for you. It looks like it might take forever to get your food, but they are really on it and you get your food right away. 

I recommend this place for when you are aimlessly wandering around the mall, hungry... and not knowing what to eat. Not too cheap... but worth every penny!
author: Amelia M.

description: I always find myself here whenever I'm in SF shopping. I always order my favorite, the Roadhouse Buck. Soooo good and the meat sooo tender and juicy! Love it!
author: Niesha M.

description:
WHO can pass up samples of tri-tip?  DELICIOUS....

I needed my energy to fight the after-Christmas madness that is Westfield Shopping Centre, so I chose STEAK.  Yet, a little warning for those who, like me, tend to have bigger eyes than stomach: ORDER A SMALL PLATTER (IT WILL FILL YOU UP!!! TRUST ME).  

Like the piggy that I am, I thought that a small platter wouldn't be enough.  I ordered one of the regular sized platters.  Let's just say that I made it 1/4 of the way through and felt like I was going to bust out of my jeans.  

Buckhorn isn't a cheap, fast-food joint.  Seriously, it is fast food, but it is quite hefty price wise and portion wise.  For the combo platter (chicken & tri-tip), I paid $13.95.  The soda was 1.95 on top of that.  So, in essence, I paid as much for lunch as I would at a sit-down restaurant.  Yet, after collecting my meal, I had to bum-rush a girl for a table.  How inelegant?  It is survival of the fittest at the mall....and obviously, since I love to eat...I guess that I'm pretty much the fittest in the entire food court....(well, there are a few exceptions).

Oh..and the chicken is DRY...I'd highly advise that you stick with what they are known for...tri-tip...yummm..
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Don't judge me for eating mall food but as you know, Westfield mall food is not your typical mall food. You can't find Burger Kings, Hot Dog on a Stick, not even a Sapporo (though sometimes you wished they had the cheap stuff. I think I spotted a few on the Nordie's side of the food court).

Anyways I was craving a salad and splurged for one from Buckhorn Grill. Got the Cabo Cobb Salad with grilled chicken. The salad pre protein is $7.95. Tack on another $2.50 or $2.95 for the chicken. That put me just under $12 post tax, and for a MALL salad!! Admittedly, the salad was good - loaded with jicama, beet slices, black beans, corn, avocado, cherry tomatoes, and juicy tender chicken chunks - all served in a fried tortilla shell. Pretty tasty I have to say. Plenty for 2 people too.

I would get it again but I'd definitely share. Gotta save room for the surrounding sweets.
author: Cindy W.

description:
I'm convinced that I didn't become a huge steak fan until they came in bite sized juicy cubes on toothpicks - the man with the samples is always in front of Buckhorn and he's a godsend.

I recommend pretty much all their tri-tip items on the menu - the Little Buck is good if you're craving tri tip in a good portioned sized sandwich (or a snack, for those of you who are bigger eaters. And I do just that, sometimes, too). The salads are always HUGE and they're all really yummy. They also have a good variety of salads that are great for sharing for a light lunch option - if you've seen the displays, you know how big the salads are.

The Roadhouse Buck is one of my favorites - it's the only sandwich with thick cut tri trip (as opposed to thinly sliced) and sometimes when I'm just wanting MEAT, I'll get that - it comes topped with their crispy Roadhouse onions - a huge heaping mound, crumbled blue cheese on top and all in their sweet sandwich roll with their Red Ranch sauce slathered on the inside. Their fire-roasted veggies are also really tasty, as well. I always choose that as my side with my . . . yep, tri tip.

So good.
author: Betty W.

description:
Buckhorn is my default lunch stop when I'm shopping at Westfield.  Sometimes I'll even make a pitstop on my way home just to go here.

I absolutely love the Roadhouse salad. The tri-tip, onion strings, dressing, and not to mention the gigantic portion, make it a hearty and filling salad without being disgustingly heavy or creamy.
author: S L.

description:
It was hectic in the Westfield Mall Food Emporium as usual and nearly impossible to make a decision on where to eat.  Buckhorn Grill was smart enough to send a girl out to give free samples of tri tip.  My fiance had a piece and immediately made up his mind to eat here. 

I went along and got the Yik Yak salad, because it contains jicama.  I love jicama in a salad!  Its crunchiness is irreplaceable by any other veg/fruit.  I also added grilled chicken on my salad, but it still came under $10.  

The salad was amazingly huge and delicious.  Not sure if I was just starving because of the crazy shopping or what, but I felt like I haven't had a salad this decent in a long time.  It has a million ingredients, which I usually don't like, as they usually just get mixed and soaked and become unrecognizable in overwhelming dressing.  This one had strong flavors, but I can still tell that I am eating crunchy lettuce, crunchy almonds and crunchy crunchy jicama.  The chicken is good too, moist and flavorful for something as boring as grilled chicken. 

My fiance had the tri tip sandwich, which according to him, was delicious.  Not bad, for about $8, for something filling and tasty in the Food Emporium.  

Another bonus for eating in the crazy underground world of Food Emporium: there is always someone breaking up with someone.  That sort of authentic entertainment usually goes very well with your food.
author: Candice B.

description: Went here spontaneously with my friend. We were hella hungry, and noticed they had a tri-tip plate that fed 5-6 people for only 20 dollars! So we figured tri-tip with a side of fries, would be perfect for our appetite. We finished everything, and it was really good! I highly recommend the tri-tip with their bbq sauce, cuz that's a winner. The rest of the day we spent quietly in a food coma.
author: Dominic A.

description: I just got back today from a road trip to the Bay Area/Nor Cal and I am craving a Big Buck sandwich!  In fact, I ate at this place twice during my 6-day vacay (once at this location and the other in Napa).  There is just something special about the tri-tip...its tender, succulent, well seasoned and the au jus and grilled onions are the perfect accompaniment to the sandwich.  Feed me a Big Buck sandwich and I'm a happy girl!  Please open up a restaurant in San Diego!
author: Mare B.

description:
The yik yak salad was delicious, split it with a friend and it was plenty  for both of us!  
The roadhouse salad not as much...the onion rings on top were mushy!  
I would avoid the roasted veggie sandwich...and stick to their salads.
Had mediocre experiences here.
The free samples were definitely a plus!
author: ELIZABETH W.

description:
Buckhorn Grill might just be the best fat food joint on the planet.

nuff said.....
author: C G.

description:
Amazingly good salads. I'm hooked on the Roadhouse salad with Tri-tip Steak. It has a deliciously sweet vinagarette dressing, but also tasty walnuts, and awesomely good tomatoes, and incredibly wonderful blue cheese. Oh, and I can't believe I almost forgot, they stack the salad with a mound of shoe-string onion fry things (Best way I can explain it, haha). But seriously the salad was a mound 6 inches high, and when I'm incredibly hungry I would always come here and order that salad because I love eating tons of food for less than $10, and I hate when places give you small portions where you're just as hungry when you come out as when you came in, despite having spent $20 on your meal.

I really want to try some of the other ones, the Asian one looks really tempting, maybe next time. I always say next time, btu the Roadhouse one is so good, that I can't get over it! :)

Oh, and they give you so much food, that you could easily share the salad with someone else and not be hungry. And the salad with steak is only $10. It's totally worth it!
author: Xavier G.

description:
Oh my GODDDDDDD!!!! i have seen this place at a few mall locations, but have never wanted to try it. Then I tried it for the first time this week and seriously, if I could buy stock in this company, I would. Is it wrong to try to kidnap the chef too?

The mashed potatoes are heavenly, the gravy is heavenly, the roasted vegetables are delicious, and the tri-tip, wow.

If you have not tried this place, I seriously recommend it. Yeah, I don't think there's any chance I will be turning vegetarian soon, thanks to Buckhorn Grill.

Oh yeah, I saw a sign that said you can sign up for their frequent dining club. Once you reach 100 dollars of spending, they will mail a gift certificate for $10. I didn't notice that the first few times as I was in a gravy euphoria, impatiently waiting for my next fix.
author: Wendy L.

description:
The first time I went their soda machines weren't working. I really wanted a coke with my steak sandwich too :(

The second time I went, their cash register stopped working the second I made it to the head of the line. After a 10 minute wait, they finally fixed the machines and took my order for the roadhouse salad. 20 minutes later, I was still waiting for my salad. My friends already finished their lunches from the thai place next door. After asking about my salad 3 times, they finally decided to make one for me - no apology! Suffice it to say, I was pissed.

Too bad the food is really really good.
author: Dalia K.

description:
As far as mall food court food goes this place is ROCKIN' it.  I speak though, for only the food I've tasted which are the salad and the steak.  YUMMY!!

So I order their... what's it called again?  That one on the left of the display case with the jicama, avocado, corn, tomatoes, and ENDLESS ENDLESS amounts of food.  HUGE, served in a tortilla bowl.  They put a citrusy dressing on it so you do not need to add anything else.  So fresh and so crisp, topped with chicken or steak for a meat eater to feel complete.  

Although, how can you not feel complete when the salad itself is larger than your head?  Sometimes, you don't pay for what you get.  13 bucks to cover a gigantic salad plus a drink?  Note that the salad had steak AND avocados.  How many places CHARGE 2 bucks just for an avocado?  Maybe I'm fooled because the pieces aren't itemized, but I feel it was a GREAT VALUE and OH SO TASTY.
author: Wilson K.

description: This place has awesome grilled veggies- I usually just order a single side of veggies for my meal. The tri tip is amazing but it is super super rare. They do not ask you how you like your meat cooked so if you do not ask for it to be well done you will get it blood red. Their salads are awesome and super big. I can easily share one with a friend and be completely satisfied.
author: Nina Q.

description: Ok I am absolutely in love with this place. I never had tri tip until I moved to CA and for years I just did not get it. This place has helped change my mind. The tri tip sandwiches are to die for. I love the Lil Buck medium rare with Aus Jus and provolone cheese. Today I tried the Bacon Cheddar Buck a sinful tri tip sandwich with slices of Applewood bacon and melted cheddar cheese smothered in some red ranch sauce. Probably not the most healthy choice but yummy. I work in the area so I try to have lunch here at least once a week. It is not cheap but I think the sandwiches are worth it unfortunately they are very slow and a bit disorganized at least at the mall location.
author: PAULA W.

description:
If you are shopping in the mall, I think this is the best palce to eat at. 
The salad is really yummy (and SO HUGE!) and the tri tip is yummy!

I say, order the tri tip salad, and split with a friend. It's plenty of food and its rather good. and its not friend or drenched in oil/fat as much as some of the other options here. 

good luck getting a seat somewhere.
author: Deirdre P.

description:
It's all about the Roadhouse Salad and the delicious fried onion toppings.  The salad is so huge and filling!  Add some tri-tip and you can make two meals out of it.  I noticed that they usually go heavy on the dressing so order that on the side unless you like your salads drenched.

I wanted to be adventurous and ordered their Chipotle Border Chuck Sandwich and fries once.  That was meh...the sandwich was so dinky and not worth the price at all ~ I knew I should have stuck with a salad *sigh*.

Anyway, this is definitely a great place to eat when you're looking for something quick at the Westfield mall.
author: Katelynn L.

description: Getting to know my new work hood, the last place I thought I would go would be the mall. I was so wrong in the spirit of "I am going to Nordy's", BUT my stomach said " I am hungry feed me". My stomach won and  my colleague and I decided on Buckhorn Grill. Seriously my first time downstairs and it was extremely hard choosing the right spot especially when there are freebies enticing you into their establishments. However, once I read the menu of all of their delicious food, I was already in line ordering crispy chicken with fries. My colleague ordered the tri-tip sandwich and yes we split sandwiches, like soooooo good (not just saying that because I was hungry and delusional) I really mean it.  Chicken was crispy no sogginess, butter lettuce fresh and the tri-tip sandwich with caramelized onions wow.  Fries thin, crispy and hot; yum great portions and  I did not leave anything on my plate.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Stranded and hungry at the metreon again. This is my favorite choice at this particular food court. I always get the same thing: yikyak salad w/ chicken. (I have tried bites of other items and those are good to. Hey its all family style if youre quick enough)
 It is damn fast and they have beer. Thats how I get to the movie on time o yeh'
author: Melissa B.

description:
BACON CHEDDAR BUCK

My crotch tingles just typing those words!

The service here is fine, and the wait is never too long. But these here tri-tip ditties are some deeeelicious samiches. 

Bacon + beef + cheddar cheese + some mayo/bbq/ranch mixture given to earth as a gift from the gods = my nadir. 

It's a bit pricey, but whatever. Heaven ain't cheap.
author: Brian K.

description: this was delicious for a mall place. but then i realized we are in the famous westfield mall in sf. lol jk the chedder buck was yummy. the fries were the good ones but cold.
author: Clayton B.

description: located conveniently in the basement of westfield mall, the food court overall here is above average. Buckhorn caught my eye as they were giving out free samples of their tri tip which was pretty good, medium rare, with enough spices. We got the grilled chicken salad along with the tri tip sandwich. The bread was quite soggy and needs to be toasted as it definitely ruined the sandwich. Id probably just eat the meat plain rather than eat that soggy garbage. The salad was decent with avocados and tomatoes in a light lemon onion dressing tat wasnt too heavy or drenched. The prices are a little bit more than I would pay for but the food overall wasnt too bad minus the soggy bread. I wouldnt mind giving this place a second chance.
author: Robert Y.

description: Came here on a whim. Friends and I were staying at the Hilton a few blocks away when a Subway commercial came on TV advertising a hot pastrami sandwich. I HATE Subway so I whipped out the ol' iPhone and Yelped for a sandwich place nearby and Buckhorn Grill sounded promising. Was it? It WAS! Don't you love when that happens? I had a very juicy bacon cheddar buck. It was about $8 and it was very fulfilling. Service was speedy and very kind. I've never heard of this place and later on I find out it's a chain! Well done, Buckhorn!
author: Jonny A.

description: Amazing tri-tip. So good that I bought the Sunday special and ate tri-tip sandwiches the rest of the week. Do it...
author: Minh V.

description: Was very hungry for lunch. I like salmon. Saw a sandwich called "Jammin' Salmon" on the menu for $7.95. Alright cool. Pretty tasty. Sandwich is kinda small though. Maybe I should've gotten the combo. Oh well. Just hate they don't take Discover card. I'm trying to get my miles here people...
author: Gerard Y.

description: Yik-Yak Salad!  Yes, I too was sucked in by the tri-tip and fried onion samples!!  Myrna and I had lunch - and shared a yik-yak salad.  sweet and tasty sesame dressing.  Even tho' it's a "healthy" salad, I bet if I dissected the ingredients on that dressing,  it would have loads of sugar carbs.  Who cares?  It was yummy.  I'll definitely be back to try the other salads ... yum!
author: Carla C.

description:
Was hoping to try Out the Door but it was closed for reservations. Came here around 12:30 PM and the place was PACKED. After taking a tour, the bf lined up here for the short line and also their claim of having good tri-tip. I wanted salad so I picked the grilled chicken salad ($8...how come Yelpers are saying their salads are $12?) and the bf got the roadhouse buck ($10).

My salad was large (a meal in its self) and I loved the dressing they used. It was a sort of tangy yet citrusy dressing that went well with the grilled chicken. There were pieces of tomatoes, blue cheese and avocados. My bf's sandwich wasn't too great. The meat was well done, but the sauce was great (they needed more, remember, I'm a saucy gal!) and they toasted the bun. The fried onions they served in it was well done as well, and pretty oily.
author: Janel Y.

description: my friend thought I was crazy when I wanted to eat at the food court while in sf...but I would have to say that this was quite worth it.  I ordered a child size tri tip sandwich and was able to replace the fries with the onion ring strings.  The Tri tip was great tender and full of flavor.  The onion strings were wanting but a great meal at a food court.
author: Christina P.

description:
The latest branch of this chain opened in the food court of the new Westfield San Francisco Center. They're known for tri-tip sandwiches. Other branches guarantee your food will be ready 5 minutes after you order it. I didn't see any of those signs here, and I think that guarantee would bankrupt this one quickly. In fact, they give you a beeper when you order so you'll know when it's ready.

The tri-tip is tasty. So is their bacon. The fried onion strings are good only if they've just been cooked; otherwise, they're lifeless and flavorless, but still really, really bad for you.
author: Timothy O.

description:
With so many choices available in this upscale food court, its hard to decide what to eat.  Should it be Korean?  Mexican? Thai?  Japanese?  Italian?  With a veritable United Nations of food available, you can't help but keep circling back and forth, looking at what everyone is eating and trying to decide what your meal should be.  Buckhorn makes it easy by actually giving you a fairly large sample of their tri-tip and thin oinion rings.   And so, that was how I was seduced into trying out their sandwiches, because their tri-tip was surprisingly good

I tried their Bacon Cheddar Buck, which is their tri-tip with bacon and cheddar.  At $6.95 for the sandwich alone, it is a little pricey.  The sandwich is kinda on the small side, though it does make a good mouthful.  I really liked the tri-tip and their savory mayonnaise, but the bacon was hard, rather than being crisp.  The tri-tip is cooked medium to medium-well, so its not as tender as it could be.  It is sliced thinly for the sandwiches, so it doesn't really get all up in your teeth.  I think that next time, I'm going for their regular tri-tip sandwich.

For an extra $2.22, you can make the meal a combo and get a drink and a side.  I tried out their Roadhouse onions, which are the thin onion rings.  Very tasty, but some of the onions were pretty oily and limp.  They're great with some ranch dressing and BBQ sauce, but I think I might blot them with some paper napkins first the next time I eat them.

Overall, a good pick for lunch in the Food Emporium.  At just under $10 for the meal, its comparable to the other available food options.
author: Angela H.

description: Westfield has done it again with another astonishley modern food court in their San Francisco shopping center.  It gets crazy busy here during lunch so you need to make sure and scope out a seat before eating or you will be left standing.  This time I chose Buckhorn Grill and had aTri-Tip sandwich.  It was pretty good and made with top quality meat for a food court.  It just wasn't anything special.  I enjoyed my meal, yet found myself rushing through it so I can get on with my shopping.  It isn't necessarily worth the price.  They did offer a nice big side salad to go with it instead of fries.  I might be back, but more likely I'll try one of the other eateries here.
author: Andy Z.

description:
How does anyone get addicted to salads? Technically, its the dressings... yummy!  I live near Westfield and it is incredibly convenient to grab a dinner salad at Buckhorn Grill and head home.  The salads are amazing.  I've had the Roadhouse (ask for mixed greens with the tri tip) and the Yik Yak with salmon.  The Roadhouse is by no means healthy, its the best thing when you feel like you should order a salad but you really want a burger.  Yik Yak is perfect when you want the crispness and coolness of a good, veggie packed salad.  Generally, I am not a fan of iceburg lettuce but it works in this salad because of the cabbage and the crunch. The portions of these salads are large and filling, well worth the $10.  The ingredients are fresh and the dressings are really good.  

I have to deduct one star for the one time I ordered a sandwich instead of a salad.  I ordered the philly sandwich and added mushrooms. The sandwich was quite small and the bread did not really seem fresh.  The sandwich was almost $10...yikes! and not nearly as filling or as big as the salad. 

So stick with the salads and you won't regret it!
author: avenelle a.

description: I tried Buckhorn Grill the other day and I am now a fan. The steak sandwiches are tender and juicy and the BBQ sauce is the perfect condiment for it. Top it with some fried onions and sauteed peppers and you're golden. The fries were good but the salad was a little wilted. All in all, I will definitely be back here.
author: Chi N.

description:
It was July 4th and we were waiting for the rest of our group to arrive, but we were  hungry . . . so 3 beers and a platter of tri tip and chicken with mashed potatoes and grilled veggies, here we come!

1 star for tasty tri tip and moist, well seasoned chicken breast
1 star for being open until 8 pm when everywhere else in the food court (besides the pasta place) had shut down.
1 star for quick, friendly service
1 star for crisp french fries and excellent BBQ sauce
Minus 1 star for one piece of slightly over cooked tri tip (There were two pieces and one of them was perfect and the other was missing pink.)

Note: This chain is actually a spin-off of their original restaurant in Winters (small town off of hwy 505).  The original restaurant is a sit-down place with animal heads on the walls, a saloon, and AMAZING steaks.
author: Amy C.

description: So they stopped me with a tray of tri-tip samples while I was wandering around in the food court and it was really good!! SOOOoo not sad foodcourt food.  All the tri-tip anythings are amazing and get it with the red skin mashers YUMMMY!! Their salads are mad and tasty but mad.  So freakin' big I didn't know how to start eating it.  But I felt healthy after all that jicama and beats hahaha
author: becca w.

description:
Horrible Service! 

Waited 30 mins for a salad, granted they had to fry up the krispy chicken, but come on now. A lady came back saying she didnt want sauce on her krispy chicken sandwich and the guy gives her a new sandwich in less than a minute, but it takes 30 mins to get me my salad. HORRIBLE SERVICE, SMALL SALADS, DO NOT COME HERE!
author: Thomas J.

description:
I got sucked in by the tri-tip they were sampling - great little nugget-sized bite. So I ordered the Roadhouse Salad with Tri-tip and it was disappointing. The tri-tip was sliced really thin, like roast beef, so it didn't retain its flavor and made the salad soggy. Plus at that price (I think it was $8.95 + the new SF service fee, so over $10 in the end), I'd much rather have paid less for a smaller salad, since I couldn't finish the whole thing.

Hope that the new economic situation gets us towards that - smaller portions, lower prices!
author: Bianca L.

description:
Their garlic kick fries are yummy and the portions are pretty good.  The roadhouse salad was ok, but they forgot to take off the bleu cheese crumbs.  The rest of the salad was drenched in the basil vinaigrette... I didn't really like that.  The onion strings on top were a little cold. 

3 stars for the fries!!
author: Michelle W.

description:
Yes, the tri-tip samples are remarkable. Even when I'm not in the mood for Buckhorn I'm usually open a sample of the tri-tip. Buckhorn is one of my standby options in the Westfield food court.

I've had the Big Buck and Roadhouse Buck sandwiches and they've both been good bets. The salads are pretty big and I've had lunchmates who have either had leftovers for their next meal or converted them into wraps (with the handy tortilla like bowl).

If you're a frequent 'Buckhorner' you should sign up for their 'frequent eater' program -- I think you get a free meal after $100 of food -- unfortunately, that's only a handful of meals. All in all, a great bet within the Westfield.
author: Gil L.

description:
Hell yeah Buckhorn salad with either beef or chicken!

This place is pricey but it is the mall. So just go with it, it's retail.
author: Shawn P.

description:
I was in San Fran for a convention recently and stumbled upon the food court at the mall.  They were handing out samples at Buckhorn Grill, which was enough to lure me in.  Great choice!  I ordered the Roadhouse Buck with french fries.  Might as well go for it, right?  Another great choice.

The sandwich had tri tip and thin, crunchy onion rings.  Yummy!!  The french fries were also really good.  The woman handing out the samples said this is the most popular sandwich.  I can see why.  I would highly recommend Buckhorn Grill and the Roadhouse Buck.
author: Erin C.

description:
they totally got me as well... darned free samples!

thing is, buckhorn grill's food isn't that bad.  i got the philly, which was covered in peppers and mozzarella cheese. however the most memorable part of the meal was for sure the fries.

my coworkers, who were also my company during lunch, noted the plate was very nice. so that needed to be mentioned.  i'd prob not eat here for a while, as there's tons of options in this  high class food court area.
author: Ameer N.

description:
What a hook! As I was walking by the food court they offered me a free sample of tri tip. The rest is history. 

Good food. Their chicken and their tri tip are both quite awesome. Very delish.

Give it a try. You wont be disappointed.
author: BoyWonder X.

description: Every time I'm in downtown San Francisco I stop in here. The tri-tip is to die for. If you like red meat I highly recommend giving Buckhorn a shot. Great food at a reasonable price.
author: Will S.

description: Yes, Buckhorn Grill has great try-tip. It's great on sandwiches ... so juicy and tender. Yes, taking home a whole one that's been thinly slices is always great party food ... that is always a hit. BUT, try the burger. OMG!!! I honestly think it's the best burger I've had in years and it's only $7 with bacon and cheese. The meat is cooked on a grill, so they taste like they were barbecued at home, only they do them SOOOO much better. The buns are warmed on the grill too. As much as we love Super Duper, these are, in my opinion, even better. Juicy, smokey and just the right size. I had one last night and another one now sounds good, but I'll hold myself back ... for a while. They have several locations ... Westfield, Metreon and Embardadero. I know they're a chain, but it sure doesn't feel like one. Tell them Randy sent you. They're super nice people too. OH ... become a frequent eater and you build points too. They also have an amazing salad I love ... Yic Yak ... it's loaded with solid vegies, including jicamaca, bell petter and pea pods. And, their vege selections are also very good. It's not just meat. Now, if they'd just start serving breakfast. Ha, ha.
author: Randy S.

description:
im a fan. oooh their crispy chicken cobb salad is bomb! i love me some blue cheese. add some roadside onions or red onions to it and it is seriously helllla gooood.

and if you're an sf state student...DISCOUNT! hollla! i mean its better than nothing.
author: Kathleen J.

description:
You should NOT get their sandwiches, because they are pretty small and comes with no sides.

You SHOULD get their salads, with double portion of tri-tip on top.  My favorite is the Roadhouse salad with shoestring onion rings, walnuts, green beans, some other stuff, and bbq vinagrette.  This is $6.99 and comes in a freshly tossed, pretty good size portion and would be a good deal if you're not a meat eater.  What makes this totally awesome is you can add tri-tip for $2.50.  What I do is add double tri-tip for $5.00, and on under the shoestring onion rings but on top of the salad lays 8 delicious ounces of tender thin-sliced tri-tip.  This my friend, is one of the best steak salads in town.
author: Milton F.

description:
JUST LOVE THIS PLACE!
I got my first meal in SF here. I was just impressed. I didn't expect this much good steaks and salad in a food court! God, it was sooo cool! The price is fine, much cheaper than other restaurants except that you don't need to pay extra money for tip. The small plate steak was just awesome! the onion rings with the steak was just addictive! It is definitely good place to eat. Much better than any other 'famous' restaurants which are overpriced and overvalued. it is just my opinion though :)
author: Joe T.

description: I was just introduced to Buckhorn Grill yesterday after a long day of shopping.  As I walked through the food court attempting to settle in on a dinner option, a Buckhorn Grill employee offered me a sampling of their famed "Char-Grilled Tri-Tip", Wow!  She sucked me in with it's fabulous taste, seasoning and tenderness! I eat a protien-heavy diet so this combined with their house salad was the perfect option for me.  I've experienced a lot of Malls and equally as many steakhouses, however, never before have I enjoyed such a great meal in a Food Court. PS, my girlfriend was drooling over my dish and was more than a little remorseful that she didn't choose Buckhorn too...  Cheers!
author: Brenton W.

description:
My friend got a steak sandwich and is was the size of a 6inch sub from subway..and it cost 10 bucks!!!!  He said he is never going back.


Scrat
author: Fady A.

description:
Great place to chow down in a Mall....Try the  TRi-tip, onion rings and mash potatoes....yummy, don't forget the "Road house Salad"! 

I usually don't eat American grilled food, this place is Great...nice large size portions, just my kind of place...Go there while your X-mas shopping all day long.
author: candice m.

description: It's a well known fact that every place in this food court is expensive. Over the years, I've learned that Buckhorn provides the best bang for your buck if you're looking for a meal under $5.  They give large portions, so if I'm looking for a "medium" portion meal, I opt for the side salad, side items, or kids' meals.  For $4.95, the kids' meals come with 1/2 of a large sandwich, fries, AND a small drink.  I used to order side salads ($3.95) since those were the size of regular salads at most other restaurants. Even though they took it off the menu, they can still make it and charge less if you ask. Oh, and the tri-tip is pretty damn good.
author: Christine N.

description: The food was not good, the service was half-hearted and the food was over-cooked. The sweet potatoe fries were pretty good.
author: Karen R.

description: really loved the little buck. This was delivered to my workplace so no complaints in terms of service.
author: Chas B.

description: I found myself wondering around, killing time, got a little hungry and decided to try Buckhorn Grill. Not bad.... Pretty darn tasty in fact! I couldn't even finish the bacon chicken cheddar sandwich, I almost slipped into a food coma! I definitely recommend but DO bring your appetite!
author: Christina D.

description: Love, love this place  especially for a food court place,.  Have had meals there about three times and the only thing that wasn't fabulous was the fries, which isn't a big deal at all!!  The sandwitches have loads of steak in it,  I had half of a small one, and it was so enough.  It's in a food court, so there are lots of seating options.  All in all very good stuff.
author: Sascha B.

description: I never ate here because their I tried their free samples and it;s similar to catering beef. Just plain beef and fires here.
author: Keit K.

description:
I'm thinking I came on an off day...I got the little buck sandwich with a side of roadhouse onions. The tri tip in the sandwich was wayy too dry and tasteless not to mention tough to chew (the au jus included with the sandwich didn't help much neither), but it was a pretty decent sized sandwich for a "little buck", and the bread was good. As for the side of roadhouse onions, I thought I was getting something similar to onion rings but instead got what looked like a platefull of fried confetti which tasted more like batter n less like onions. 

BUT the samples of tri tip the guy in front gives out were the exact opposite of what I got in my sandwich. Juicy, tender and flavorful, which lured me here in the first place. Maybe they save the best cuts of meats for the samples? They definately reeled me in on that one, and I was the dumb fish that fell for it.
author: Mike A.

description:
The steak at Buckhorn grill is amazing, almost as rich as it seems one must be to eat there on the regular and not suffer a panic attack each time they're forced to reach for the wallet. 

(Of course, I have been told real steak restaurants cost on average about double - so in that way the Buckhorn creates its own feeling of wealth in the customer).

After consuming the delicious value steak, however, I had the intense sensation of having been gored through the stomach. Notably, clutching ones gut and moaning in agony is not the best way to return to work from a lunch break. I'm pretty sure I now understand Buckhorn's chosen name.
author: Stephen M.

description: I got the Mini Tri Tip combo today and it was alright, I love my tri-tip and so being in sf for lunch, i decided to try this place out. The sample lady had tri-tip and it was SOOO savory I opted to get my meal here. A mini tri tip sandwich with au jus , fries & soda was about $10. The fries were great (fries are my weakness), the sandwich came out a bit dry, not as savory as the sample lady's. All in all, I'll have to try this place again to see my final impression of this place
author: Elisa T.

description: I was in San Fran recently. Had tri-tip at the Buck Horn. "NO DOUBT ABOUT IT!" The best tri-tip I ever had. I smoke my own tri-tip and it is pretty good, but I can not compare mine to Buck Horn. Buck Horn is the best! I am going to check to see if there is one in the L.A. area. If there is, they have a new customer.
author: Milan K.

description: I really like the tri-tip steak here, though I feel the free samples they give out are better than the real thing =P Otherwise, its a good portion for a pretty decent price (~$14), too bad the food court is usually overpacked and hard to find a seat in, maybe their nearby outlet at the Metreon is a better idea.
author: Abhinav S.

description: Ok, first off let me say ive been to the original sit-down one in Winters, and I remember that being absolutley delicious! You can imagine my shock and excitment when I found out that there was one in San Francisco (which I go to often) and as well as Walnut Creek (only once) however it wasnt sit down! Wodnerful quality of food in a short amount of time ( I believe some of them have a policy if your food isnt done within 5 minutes of ordering then its free, but I could be mistaken). Delicious and decadent meat! The bacon buckhorn is devine! get it! And dont you dare pass up thier onion shoe strings!
author: Caitlin G.

description: I have never tasted salad this delicious. Try the Cabo Chop Salad!!! OMG. Incredible sauce, fresh salad and the treat of the fried tortilla! I had never tried or heard of fried tortilla before. But this salad is a must eat!!!!
author: J P.

description:
I'm almost embarrased to admit that I dig on Buckhorn.  First off you have to identify it for what it is...glorified fast food a la chipotle.  Once you get your mental groove on regarding what type of food you are eating than the "magic happens".   

Solid portions, good fried onion bits, tasty/flavorful and for the most part tender tri tip(unless you get gristley bits).  Putting it up against other glorified fast food meaty lunches such as Sellars Market steak sammy with two niblets of meat...I'd eat here anytime.
author: Stephen L.

description: This place has the best tri tip ever considering it's food court food. the meat is tender, juicy a bit on the salty side but it's okay! i was get the big buck with fries and a cup of french onion soup. the dipping sauce and the sandwich makes my stomach sing with pleasure. fries are nice and crisp. the french onion is good minus the cheesy bread topper. i will definitely keep coming back when i'm starting to get hungry after a long day of shopping!
author: Lynn P.

description: Nummie Nummie Nummie! salads are sooo good, but better be willing to spend $10-12 on it -YIKES! I also find that if you do go with the tri-tip it tends to be a little fatty, which I don't like any fat on my meat (yes I understand this is weird but people love me any way).
author: Ka C.

description: I come here all the time b/c it's just so tasty, but they always mess up my order.  Usually they put the wrong type of cheese on there, but this time they just forgot the cheese!   Even if it's fast food, they should get my order right.
author: F K.

description: I don't recommend this place - not for the price anyway. You're better off getting high quality meats and mashers at a sit-down restaurant. This place has pink tri-tip that's too rough to chew. That little smidgen of a muffin is not something I'd consider "bread with butter." Very disappointing.
author: J.I. B.

description: I ordered a cabo salad. very yummy! i just LOVE how i can eat the bowl.. which is made out of tortilla. its just better!!!! o man im craving for it. drools
author: Vivian L.

description: I don't normally eat a lot of red meat as I tend to go for chicken or turkey however I do have to say the Roadhouse Burger with blue cheese & onion strings is simply delicious. It may seem kind of plain to some but it really is flavorful. The amount of blue cheese and onion strings compliment eachother well w/o either one being overwhelming.
author: Claresse M.

description: Great tritip. It's always serve medium red, and it feels like it melt in the mouth. i totally recomend it 100%.
author: Samuel L.

description: The guys at Buckhorn are genius for handing out free samples of their amazing tri-tip, because it's probably not a place I would have stopped at in the food court. I usually beeline for the various salad options, or Thai. Tri-tip? Not so much. However, that guy standing there with a huge plate of tri-tip bites won me over when my toothpick stabbed into a four-piece sample that wouldn't pull apart and he encouraged me to just grab the whole meaty mouthful. It was divine. And it worked since I was soon ordering a Caesar Pleaser consisting of 2 slabs of the tri-tip along with a Caesar salad and a roll. It was a Perfect Dinner. Hubby got the Buckhorn sammich with some of those crispy onion things and was very, very happy with it. I'm also a huge fan of their cabo chopped salad - meatless but giant and very satisfying. A solid choice in the king of all mall food courts.
author: margot b.

description: Had the traditional sandwich with fries and onions. Was amazing sandwich. Wish they had better fries. Other then that the steak was juicy and tasty.
author: Eric H.

description:
The girls and I were looking for a quick bite to eat the other night. We were just around the corner from the Westfield Mall, so I suggested the food court there because they have some pretty good options. At 8:30pm, the food court was still very busy, but we didn't have to look around for a table. We passed by a women who was having a giant chicken salad in what looked like a tostada shell. It was large enough for 2 of us to share, so we asked her where she got it from. She directed us to Buckhorn Grill and told us to order the Yik Yak salad. The menu listed the ingredients as: An oriental salad with south of the border flair; a crisp mix of greens, cabbages, jicama, snow peas, water chestnuts, tossed with sweet sesame dressing & topped with toasted almonds. It sounded delicious, so we ordered it and added chopped chicken. For $10, it was the perfect light meal for 2. What we thought was a tostada was actually a tomato flour tortilla, which was good to wrap the salad in. 

Yesterday, I stopped by again and had the Roadhouse Buck sandwich, which is a thick sliced tri-tip sandwich with onions, ranch and bleu cheese for $7. It was a generous portion of steak and fried onion strings were pouring out of the sandwich. The sandwich was just as delicious as the Yik Yak salad, so it seems like most of the items here are pretty good.
author: Connie C.

description: Buckhorn Grill was pretty good.  Placed in a fancy mall, the prices would be expected to be a lil high.  Ordered some type of chicken  salad I believe that me and my gf shared...There was ricotta cheese, walnuts, crispy chicken and some good dressing. "It was yummy" says my gf. I think it cost us around 10 bucks or less. But you get what you pay for.  They also had other foods to choose from.
author: Cedric R.

description:
i had walked by here MANY a times and the samples of the tri tip or steak  was always  DELISH but i wasn't craving it at the time. so i finally broke down and got a "little spike" meal for my son HOLY MOLEY i think no it can feed an adult. they are not chintzy about the meat it was overflowing out of the roll.
 WOW!! it came with fries and a soda all under $5.50 including tax. the only thing i can bad about it is i asked for well done but when i picked up the sandwich half the meat was medium well done with some pink . i just took those pieces out and gave the well done pieces for my son. good flavor of the tri tips especially with the dipping sauce included.:)D
author: Jo K.

description: The Review Highlights can make my review the 17th one to call out the Roadhouse Salad. Delicious! And might I had ENORMOUS! I used to eat salads every day at the Goog and since working in the city, my diet has gone down the crapper. In attempt to get back on the salad wagon, my eyes lit up with I saw how gigantic the Roadhouse was. Full of nutritious lettuce, blue cheese, tomatoes, and added grilled chicken, my body felt alive again! My friend had the Spring Salad, which also looked good but didn't compare in sheer size. I might give it a go some time if I can get unhooked from the Roadhouse.
author: Susan L.

description: I was VERY impressed with the quality here.  Considering it's mall food... it tastes reallllly good.   My mixed feeling on this place  is that I'm glad it's in SF so that I'm not visiting it very often, yet I wish Valley Fair had one so I could eat here all the time !!!!
author: Laurin A.

description:
dead animals.....*drool*

tri-tip is freakinfantastical.  

also, all the salads are a blessing to the salad kingdom. 

negate one star for $10 dollar salads....seriously, highway robbery for road kill on leaves.
author: Christina S.

description: Since I don't fancy hotdogs and popcorn at the movies, I've taken to bringing in a veggie salad from the Buckhorn Grill.  By "taken to" I mean I just did it once and thought it was a good idea.  Plus the salad was really, really, really good.  The next time I went back I got fries with the salad and a side of onion rings.  I was glad I had someone to share all of that with, b/c it was a huge amount of food.  They give you a ton of those onions, which are really greasy, and not so fabulous- good that they were cheap.
author: CAKE E.

description: Talk about some darn good tri-tip at darn good prices.  Awesome food.  I'm even thinking about buying a take home tip for my next pow wow.
author: Marcolm A.

description: Wow I looooove the mixed spring salad with tri tip. MMMmmm! It makes you feel very refreshed and the fruits in it were all great tasting. The trip was very tender and made perfectly medium rare and very well seasoned. I have yet to try any other dish here because every time I come I can't resist the mixed greens. For an eatery in this area the price was amazingly decent with all the other places being fairly expensive. Totally recommend it!
author: Dang L.

description: 2nd time there.  Had a tri-tip sandwich with a side salad.  Totally satisfying.  I'm sold!  Delish!
author: M R.

description: So many choices to choose from when coming to this food court. A friend of ours suggested Buckhorn Grill for some tri-tip. My bf and I couldn't resist. The line seemed so long, but their menu looked so great.. we didn't mind. The service here is fast the line moved rather quickly...we ordered the Roadhouse Salad to share, the salads are huge!! I don't think one person can finish it, its stacked piled high.. the roadhouse salad had a nice vinaigrette, so tasty and it was piled high with their roadhouse onions.. I ordered a small plate of their char-roasted sirloin tri-tip with au jus and hore radish ssauce on the side.. it was a perfect size for me, I finished it all.. and I must say it was soo delish, the tri tip was nice and tender and really went well with horseradish sauce..(i love horse radish sauce!!! My mouth is just watering right now as I think about their tri-tip.) My bf ordered the same altho the larger portion, which comes with mash potatoes, veggies, bread, and of course tri-tip, and our friend ordered the same. We were in the very pleased with our food, so tasty and fulfilling!! I just found my new fav. spot at the food court!! Drinks here are free refill so that is a major plus! Altho the lines here look long, I must say service is quick! Right when we found our table the little beeper went off to pick up our food. I love Buckhorn Grill!
author: karenina c.

description: I tried the bacon cheddar buck and it was good but small. I have a big tummy and I was not full for what I had paid for, for the sandwich. But along with a large order of fries, I was satisfied. The sandwich had lots of tri tip and really cheesy with 3 slices of Apple-wood smoked bacon. YUM-MO! The fries were piping hot and crispy!
author: Juliane N.

description: Good lunch spot in the SF centre! I had the cabo salad with grilled chicken. The portions were huge! Inside a large tostada shell were tons of lettuce with black beans, jicama, corn, radishes, tomatoes, blue cheese, and half of a sliced avocado. You can add any type of meat you want. The grilled chicken was really good. My friend had the little buck sandwich (sirloin beef) with fries. That looked good too.
author: Denise L.

description: The big buck is good, great fresh bread and tender meat. Onion rings though could've been great, but instead weren't so crispy and were cold. For a moment I thought I was back in the midwest due to the gigantic portions (not that thats a bad thing)...
author: Nicolas H.

description: Got the Big Buck... tri-tip w/ au jus sandwich. Meaty! Breaddy! GOOD!
author: qirk z.

description: Wow...the lady asked me if I wanted to try their sample and I was hooked for one tri tip sandwich with carmelized onions. It seemed as if it was mainly men ordering, but it was really yummy and the customer in front of me helped me figure out which was the water button and he was kind enough to push it for me while I held the plastic cup...Five stars for that hunky guy with the tats and the sweet chivalry.
author: miriam b.

description: I ordered the roasted tri-tip small plate today because I remember their steak being really good. When I got my plate, I had thought they made some sort of mistake! I was thinking, NO WAY would a small plate have 7 or 8 slices of decent sized slices of steak cooked a perfect medium (most of the slices at least)! There were also some sort of onion rings and 2 sauces. It definitely looked like a big plate that would've cost $15 (even at a food court place like this) instead of under $9. My only complaint is that because it was roasted, the outer part was hard and somewhat difficult to chew without hurting your mouth. But the center was cooked to tender perfection.
author: Elaine H.

description: My salad was good... until i found a caterpillar (alive!) in it!  All is said ...
author: Billie L.

description: Yeah this place is a chain but who cares.  Oh wait chains are bad.   Hisss.  The meat here is decent.  The meat has never been tough when I have eaten here.
