I usually order the big buck because I am obviously big.  The onion rings and bleu cheese on it looks good but I already have bleu cheese thighs.  I tried ordering a sprite with my combo but the lady at the counter said they don't have sprite.  She then proceeded to give me a blank stare.  So I glance at the soda fouintain behind her and said ok I will have a Sierra Mist.  She said ok.  WTF?  There is no god damn difference you wretched tard.  Its ok lady.  One of these days you will get promoted to fries.  Ridiculous.
author: Fatty A.

description: Giving out samples of this meat is the best thing they could do. Definitely not a big steak eater, but that tender juicy tri-tip brought out the carnivore in me.
author: Stevonne R.

description:
Im a little cheesy...yes I gave a restaurant in the mall food court a 5! Buckhorn Grill is almost perfect. I've never had a bad meal here, and other than Sorabol (also in the mall) it is one of the only places that I actually crave! What I like most is that it has that restaurant dining feel but it's super fast and can be carried out, taken home and devoured!

I get the tri tip and chicken combo everytime. Unfortunately that, plus a drink adds up to a litle over $17 but it's well worth the dinero. Anyways, the chicken is sometimes dry,but that's nothing a little bbq sauce can't clear up, the tri tip is perfect everytime, id come here JUST for the vegetables, they are so delicious!, the mashed potatoes, equally tasty and even the bread does its job of being amazing. 

Overall, I ate at the Buckhorn a few nights ago, as well as last week, and am starting to get a taste for tri tip as I finish up this review. If you're in the food court, or near the mall at all and are looking for a quick, but very good, bite to eat, Buckhorn is your place.
author: Sarah I.

description: Had the Yik Yak salad and it was HUGE! Shared it with bf who ordered a pizza from neighboring outlet. There was a lil too much salad dressing but overall a great sesame taste and salad was fresh and great for sharing.
author: Yan M.

description: The tri-tip sandwich here is so so so good, and the roadhouse onions are also amazing. Sometimes, I wish I could drink the au-jus. So good.
author: Samantha W.

description: I was starving at SF Center yesterday. I hate that mall and the food court was insanely crowded but for 15 minutes of my life everything was moving in slow motion, and the noise seemed to stop as I ate my Roadhouse Buck Sandwich. A sweet french roll piled generously high with tri-tip steak, super thin and crunchy onion rings, bleu cheese, and some special sauce. I was full after 1/3 of it but I ate every last buite and practically licked the plate. OMG that thing was freaking good. Best sandwich ever.
author: Emily W.

description: Damn.  The girl working the counter here must be one of the friendliest service industry workers in San Francisco.  How refreshing!  Three cheers for the enormous salads.  I love the Roadhouse salad.
author: Poker B.

description: The TRI-TIP STEAK WAS A+. Perfect flavoring, perfect medium rare. Sit back and cut your tri-tip in a million pieces so you can savor and enjoy it. Then head back to shopping. =]
author: Jonathan L.

description: The food here is really good. I ordered the Krispy Chicken salad.. It was really tasty. The Chicken was ready crispy, they had avocado on top of the salad! The blue cheese was really good. The salad wasn't over dressed like most places do, especially for a food court. The only downside is that it's pretty expensive, but it's all good, you get what you pay for, and that's what i got.
author: Brian P.

description: As I'm not a big meat eater Buckhorns is not my typical choice for lunch.  Like most, it was the sample tri-tip that hooked me in.   I ordered the small buckhorn plate which consisted of 8 ounces of thick tri-tip pieces over a generous portion of the onion rings.  The tri-tip is delicious, especially with some horseradish and so are the onion rings but I must admit that for me the mystery was pretty much gone after that first sample bite.  I found the full order to be too much and found myself staring longingly at the big bowls of noodle soup that others were eating around me.  But that's just me.  It's probably not something I'd eat on a regular basis but when I'm in the mood for some tasty beef, I'll be sure to come back.
author: mia s.

description: This is crack, period. I usually get my fix from the samples. Too much at once doesn't make it as appealing.
author: Wanda K.

description: The service here leave a lot to be desired.  Once I got the salad that I had asked for with meat.  When I told the girl behind the counter that I was a vegetarian and wanted a salad without meat, she just opened my container and took the meat out with her hands.  Not the most appetizing.    However, I am a glutton for punishment and can never find a good salad, so I keep going back.  There is a southwestern salad here that is very good and that I definitely recommend.
author: Joanna S.

description: SAMPLES!! That's what got me to order from them. The meat was oh so good that I decided to order a tritip entree for myself. Good marketing tool! Their tri-tip is nice and tender with a light, delicious seasoning. The system is pretty fast and they give you the buzzer thing to let you know when your food is ready to be devoured. I also tried their philly style sandwich and it was excellent with the bell peppers & mushrooms. Carnivore heaven!
author: Linda C.

description: This place makes one mean salad with tri tip steak. I was in love with it. I got some sort of fruit salad (lettuce, not "fruit salad"), hold the nuts, with tri tip and the dressing that goes with it. Really good stuff. The only thing is that I started to get more and more pieces of fat on my steak, so the glow that this salad used to have in my mind's eye is a little tainted.
author: Clare R.

description: this place rules tri tip, perfectly cooked, juicy, ahhhhhhhhh.... and their chicken is awesome too. If my plate never ran out of their fried onions I would literally never stop eating them.
author: Ryan C.

description: The tri-tip salad is fantastic, and while it is a little pricey, it's huge, ample for sharing.  Definitely recommend Buckhorn for a quality salad.
author: Cory J.

description: Not fine dining i the Food Court in the basement of Bloomingdales BUT had excellent Tri-Tip steak with all the trimmings for an unbelievable price and very quick.
author: Lee S.

description: I tried their sample of beef, which was tender and flavorful. I split an order of 3 chicken tenders as a snack. WAY too much batter, and too little chicken. Felt like kinda a rip off for $5, but the wasabi-infused ranch dipping sauce was interesting.
author: Joy C.

description: I went with the Philly Buck.  It was good.  This place is a solid place if you are ever looking for a good hearty lunch.  Fast service also.  I would go again.  The bread used on the sandwiches is a great combo with the tri-tip.
author: Aaron T.

description: Great sandwiches, no matter how hungry i am a little buck combo does the trick - the big buck is a little too big for me.  Last time I went though, the guy offered three rounds of free samples to everybody in the line - except for me, skipped over me each time :(  why don't they like me?
author: Greg M.

description: I went to eat here with some friends after we ran around the city for the Chinese New Year Treasure Hunt.  I loved it.  I was walking around looking at all of the places to eat and I felt like a steak salad type of meal and here was Buckhorn Grill ready to please.  I got a salad with tri-tip steak that had some fresh and dried fruits in it.  I forget the name of the salad and I don't see it on their online menu, but it was friggin delicious.  Sure.. maybe I was tired from running around all day.  Maybe I was really in the mood for a steak salad.  Then again, maybe it was just friggin delicious!!  Oh, and for those that care, cost-wise It was about $11 and some change for the salad.
author: John K.

description: This is one of those restaurants that make me want to order onion rings. Dip the onion rings in ranch sauce and pop a slice of tri tip in your mouth and voila! Instant goodness! I love it.
author: Michelle B.

description:
is this gross that i crave this stuff?

i miss good tri-tip.
love the roadhouse buck...broke down and got the cheddar & bacon one...they use delicious bacon...that was crazy good too.
i love the fried onions & the mashed potatoes too!
i am the girl sitting in the corner that needs to be rolled out of the food court. :)
author: Tiger Lily ..

description: This is a gem in westfield mall's food court. I usually get the platters with tri tip and two sides. The tri tip has always been incredibly juicy. The grilled veggies are always fresh and crisp, and the mashed potatoes are whipped to perfection. I think the platters are reasonably priced, considering that the ingredients are high of quality.
author: Carmen L.

description: Food was great but does it really take 15 minutes to get a chicken salad. However, at least we know they grill the chicken to order or maybe they ran out. In any case, the prices are a bit high.
author: S L.

description: Was around Powell street area in the morning, haven't had breakfast yet. Head over to westfield, walk up to buckhorn at 10:30am, guy setting up, says we aren't open until 11am, where every other food establishment in the emporium food center is serving. Then walked around to check out what else is available. Notice from the distance there's people in line at buckhorn, glance at time it's 10:50am, walk back and picked up the roadhouse salad with tri tip because of the reviews. It went for $11, and hands down was a very fulfilling meal, 4 people can share one order. Will come back again and try the other salads.
author: Robin L.

description: I'll venture out there and give this place 5 stars.  Yes, it's in a food court.  Yes, it's a chain.  And yes, it's spendy for food served on a trey.  But so what?  It's all about the tri tip!  Order a sandwich, add some fries, grab a bottle of bbq sauce, and just smother it all in sticky sweet mesquite goodness.  I love this place.  Definitely one of my goto joints when I'm in the Union Square area.
author: Tony L.

description: Simple menu, simple sandwiches, reliable, always good, not too expensive for a good tri tip sandwich.  Nice that they are in SF Center close to my office!  Love it!
author: Ron T.

description: I eat here quite often and I really like it. The chickenshroom sandwich is excellent as well as their grilled salmon, chicken plate, and fries. My boyfriend absolutely loves the tri-tip but I haven't tried it because I stopped eating beef. Also, they have the tri-tip to go in a family size for $20 which honestly is a steal when you compare it to the individual dishes. All in all, I'll most definitely be back again.....and again....
author: Diane M.

description:
During my first visit to this place, I was stopped by a lady sticking out a sample of tri tip right in front of me. Free sample is a plus already for me! I like to try before I buy. Mmmm, it's tender! I've tried the Little Buck Combo: 4 oz. thinly sliced tri tip on a french roll with caramelized onions, side of Roadhouse Onions (you can choose among other sides), and a soda for $6.75 + $2.45 for combo. Sorry, I still think Firestone's tri tip sandwich in SLO surpasses this place. I like sauces and dipping my sandwich in extra sauce. Their bbq sauce is just the average kind you can get from grocery stores. 

My personal favorite at this place are their salads. The Roadhouse Salad is pretty good (Mixed greens with crispy Roadhouse onions, string beans, tomatoes, bleu cheese crumbles & sweet walnuts tossed w/ honey basil vinaigrette). I usually add on tri tip for $6.95 + $2.50 for tri tip) I personally think the honey basil vinaigrette tastes weird in this salad. I found a new love at this place that always makes me come back...
The Yik Yak salad with grilled chicken or tri tip. A miix of greens, cabbages, jicama, red peppers, snow peas, tossed with sweet sesame dressing (there is a little spice to it!) & topped with toasted almonds all inside a tortilla wrap in a bowl ($6.95 + $2.50 for tri tip or chicken). They give you really good portions, I can usually only finish half. I would seriously just give this place 3 stars for everything else, but I give 1 extra star for the Yik Yak, Yeaauh! It's what keeps me coming back to eat at this place whenever I come to this food court.
author: Tracy T.

description:
the buckhorn grill at the sf shopping center leaves room for improvement.  i ordered the portobella mushroom sandwich, which was pretty good, except for the fact that the roll it came on was boring and sad.  they could use a nice whole wheat roll or something.

the something-basil dressing was delicious, even though their side garden salad was also BORING!  lettuce and tomatoes and croutons were the feature attractions.

but i must say, the tri-tip looked amazing!!  these people sitting next to me had ordered what i assumed was a combo plate: juicy medium rare tri-tip, mashed potatoes with gravy, and grilled veggies.
author: Michelle W.

description: Having grown up vegetarian and slowly "trained" to eat meat, I've definitely become picky about where the grub comes from.  Buckhorn Grill, nestled in the pimp food court of the SF Centre, certainly meets my expectations.  Well cooked, perfectly flavored, & well presented.  My chipotle steak sandwich was amazing, and the balance of the sweet/spicy chipotle sauce with the savory goodness of sirloin was incredible!  Price is better than most of the other places here, at about $7 per sandwich.  Can't wait to go back and try their salads!
author: Maulie D.

description: Grilled salmon is delicious. Choice of wild or farmed. I got the "side" which was pretty big - 2 ~6oz pieces of salmon. About 9 bucks. A bit pricey for a fancy food court, but it's great to have a healthy option. I don't mind paying more for good quality and healthy food, I guess. The steak sandwich my friend got was supposedly delicious.
author: Maren P.

description: I've eaten here frankly more times than I care to admit. It's rich, filling comfort food and because it's a chain, you get the same thing done the same way every time. I always order the charbroiled chicken sandwich combo. The bread is quite mediocre, the chicken better, and the mashed potatoes heaven. Seriously, they have mastered the art of red mashed potatoes, replete with the very crucial skin bits. It's a generous portion, too, but they wayyy skimped on gravy the last time I was there and that made me sad. : (
author: Ada T.

description:
I first tried the famous tri-tip steak through the free samples they pass out in front of their kiosk at the mall. it was sooooooo good. 

I'm not a red-meat kind of person, but the steak really melts in your mouth yet is not too greasy. I haven't tried the sandwiches, but I really like the garden salad with the honey lime dressing with added tri-tip. The salad itself doesn't come with steak, but you can add some on for 2.50. The lime dressing is light but flavourful and the steak soaks up the dressing and goes perfectly with the fresh lettuce, cherry tomatoes, radish, cucumber and croutons. The salad is huge! I ask for an extra take out container so that I can split that meal into two. I would have to say that this is one of my favourite meals in the westfield food court.
author: Florence T.

description: I had the Yik Yak Salad. It was so good! Fresh veggies, nice dressing and the almonds give it the perfect crunch. They give alot! It could easily be split into two portions, however I ate the whole thing! Hmmmm. I'll definately be getting this again. Maybe next time I'll add salmon or chicken for just a couple dollars more. WORTH IT!
author: Katherine C.

description: yum, my favorite restaurant in the food court (although almost everything here is amazing). This is probably the best food court I've ever been to. I tried some of their tri-tip (samples!!) and was hooked, I come in for a sandwich + crispy onions whenever I'm in norcal.
author: Angela S.

description: Me and the girlfriend were looking wandering around the food court trying to find a place to eat, but after sampling a piece of the tri-tip, we wanted more.  We ended up getting a tri-tip dad's cut which was 10oz of beef that came with mashed potatoes, fire roasted veggies and bread.  It was a huge portion and we both split it.  We also had a order of their large fries.  The food was delicious because it really was delicious or we were just really hungry from so much walking around in the city.  The food came out decently fast and you can help yourself to condiments.  The only negative....the ranch which I use for french fries was watered down.  I would for sure come back here again if I am in the area and feeling for some beef!
author: James T.

description: damn, it's literally as if somebody created the restaurant of my dreams! i often get cravings for BBQ on salad -- i'm on a low carb kick -- and this place is it. Initially lured by the delicious tri tip samples, I decided to order the fruit and nut salad with honey lime dressing and blue cheese sprinkles with tri-tip. it was fantastic; the salad contained sliced strawberries, apples, and bits of dried apricots and plenty of finely sliced beef. Please open up a location in LA!
author: melinda j.

description: Really tasty steak sandwiches and onion strings, but kinda expensive for a lunch at the mall. The Little Buck-- (smaller version of their regular steak sandwich) was really good and tasty along with their deeply fried onion strings, although they were quite greasy. I would come here again if I were really craving a good steak sandwich, but wouldn't get too big a meal because it will get pricey..about $7 for a sandwich
author: Jessica h.

description: Love, love, love the Sirloin Tri Tip.  It rocks my world!!!!!!
author: Wel C.

description: This place is great for a tri-tip sandwich or salad.  Yummy!  They are a little on the expensive side, but what restaurant isn't expensive in San Francisco?  Also, there is not a lot of sitting in the restaurant itself.  Bring the Tums!
author: Aimee L.

description: I ordered their tri-tip and it was so so. A bit on the salty side, actually a little too salty.. the mashed potatoes were okay but they covered it with lots of thick gravy. The grilled veggies were good. I shared some with my bf ... he liked the veggies. I had some of his chicken.. its rather dry and tasteless. Yuck!
author: Linda X.

description: You certainly get bang for your buck with the small plate sirloin - it's $8.79 (remember, this is steak!) after tax and it is nearly enough for two, leaving room for dessert.  You shouldn't eat grilled or fried foods too often, but Buckhorn every now and then is a sure treat!
author: Michelle M.

description: Ok here's the deal.  I'm a big dude and I'm a meat and potatoes kinda guy but when I'm ordering a "salad" for a meal you know it has to be grubbin!  I only order the BIG ASS road house salad with tri-tip.  Its tossed in a nice subtle vinaigrette and served with a big mound of fried onion straws.  I actually cant finish this salad as its so massive.  The price is reasonable too!  It was $6.95 for the salad itself and an additional $3 for the tri-tip.  The tri-tip is very flavorful and succulent.  Its cooked correctly to a medium rare and really compliments the vinaigrette.  Their counter help was really polite and provided great service.  This is always a sure stop for me when I'm at the SF mall.
author: Henry S.

description:
I'm trying out all the lunch places in the shopping center now that I'm working in the neighborhood (lucky for me, the office will soon move and hopefully there will be decent food in the new neighborhood).

I got the crispy chicken sandwich combo (with fries).  And unfortunately it didn't taste good.  The chichen was plastic-y, the fries were soft and I absolutely hated the 'buckhorn sauce' they insist on putting on top of everything they make.
author: Marijke D.

description: Food is great here.  Much more than what you would expect from a mall restaurant.  The beef is so good.  I usually get the sandwich with the onion strings and blue cheese...sooo good.  They give big portions too.  I don't think you can wrong with any of the choices on the menu; however, spending over $12 for a salad to go is a bit much more me.  So I limit myself to only a couple times a month here.  I still recommend it though if you're looking for a quick bite.
author: Jonathan T.

description: Ive had the Roadhouse salad a few times, substitute ranch dressing instead of the honey vinaigrette and its currently my favorite salad.  Huge portions.
author: Tina L.

description: I absolutely crave the Cabo Chopped Salad with tri-tip.  The dressing is amazing - sweet and creamy.  It's huge.  Great toppings (grape tomatoes, black beans, jicama, avocado, cheese, corn).  I substitute parmesan in for the other cheese (blue cheese I think).  I live in South Bay and sheepishly admit that I will come to the city on occasion primarily to have this salad.
author: Michelle F.

description: Yay! I'm A Fan! I love coming here for the ROADHOUSE BUCK!! Again I love bleu cheese not by itself, Yuck! but with the beef and the addition of crispy onions with mashed potatoes makes for a hearty dinner or lunch. This is a chain restaurant that does pretty well. The service is ordinary but the food is good!   The food would be better if the food was served a little hotter but notheless the food still tastes great and service could be little more friendly! Still I give this 4 stars as I will always comeback for The RoadHouse Buck $6.95 cant beat that. MMmm Bleu cheese and beef.
author: Daryl A.

description: Came here for lunch and  had a sample of their tri tip which was very good. I got the sirloin platter which you get two good size hunk of meat. It was a bit cold and chewy though, so I was disappointed. The mashed taters were very good. The veggies were pretty average I thought, but pretty good size of it. The platter was a bit pricey.
author: Leon C.

description: I used to work in the SF Centre and Buckhorn Grill has the best food in the mall (other than Out the Door).  Their Big Buck tri tip sirloin and side of red mash potatoes are the bomb!  If youre in the mood of a good meat xwich, come here! Yummmy! Panda was happy!
author: Steven L.

description: I had the salmon platter with mashed potatoes. Aside from the salmon cut being pretty thin and my lunch heading near $20.00 I though it was phenomenal for food court fare!
author: Carolyn P.

description: Their steak sandwiches were surprisingly delicious. I usually don't like red meat. But, as a cheap asian, I had to try their free samples and was drawn in. I have to say that it was a bit pricey for a simple sandwich, i was expecting fries along with it or something.
author: Bridge H.

description: I tried this place twice. Once I got a salmon burger- it was kinda plain and didn't seem to fit together well. Second time I got teh salad with the fried onions. I like the fried-caramelized onions at Neecha Thai..the ones in the grapefruit salad...better. Maybe I just like red onions better, but the salad was just alright...
author: anocha s.

description: Great place to eat while out shopping.  Delicious, fresh food!  The portions are huge!  My husband and I could have shared one plate.  Expect a busy setting as it is on the bottom level of the Westfield shopping center.
author: Lindsey K.

description: I used to eat here pretty regularly when I worked in the mall. The food here is great but a little pricey, however you do get what you pay for. The grilled chicken and mashed potatoes are my favorite. The only drawbacks are that sometimes the lines are super long and since they make your food as soon as you order it, they can be a bit slow in serving, sometimes even making me late coming back from lunch. It's worth the wait, but I would recommend that you only come here when you're not on a lunch break.
author: Starr R.

description: I have been here a few times while shopping and have liked it every time. I got the little Bucky or something which is the kids tri-tip sandwich and fries and drink for like $5. Not bad!! I even switched out the fries and got a Cesar salad (better deal) and that was tasty too. Perhaps if I were really hungry that wouldn't satisfy my hunger but luckily I haven't been too hungry when I go there. Minus one star because last time my meat was kinda fatty and so was my husbands. I brought his up though and said, This is kinda fatty. That's all it took and boom they gave me a big, thick new slice for him. That was good. Ok maybe I should give them their minus one star back for that? hehe :) If you are shopping this place is so much better than the usual mall food. Definitely try it if you are here! :)
author: Elizabeth H.

description: Wow, I did not expect such good steak from this place. I ordered the tri-tip with a side of mashed potatoes, the mashed potatoes were fresh and delicious. The meal just melted in my mouth, the steak was juicy and well cooked and was very tender and good. I'm definitely going back next time I am shopping around that area!
author: Sina H.

description: I was in the food court of the San Francisco shopping center and trying to decide what to get.  There was someone in front of Buckhorn passing out samples of their tri tip; the moment I ate the sample, I got right in line.  I ordered the tri tip sandwich and some fries.  The tri tip was so moist and juicy.  The au jus that came with the sandwich further enhanced the flavor of the meat.  Hands down the best tri tip sandwich I have eaten.  I could of eaten another one.
author: Raymond K.

description: had the 6 oz tri-tip sandwich with onion rings and ranch dressing on the side. the meat was smokey and flavorful. the aus jus sogged the bread just right. onion rings were thin and crispy
author: Kris B.

description: I ordered a burger from this place for 6 dollars and it tasted ok, nothing special. In n Out burgers are 2 times better for less than half the cost though. This would've gotten 3 stars but the guy who took my order looked mean and unwelcoming. On top of that, I ordered a salad for my friend and I thought it'd be over 15 dollars so i gave him a 10 and 2 fives. When I realized it came out to only 14 something, I wanted to ask for one back but he started talking to the lady next to him and then for some reason he gave that lady one of the fives I handed him and then gave me back a couple cents in change. I told him I gave him 20 dollars and then he looked really annoyed and somehow got it in his head that the five he gave that lady was hers? He asked that lady and she was like i dunno why you gave it to me so then he gave it back with this rude attitude like it was all my fault. On the up side, my friend's salad which was 7 dollars was pretty big and she said it tasted good. I won't be coming back though.
author: Stephanie K.

description: i tried the buckhorn grill located at the new bloomingdales last night. they were packed.  i ordered a sandwich but i can't remember the name.  it is tri-tip with blue cheese. it was really good.  cost about 7plus some cents.  it came with 2 slices of tri-tip, fried onion strings, and blue cheese.  i did not order a drink nor did i add fries.  i really like hot sandwiches so i recommend this one.  it is messy though.  i think it would've cost about 10-11 bucks if i was to add a drink and fries.  after you order, they give you the buzzer.  it took about 5-10  minutes.  they were super busy and it was 6:30pm and they were closing at 7.  but they took everyone.  can't wait for 'wich craft to open.  i love yummy sandwiches
author: D W.

description: My tastebuds cheer, atlhough my arteries are a bit skeptical. I love their salads (huge and certainly large enough to share as a meal!) and their grilled steak sandwiches are divine! Great quality for a food court meal.
author: Michael H.

description: i got their chicken salad and their onion things. came out to around 10 bucks. the onion things were GOOD! the salad was... blah... i didnt get any of their fancy schmancy things though. i would give it an extra half a star because the guy there gave me an employee discount (which was like a dollar. woohoo!) pretty expensive, would probably just get the onion things next time.
author: Lillian P.

description: All very good, but I feel like I'm gonna get a heart attack every time I eat here. BEEFY.... with some greasy deep fried onion strings. Real heavy. Okay fine, the salads aren't that heavy, but close. Don't get me wrong, it's damn good.... I just can't eat too much of it. Half a sandwich or just some of that tri-tip salad they have is good enough for me.
author: Haim C.

description: The sandwiches are absolutely delicious. The meat is tender and tasty and the bread is fresh. The au jus dipping sauce is awesome but it's easy to make a mess of the table or your lap.
author: Estevan M.

description: their sandwiches are tasty, but the last time i ordered, they didn't bother buzzing the beeper so the pinche sandwich just sat there on the line... until i realized that it had taken quite a while and went up to check on my order...
author: charlotte s.

description: i ordered the bacon cheddar buck sandwhich and it was delish! the mashed potatos were seasoned perfectly and i like how they leave potato skin bits in it. i dinged a star off because it took awhile to make
author: Kiyoshi K.

description: I always like to have the Yik Yak or the Cabo Chop salad when I go to Buckhorn Grill.  They are my favitores.
author: Minna S.

description: Best place to eat in the mall!  Good quality food--you get what you pay for!!!
author: Jo M.

description: the cheddar chicken smoked bacon sandwich is amazzing!!
author: N. M.

description: the tri-tip is where it's at.  they have a secret deal called the "ray-buck" thats not on the menu, but ask for it.  also, and trust me on this one, trade out the cheddar cheese for blue cheese.  they flash broil it under intense heat until it a creamy melted dream and gets inside the tri-tip...it's ridiculous.  get a side of au jus to dip it in, and you're flying high, my friend.
author: Jason B.

description: Proof that you can use a potentially negative encounter and turn it into a postive one. I  went to the Buckhorn Grill prepared to try their Ultimate Veggie Sandwich, but when I placed my order, they told me that it would not be ready for another 15 minutes. I panicked because I didn't know what else to order. Hard to make decisions like that on the spot--and the line of people waiting behind me only added to the pressure. I was thinking of leaving for another place, but the person made me feel better by saying "Take your time". I eventually ordered the Roadhouse salad just because I had heard my friend order it--had no idea what I was ordering--just wanted to get some food and find a place to sit. Anyway, he ended up giving me a 70 cents off my order and a free drink for the inconvenience. That was smart customer service. 70 cents is not too much money, but the fact that he apologized and made an effort to correct the situation was impressive. The salad was huge and had onion rings on top. It was decent, but the dressing was a little sweeter than what I'm used to.  I am writing more to comment on their customer service. Small gesture, but I am spreading the word and if I get a chance, will likely go back again.
author: Emm S.

description: this place has the best tri tip, i wouldnt go to the one at embarcadero, that one is nasty buit this one is great. expensive bu worth it. the salad is very fulfilling.
author: Cassandra c.
